review_content: Nie smakowało mi bardzo, śmierdzi, wygląda jak siku, a w smaku gorzko-kwaśna woda.
Aroma 5. Appearance 2. Taste 5. Palate 2. Overall 9. Malt and grass aroma. Grain taste, a hint of bitterness.
0.45l bottle from Chisinau. Light gold colour almost without head aroma  corn and coffe. Taste light and wattery. This is not beer this is watter

Color dorado transparente con espuma medio-alta blanca de retención media y residuo escaso. Aroma a cereal y minerales con notas a maíz. Sabor a maíz y malta con notas a minerales y lúpulos nobles. Dulzor, alcohol y amargor medio-ligeros con regusto corto. Textura acuosa, cuerpo medio-ligero y carbonatación media.
Old Untappd checkin, January 17, 2016. Rich golden color with a moderate head, clear appearance. Decently full-bodied flavor. One of the better European macro lagers for my money.

330ml bottle. Pours a bright clear gold with a white head. Nice hoppy pils smells with malty ness underneath. Slightly watery presentation of classic pils flavors balanced well but overall it lacks conviction. Weak bodied with a fizzy mouthfeel and short dry finish without the traditional bite.

Clear gold pour, ring of a head.  Nose is roasted grain.  Middle is medium roasted grain, some hoppy bitterness, an almost butterscotch hint.  Finish is malty with a light herbal hoppiness.  Not quite a pilsner for me.
Ok Pilsner, rather easy to drink many of them. Good shape of bottle and appearance
Delikatny lager aczkolwiek kieedyś smakiem bardziej przekonywał niż teraz.
Or pale, limpide, fine mousse blanche très abondante. Arômes: fleur, herbe, agrume, miel. Bonne acidité et amertume. Recette légèrement trop sucrée.

Dose 0,33l (as "Carlsberg Premium Lager Beer", ABV: 5.0%): Golden, glasklar, kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; kräftig malzige + leicht fruchtige Nase, leichte Zitrusnoten, leichte fruchtige Säure, dezente eher trockene Hopfennoten, malzige Süße, Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, sehr mild, dezente malzige Bitterkeit; frischer + leicht fruchtiger Körper, leichte trockene Zitrusnoten, eher milde Hopfennoten, Malz, Getreide, spritzig, deutliche Kohlensäure; leichter malziger Nachgang

Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień w celu uzupełnienia profilu na RateBeer. Degustacja odbyła się jakiś czas temu.
Instagram/czgr_
Lättdrucken fast ända full i kropp och smak. Perfekt för sena sommarkvällar.

0,33 l
Slabo.. ugodna aroma bilja, ali sve ostalo ispodprosječno.. boja bljedunjava, pjena slaba, okus vrlo vodenkast, bez odlika..

Found out of can from a zabka in Rybnik, Poland. Pours the standard straw yellow/light gold with medium white light foam.  For the style i would say it is actually slightly above average when compared to similar priced ones. Still mainly a quantity beer on a hot summer day.
Nie smakowało mi bardzo, śmierdzi, wygląda jak siku, a w smaku gorzko-kwaśna woda.
Aroma 5. Appearance 2. Taste 5. Palate 2. Overall 9. Malt and grass aroma. Grain taste, a hint of bitterness.

Pours a clear straw yellow with a small white head. Semi sweet grainy aroma. Crisp and clean with a lightly sweet grainy flavor and no bitterness. Light lingering aftertaste. Drinkable but nothing special.

Bouteille.
Robe dorée, limpide, scintillante, effervescence active.
Fine mousse blanche. Tenue de mousse éphémère.
Arômes: presque négligeable, soupçon céréales et herbacé.
Saveurs: équilibré avec des notes similaires aux arômes et une amertume négligeable en finale.
Texture: corps mince, carbonation moyenne, bonne buvabilité.
Caractère pauvre.
Beer for a good time. The taste is very hoppy and best drank from a tap! My go-to beer in Malaysia.

320 ml can presumably from a supermarket; seasonal Year of the Ox skin brewed in Malaysia. Pours golden with a large white head; not much on the nose, just a little noble hops and perhaps a bit of malt. Taste is quite empty with just a bit of noble hops. Quite watery as well. Would have been nice on a 35 degree hot day but otherwise no.
Pours golden with large head . Smells of strong hops. Highly carbonate with loads of bubbles. Metal after taste. Average main stream lager

Light and refreshing beer, has mild head and clear yellow color with fast rising bubbles, pours slight bitterness and aromas from hops, the malt has little sweetness on it and feels watery. A good beer to enjoy on a hot day

Ok. Probably not the best beer in the word as those ads say. That marketing team probably went to Waikato University. Kronenbourg is the better of the Burgs in my opinion but not as good as that iceburg that struck the Titanic right... Sorry that disaster probably goes down as bad as this beer review. I’m Drunk sorry.
Flasche 50cl @ Wismar Germany mit 5.0 ABV. Extrem flaches Gebräu, dem selbst das Grünglas keine geschmacklichen Veränderungen mehr beibringen kann. Respekt vor so viel Belanglosigkeit.
Bread and pepper on the nose.  Nice gold color with a thick white head.  Semi sweet malt up front.  Sweet bread followed by pepper and earthy bitterness.  Watery mouth feel.

Aust version brewed by Coopers. Nose- horrible, thought it could be off tbh before tasting. Thin head, colour white wine. Tastes okay though, like beer, no nasties, light body, inoffensive mouthfeel. Nice bitterness on finish the high point. Sessionable, let down by the aroma and appearance but not a deal breaker. Would grab these instead of mainstream aussie lager, just.

Carlsberg Danish Pilsner from Denmark🇩🇰 , 3.8%VOL , 9.6°OG  #carlsberg #craftbeer #denmark #denmark🇩🇰 #pils #pilsner #pilsen #caelsbergpilsner #beerlover #cerveja #bier #bière #craftbeer #craftbeerlover #crewcraft #lovebeer #drinkcraft #instabeer #cheers #brewery #beerme #drinkgoodbeer #instacrafrbeer #craftbeercommunity #beerphoto #ilovebeer #beerisgood #craftbeerporn

Carlsberg isn’t bad. Not my first choice for a Pilsner but there’s some appeal here. Slightly bitter with some carbonation. It’s a third choice kind of beer, like if someone offers you one you say yeah sure but you’ll always have 2 other options ahead of it.
450 ml bottle. Poured a clear gold with a white head. The aroma with light notes of hay and lemon. Taste is watery, slight citrus, malt, some bitterness.
Słomkowe, klarowne piwo o średniej pianie, która dość szybko redukuje się do zera. Aromat i smak nikły, słodowy. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie nudne piwo, bez smaku, aromatu i goryczki.

[Blind pilsner tasting - Beder]

Aroma: Hay, wheat, hops and slight honey

Appearance: Golden yellow with a small fast disappearing white head

Taste: Mildly sweet and bitter, hay, wheat, hops and slight honey

Mouthfeel: Mouthfeel is soft with mild carbonation

Overall: This is my second everyday drinking pilsner :)
Tasted this beer. Drinkable to Pink Floyd, Elbow and other great bands. Remember to enjoy your beer in company with good friends.

(2012 vintage)
Taste of metal and wet dog. Bit like shite but worse. Whats better, old fish or this beer? I’d eat the sushi any day

Color amarillo claro, casi transparente. Mucha espuma, pronto diluida, y alto nivel de burbuja.
Olor a cerveza industrial, a malta y cebada.
Poco sabor, el gas destaca sobre todo lo demás, bastante aguada y sin cuerpo. Para tomar muy fría en una terraza de verano si no hay opciones mejores, lo que desgraciadamente es muy común en nuestros bares.

Trochę nawet szkoda eksploatować klawiaturę. Wygląd jeszcze w miarę stylowy, jest bardzo jasne, słomkowe, klarowne, piana rachityczna dziurawi się, ale coś tam pozostaje. W zapachu już jest "dobroć" zielonej butelki, czyli sławetna marihuana aka nasłonecznienie z pakietem w postaci dorównującego mu DMS-u. W smaku jest niewiele lepiej, do wspomnianego wyżej pakietu dochodzi płaskość, brak goryczki. Nie jest to po prostu pilsner

0.5 can. Head is white, a tiny remains. Large-scale lager-beer aroma and color. In addition to watery, it opens with a good bit of bitterness. It is somewhat believable to be a pilsner, but it is far from the Czechs. It is, however, a fairly acceptable drinking beer. It's a pity for the water.
***
Hab fehér, egy pici megmarad. Nagyüzemi lágersör illat és szín. A vizesség mellett elég jó kis keserűvel nyit. Valamennyire hihető,  hogy pilsner,  de a csehektől messze van. Azért egy elég elfogadható szomjoltó ivó sör. A vizességért kár.
Hab korrekt, illat szinte semmi és van egy savanykás íz amit nem tudok hiba tenni

Green bottle poured a clear gold with a small lingering white head. Aromas of bread, light skunk and a hint of citrus. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of bread, light yeast and a hint of citrus with a crisp dry finish.
It poured a golden color with a white head. The aroma was of grain and corn. The taste was similar to the aroma with more grain, corn with mild skanky after taste. Average carbonation.

Bright and bubbly golden color, good carbonation, medium white head that lasts long, light taste, malty, with hop flavours dominating. Aroma is pleasing.. thick flowers hint, hops and bread also.  Bitterness is medium with very aromatic hop, it lasts long till the end. Flowers again in the finish. Very good pilsner. Recommended.
Es kommt den deutschen Fernsehbieren einfach sehr nah.masse statt Klasse. Das Flaschendesign ist natürlich fantastisch
O, tego dziada nie miałem nigdy klikniętego, to sobie wpiszę. Bardzo cienkie, mało słodkie, wysoko wysycone, kukurydzkowe.

Aromat słaby. Niski słodowy, niski kartonowy i ledwo wyczuwalne jakieś nuty piwniczne i DMSu. W smaku wytrawne, niski smak słodu z lekkim dodatkiem alkoholu. Pełnia średnio niska. Nagazowanie wysokie. Plus za brak skunksa. Ogólnie nijaki eurolager. Jakieś 15 lat temu byłem fanem tej jego wytrawności, skunksa i nagazowania. Wtedy wydawało mi się dużo lepsze niż teraz. Nie wiem czy to, że teraz wydaje się nijakie to kwestia tego, że jakieś 5 lat temu poznałem kraft, czy nie, ale z chęcią bym się przeniósł 15 lat w przeszlosc, żeby to sprawdzić ;p

Nostalgic, more than anything.  I love traveling to Denmark and have so many good memories that involve this beer.  It is a bit boring, and won't impress a connoisseur, but they go right down.  I drink 12 per day on vacation in Denmark and you should too.

This is not Pilsner!

Can production of Brewery Baltika Russia
Golden color.
Nose. Malty, slightly grassy hops.
Taste. Malt, empty, after a taste of hint of hops.
Helt okej för att vara en massproducerad öl. Lite för mycket kolsyra men kan vara svalkande och fungerar ok till viss mat.

(330ml can, Copenhagen)
AROMA: sweetish malt, leaning towards wheat/corn, soft dairy
APPEARANCE: light orangey yellow, for a cheap lager, not bad
TASTE: lightly sweet grain/corn, bland perfume, super plain yoghurt, nothing bad or weird, but very simple
PALATE: light, fluid, not much bite but a bit of malt/earth body (just a bit)

OVERALL: a super drinkable pils (if this is actually a pils). I would call it a robust pale lager. slightly sweet and not really bitter, no real flaws except for being non-descript.  beer snobs will hate this but it doesn't suck.

(can 0,5l) Overall: Light in everything, but no flaws like in other international lagers. Boring.
 Aroma: Very light malty, later light hay.
 Appearance: Clear, light golden. Quickly done white head.
 Taste: Light sweet, light malty.
 Palate: Light body. Light bitter finish.

What can I say. I am looking ahead in the world of beer and this is very much a part of the past...

It's a mass produced beer, that offers very little. However I believe context is everything and this has its place. But only just. 

Served ice cold on a hot day after a bit of physical work or labouring this is refreshingly satisfying. Nice aroma of faint lemon and digestive biscuits, super heavy carbonation with little body but a refreshing tang. 

Beyond this, it's redundant.

clear gold colour with a uniform foamy faded white head. Few streams of carbonation. 
The aroma with light notes of grass/hay, lemon, biscuits.

Draught, half pint. @"Copenhagen Airport". [#3.107 Global - #227 Denmark - #1 Carlsberg Brewery (My Danish brewery #39)].
Clear golden colour with a thin white head. Poor retention. Aroma is grainy and malty. Taste is the same leading to a soft corny and malty finish.
Next one please!

330ml can, spilt from multipack in reductions bin, from Waitrose Westfield London for 55pence. Dated as best before 21/05/2020. Served fridge cold into a tumbler. 

The beer pours a perfectly clear gold colour with a uniform foamy faded white head. Few streams of carbonation, I would have expected more. 

The aroma, although minimal, clearly has light notes of grass/hay, lemon, biscuits. 

The taste follows the aroma. Sweet in front with the faintest suggestion of bitter hop on the back. 

Nothing memorable in the mouth. A light bittersweet finish on the tongue.

Clearly a beer for the mass market. Not nearly as bad as the rating on here would suggest. A stepping stone of the road from Carling to Helles.
Can. Clear golden color with a thin head. Mild aroma of hay. Messy taste. Thin body.
Schmeckt aus der Flasche seltsamerweise besser als aus dem Glas. Unspektakulärer, aber ganz eigener Geschmack. Leichte Bitterkeit, etwas herbes Aroma aber weich im Geschmack. Betonende Lakritznote.

From a can to a glass. Pours a clear light gold color with a small foamy head that disappeared. Aroma is barley corm malts and slight earthy hop note. Taste follows the aroma with a slight nuttiness note in the sip and a slight earthy hop note . Medium light mouthfeel. Pretty tasty budget beer.

I was afraid to get similar beers like the "Pilsner Urquell" because i had bad experience with that beer.. But i give a try to this also famous "Carlsberg" Pilsner beer.. 
The aroma smell like one ordinary "Pilsner" beer that wasen't the greater thing but the taste really surprised me and in the end i enjoy this beer.. It has some bittersweet taste and not some high rate bitterness.. Also the aftertaste is simply beautiful.. You feel one amazing malty taste in your mouth and that is the best part here for me..
Overall a very enjoyable and refreshing beer to drink and with the cheap price the whole thing become better.. For sure you can't compare these beers with some classic and badass belgium and german beers but like i say before, any beer has a purpose.. This beer for what it is, worth to drink it..
Bira konusunda aşırı deneyimli değilim fakat şimdiye kadar içtiğim en kötü biraydı. Gazı kaçmış bir sade sodayı yeniden buzdolabına koyup onu içmiş gibi hissettim, keyif alamadım.

Blind test - 25 koncerniaków.
Wygląd: Barwa złota, klarowna z niską, drobno i średnio oczkową białą pianą, która szybko opada do malutkiego pierścienia pozostawiając małe cętki na szkle. 
Aromat: Lekka słodowość chlebowa oraz trochę ziołowego chmielu. W tle nuta diacetylu. 
Smak: Podobnie jak w aromacie. W ustach półwytrawne, treściwość niska, wysycenie średnioniskie. Goryczki brak. Finisz półsłodki z nutą chlebowo - ziołową. 
Ogólnie zwycięzca ślepego testu. Poza wysokim diacetylem brak większych wad, nie licząc pełni, goryczki, intensywności itp.
It's everyman beer. Bulk over substance. But it's possibly not even the worst lager in the world
super crisp clean beer, great at the end of a hot hard day. as long as it isn’t skunked, it’s great. Rewe dresden
Aus der Pulle. Der Antrunk ist sehr wässrig und hat kaum Geschmack. Ganz leicht grasige Aromen, etwas Zitrus. Aber in erster Linie total wässrig. Die Carbonisierung ist ganz ok

Bottle at hotel.
I think I miss you Heineken... Oh, What have I just said loud...

Aroma: Malta, Maíz, Cereal, poco dulce
 Apariencia: Dorada, clara, corona blanca poca retención, espuma blanca
Sabor: Cereal, Malta
Sensación: Delgada, suave, poco amarga

Color amarillo, cristalina. Dos dedos de espuma con buena retención. Aroma y gusto en la misma línea, discreto cereal y maíz, inicio de trago ligeramente dulce y mínima amargor al final del mismo. Cuerpo acuoso. Pils aguada industrial.
# 140, 11/2015. Rozhodně se nejedná o pilsner, ale spíše o international lager... Pivo s divným čmuchem, prázdné, bez chuti, nakyslé.

Verzija iz pivare Celarevo, 5%. Zlatnozute boje, bijela pjena srednje debljine, srednje trajna. Aroma citrusa, trave, metalna aroma. Umjerene gorcine, srednjeg gorkog finisa. Vodene teksture, srednje karbonizacije.
Malty , metallic and a sweet taste with a sour finish. I had the romanian 5.2% abv version and I think they have a different recepy in every country. Very bad beer.

Little bitter
Little bit watery
But would rather buy this than the Tuborg you get in Denmark would buy again
Meget lys øl med en grov skumkrone. Meget let og lidt bitter smag, det hurtigt forsvinder. Meget lidt fylde, men forfriskende. Næsten Danmarks national øl.
okoliczności nie pozwalały na bliższe przyjrzenie się temu piwu, więc ocena tylko taka poglądowa dla uzupełnienia profilu.
0,33l bottle. Pours clear gold with white head. Aroma of citrus, grains, surprisingly not skunked. Taste is watery, slight citrus, malt, some bitterness. Meh.

Bought as a 50cl can at the Shell station in Luxembourg-Eich.
Somehow my version here has 5,5% alcohol.
Slightly amber and clear appearance. Frothy head. Smell of lime, metallic watery taste, weak body.
I pity the Danish queen if she has to drink this beer.
Bottle.  It poured a golden color with a white head.  The aroma was of grain and corn.  The taste was similar to the aroma with more grain, corn, water with mild carbonation and a watery aftertaste.
Carlsberg Pilsner 4.6%. Golden, pale malt aroma, light bodied, pale malt, corn, grainy, metallic finish. Refreshing Pilsner from Copenhagen, Denmark 🇩🇰

Light golden color, watery, clear body, good carbonation, weak head.
Aroma of malt, cereals, dry grass, corn, bread, a bit of lemon, a bit metallic.
Refreshing taste, sweetish, good carbonation, quite watery, malty, baked bread, yeast.
Aftertaste is not so intense, malt, yeast, bread, sweet, a bit metallic.

On tap at Las Buenas Pulgas. 
Pours a golden colour,  two fingers head with medium retention. Good lacing. 
Aroma of grains and herbs that soon decays to sulphur.
Medium to light body, oily texture,  good carbonation. Finish? I don't know what to say.
Taste follows the aroma. 
Refreshing on a hot day.
Clear gold with a small white head. Pretty standard light lager, but with a quality hops aroma and taste.
Bread and corn flavour perhaps, but metallic and harsh, watery and gassy. Not a good beer.
Backlog, bottle that pours a clear golden with smaller to medium head. Notes are cracker, corn, metal, grains, and a touch of spice. Thin and boring with no depth whatsoever. Pretty crappy
So cheap and very popular in Turkey. Standard pilsner. You should not have much expectations.
One of the cheapest beers in stores. Metal in aroma, empty taste of water. Imagine if you wake up after a party and find an opened beer in the kitchen. That's what it's gonna taste like.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso viene attratto dall'orzo. La finezza olfattiva è appena percepibile e la maniera in cui permane è corta. Il manto birroso superiore è caratterizzato da una schiuma che resiste abbastanza. Il liquido è di consistenza limpida. La frizzantezza si presenta sotto forma di bollicine medio-fini. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è leggero e scorrevole. L'amaro è moderato. La forza gustativa è normale e si prolunga in modo sufficiente. Il finale è semplice. Il retrogusto è sfuggente. Sul palato si percepiscono note di pane e di cereali.
bottiglia 50 cl, cosa dire, la classica birra industriale che si lascia bere senza impegno. Dopo 8 km di nuoto è andata giù abbastanza bene. c. Carrefour Gemignaga 26.05.19

only beer they had on the plane, but jack daniels was also free. smells like mashed corn, distant vinegar. pale yellow with froth white head. thin flavor, fairly inoffensive, slight hops. leaves  taste in the mouth.

They say they have completely rebuilt this beer but the taste is only slightly improved. If you buy the cans it seems it's a marketing gimmick so they can now sell you 10 packs of 330ml instead of 440ml.

Absolutely terrible. The only reason I ever drank this beer is because it was cheap and because it’s so weak it was the beer I was allowed when I was a kid at family parties. But now I’ve grown up and drank many others and know what a good beer tastes like I know that this stuff is pure crap. And if you’re talking a lot with like a quarter of a can left if it goes flat you’re gonna get a shock! Honestly it is vile! Seriously, like beer flavoured water.

I'm afraid I'm not in favour of the new brew, it seems to taste more acidic/sharp.
Also I don't like the new glasses, they detract from the presentation, they just look cheap.
I'll stick with Peroni from now on.

Piwo dość znane jako międzynarodowa marka wywodząca się z Kopenhagi. Jest stawiana oczywiście na półce razem z piwami koncernowymi. Cena jednak jest wyższa niż typowe piwa z dolnej półki typu Warka i za puszkę zapłacimy ok. 3Zł. Oczywiście to nie jest dużo, ale już obcujemy z jakąś lepszą marką. Nad szatą graficzną butelki czy puszki nie będę się rozpisywał. Sam producent mówi, że tą chorągiewkę zna każdy i zwiastuje to dobry smak piwa. Deklarowany styl to Pilsner. Jednak byłbym dla niego bardziej wyrozumiały i narzucił po prostu międzynarodowego jasnego Lagera, choć podczas degustacji zauważyłem, że wcale taki typowy rozwodniony Lager to to nie jest. Ale zacznijmy najpierw od naczynia. Jest to zwykła puszka, więc koloru i piany nie ocenię. Zapach jest przyjemny. Czuć znacznie alkohol trochę spirytusowy i koncernowy, ale nie aż tak mocno jak np. w Królewskie. Towarszyszy mu nuta słodu, ale  nie za mocna. Jest to piwo Pure Malt Lager, czyli jest tam tylko słód jęczmienny, woda i chmiel. Podsumowując zapach to można powiedzieć, że zachęca do picia. 
Po łyku wyczuć można wodę gazowaną, czyli nic. Jednak potem wyłania się  alkohol z nutami spirytusu z  bardzo lekkim posmakiem słodu i zaskakującym goryczkowym finishem. Jak na Euro Lagera goryczkowość jest bardzo dobra. Można powiedzieć, że przewyższa o wiele słodowość. Goryczka nie jest garbnikowa ! Stawia to piwo gdzieś pomiędzy Euro Lagerem, a Pilsem jeśli chodzi o chmiel. Jednak bardzo mało ciała i wyczuwalny alkohol, który dodatkowo ma akompaniament minimalnego DMS (ale to bardzo minimalnego) i żelaza spycha to piwo na Euro Lagera. Więc czym jest Carlsberg ? Według mnie na pewno nie Pilsem z prawdziwego zdarzenia. Kupując go biorę go za lepszego koncerniaka i patrzę na niego jako Euro Lager, ale ten lepszy. I taki właśnie jest Carlsberg. Lepszy konernowy Lager z bardzo dobrym goryczkowym finishem. Polecam dla ludzi, którzy chcą coś więcej niż Taterka.

Lane. Od Kasztelana odrobinę lepsze, ponieważ bardziej przypominało wodę. Tak, taki rozwodniony kasztelan, czyli woda z syropem glukozowo-fruktozowym w proporcji gdzieś tak 1:4. Zapachu nie ma, słodkie, ale nie do wyrzygania. No i na pewno nie w kategorii pilsner.

Can from the Co-op. So I've been told that this has been revamped. Let's check it out. Very pale amber, large foam head. Not so fresh head, more the macro chemical foam head. Nose is subtle but there's a slight greenish and floral hop aroma, light hay and straw, toasted grain, very slight biscuit malt. Taste is minimal, but it's clean and crisp, slight touch of floral hop, almost no bitterness, little bit of cereal grain and toasted grain, not too carbonated which makes it softer on the palate. On the finish there's a subtle bitter hop and floral hop thing going on. It's not an unpleasant beer, easy to drink and doesn't have those macro bad notes like corn and over carbonation but it's still under flavoured.

Piwo jasno złote piana szybko opada. W aromacie pusto, koło chmielu to nie stało. Lekkie warzywa ale raczej nie DMS. Jednak jest on bardzo delikatny. W smaku delikatnie słód, goryczka jakaś jest. Coś co przeszkadza to olbrzymie wysycenie. Niestety na tym polu przegrywa z konkurencją

Aroma: Pilsner malt, a touch of hops and some DMS.

Appearance: Crystal clear, straw, good white head.

Taste: Sweet, low-to-medium bitterness.

Palate: Light body, average carbonation.

Overall: Not very impressive, bland and not as clean as it could be.

Comperative tasting: Bottle 630 ml - bottle, 330 ml - Can, 500 ml - Draught, pint. There's a huge difference between these Carlsbergs. First of all, Cyprus had the right first to produce Carlaberg out of Denmark in 1967 by Photos Photiades Brewery. So the Carlsberg here is quite a good, trustworthy lager. The strongest is the draught obviously, great creamy foam, deep golden colour, expressive and pleasent malty aromas. The small bottle is great also, a bit compressed, but also a very drinkable and rich lager. Canned is good also, no metallic taste in the background, pure aromas and taste. The big bottle... I don't know, it's like a shadow of the small bottle, not very rich, watery on the palate, somehow it's more weak than the others. So if u have a chance, always choose the draught, bottled is good also, canned is OK, big bottle is not the one to recommend. Anyway, Carlsberg rocks in CY!

500 ml can into lager glass, best before 1/2018. Pours fairly crystal clear medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with awesome retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of cracker, corn, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness. Touch of fruitiness in the aromas, but not overpowering. Nice and pleasant aromas with pale malt/corn and light earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, corn, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness. Mild herbal, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, corn, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, and mild herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice robustness of pale malt/corn and light earthy hop flavors; with a nice malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Very clean on lager flavors, with minimal yeast notes present. Lightly increasing dryness from lingering bitterness. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, and lightly sticky mouthfeel that is good. A bit thin, but not watery. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is a very good pale lager style. All around nice robustness of pale malt/corn and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. Clean pale malt/grain flavors, and decent hop presence; not overdone on the adjuncts at all. A very enjoyable offering, and well made style example.

Draft at SAD- I mean SAS- "gold" lounge. So you made it all the way to the land of the top beer tickers. And to celebrate that, we're rewarding you with... drum roll please... Carlsberg! And when you get tired of that, we have... get ready for it...Carlsberg! And we'll top that off with our final selection...Carlsberg! One beer here and it's the most boring beer in Denmark. So, it pours clear golden yellow on draft with a quickly fading white head. Aroma is boring, light, grainy, maybe a bit o honey if you really strain your nose. Flavor is a typical Euro pale. Bar 7,50€/l, 2€/l
Clear golden beer with little white head. Aroma is light malty, metallic. Taste is light bitter and little sour. Light body. Easy drinkable refreshing beer.

16oz can. For a macro lager, this is perfectly decent. It doesn’t have any flaws, and there’s just enough cereal and hop flavor to actually give it a slight taste. Still, there’s no denying its overall blandness.
On tap somewhere at a bar at Hamburg-Hafencity. Pale clear in the glass with a mid head. Taste is grassy, hay, some malt, low flat bitterness. Standard stuff.

Aroma: Cereals and herbs.
Appearance: Light golden color with clear sparkling liquid and white rocky head.
Taste: Medium bitterness with light sour notes.
Palate: Light body with thin texture and average carbonation. Short bitter sparkling finish.
Overall: It leaves no memory and it is pretty soft, but it is refreshing and it doesn’ t leave metallic or astringent finish.
Carlsberg, synonymum europiva a globální korporace, ničící malé pivovary. Je třeba ho blíže komentovat?
Lata @Supermercado Alimerka , Oviedo 22/04/17. BBD:26/10/17. Color dorado hermosa cereal sabores a cereal cuerpo ligero floja.

From old tasting notes. Clear medium gold color. Thick creamy white head. Clean mild malt aroma. Deliciously mildly crisp malt flavor with hints of cloves and spice. Finishes clean with a touch of dryness.
Drank more than once. Last time on tap at Carlsberg Øl, Milano, Italy. Colour is golden yellow with a decent white head. Aroma of malts and corns. Taste of standard mainstream lager beer.

330ml can bought at my local Prix store.Clear straw-golden body, decent, bubbly white head. Clingy lacing. Mid-sweet pale malty nose. Sweet grainy taste with distant notes of dusty hops. Papery dry endnotes. Soft on the swallow. Just about drinkable. (Shared with djoeye, Tromsø 02.04.2017).
Earlier Rating: 1/21/2010 Total Score: 1.6
500ml can as Carlsberg Hof, 4.2% ABV, Clear, straw-yellow body, rapidly collapsing white head. Weak grassy aroma. Notes of sweet malts with lemony hints in flavour. After a while in the glass, I’m left with little else than sweet, mouth-filling carbonated water. Pretty dry on the swallow. A very neutral partner to our spiced chicken (shared with Frau Eva, Tromsø 17.01.2010).

Aroma; mild grain, sweet grassy hops.   Look; off white head, pale strawy golden body.   Taste; mild grain, sweet malts, lousy hops – cardboard malted finish.  Feel; macro so so.  Overall; same Carlsberg, new can.   [33cl.can abv4.5% B@Prix T@Hagen&Bier]   
Earlier Rating: 7/15/2013 Total Score: 2
Bought an 0,5L alu-can and 0,33 bottle in Middelfart DK - therefore this review is not about any of the licence-products of same beer in other countries.
Bright white to vanilla-white smooth foam which vanishes and leaves only tiny dots and a 3 mm rand.
Scents of herbs and hops. Beer is light yellow-golden, and has a moderate carbonation, tiny bubbles.
Very mild malty hoppy taste, and rye-bread, nuts, straw, and droplets of water. Palate of malts and bread and some grass.
Aftertaste average lived, but not very special. Pale lager covers well as description, and it is just an ordinary beer for those who prefer that.
This beer may go with mild food, or one may say "pale food". Or it is just a quick fresh one on a hot day.
I tasted both bottle and can version in Middelfart Denmark 30th June 2013 and took an extra in Tromsø 15th July.
Abv varies 4,6 - 4,5.
33cl can. clear golden color. small white head. pilsner malt, citrus. watery and bland.

Bottle from Trinkgut in Goch, Germany.
The beer is clear golden colored and has a small white head, with enough carbonation. 
The aroma is malty and a little fruity, with notes of grass, bread, yeast and a hint of citrus. 
The taste is light bodied and malty sweetness with notes of bread, grains, yeast and a little fruit. Further a little watery. 
The finish is light bitter and grainy. 
Typical lager, nothing special but better than Tuborg Green.

Bottle into a stemmed beer glass. Golden appearance, thin white head. Some lacing but only early. Smells of corn and sweetish malt. Tastes sweet but there is a cleansing piece to the short palate which helps. Nothing really wrong with the beer, just pilsners are no longer a style I go back to well.
Nudne piwo. Słodowe. Barwa jasnozłota, piana niska, szybko znika. Nieciekawe.

Tap at Vinstue 90 Copenhagen. Sold as Slow beer and poured at 15 minutes per beer, the taste was hugely affected. Giant whipped cream head, no bubbles whatsoever. The beer was smoot as anything; little taste but nothing to dislike. A great lager under these circumstances. (23/3/18)
_____
Can at home from systembolaget. 3. 2 to 2.8. I still think that for a macro beer it ain't actually too bad. Does what it should. (6/5/20)
---
On tap at Captain Cook Östersund. Didn't punch up or down. Standard lager. 2.8 to 2.7.
Aroma of straw and grains. Taste is nicely balanced between the hops and the malts. Good stuff.

50 cl. can. Straw coloured with a quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is malt and corn. Taste is sweet and crispy with some apple notes. It is medium bodied and thin to oily textured. Carbonation is quite lively. Finish is mostly sweet with a light bitterness and leaves a very light sourness in the palate. Aroma would be better but other than that it is indeed a nice Pilsener.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Découverte et goûtée en pression avec mon cher Appiantiqua .Robe jaune paille surmontée d’une mousse blanche peu persistante.Le nez offre des arômes maltés.La bouche ajoute des fines notes amertume.Une bonne bière,légère et rafraîchissante qui rappelle la Pils mais avec en plus une petite pointe d’agrume bien plaisante!

Goûtée avec mon petit Kittenbieer en pression.
Température environ 6°.
Robe blonde surmontée d’une mousse blanche de persistance moyenne.
Nez malté caractéristique des Pils.
Goût agréable et rafraîchissant avec une dominante amère.
L’arrière bouche est plaisante et sans lourdeur.
Une Pils plutôt réussie.
Light, bitter, very refreshing, malty. Unspectacular, but I am part Danish, so I kind of had to try it.
Blind tasted from the bottle. Straw coloured, small white head. Creamy texture. Little taste and fades quickly. Almost no discernable aroma.
Bottle. Pours golden yellow. Aroma is weak, mostly malty. Some corn. Light body with a crisp carbonation. Soft. Watery. Meh.

Very pale golden yellow with quickly disapearing white head. Sweetness in the aroma (over ripe apples and corn and after a while boiled cabbage notes), not much malt or hop aroma. The taste is sweet (again with apple notes I think) and with a light medium bitter finish. Not much malt or hops in the flavor either. Palate is a little weak bodied and lacks staying carbonation. This is one of the beers I grew up drinking but besides the nostalgia it is difficult to find much charm.

Proefglas van 25cl-fles in les Zytholoog te Syntra Kortrijk. U: Goudblond met kleine witte schuimkraag. G: Pilsmout, brood, kaf en fruitig. S: Licht moutzoet gecombineerd met een lichte bitterheid. Gist en een zeer lichte florale toets. Lichte astringente nabitterheid. M: Weinig body en medium carbonatie.
12.11.2016 at (sadly Mikkeller Free Zone) Ferry between Denmark and Germany - Plain metallic lagery smell and taste. Old or cheap hops with a thin thin body.

Yellow, clear pour with a quick, thick white foam. Biscuit malt dominate the nose with some grassy hos. The taste is malty at first and finishes with a hoppy bitterness. Thin body and slightly watery but active fizz.

Bright pale straw color with lots of pearly activity. Slightly foamy white 2 finger head, lasting less than 5 minutes, with faint lacing. Flavors of sweet grains, barley, corn, faint lemon and noble hops. Lots of sweetness, a little crispy but faint sharpness. Slick light body with prickly carbonation. Light finish, lingering malts and sugars, very faint grassy hops and skunk. Feel of alcohol lowering the freshness. Quite watery and bland. Lacking some sharpness and hops. Overall bad quality craft.

Piana biala, dosc obfita, stosunkowo szybko opada. Barwa bladozlota, piwo przejrzyste. Slaby aromat, slodowy. W tle pojawia sie nuta owocowa oraz diacetyl. W smaku bardzo przecietnie. Wysokie wysycenie, lekki slodowy smak, generalnie pustka. Piwo wodniste. Goryczka ledwo wyczuwalna. Standardowy koncerniak, nic specjalnego

Aroma: mostly sweet with notes of earthy hop. Appearance: straw coloured with a thin white head which did not retreat. Taste: grainy sweetness with dry finish. Not terrible as a mass-produced beer, a lot better than some of the American adjuncts.

Draught. Good lacing! Yellow colour and white head. Aromas really not unique, just standard Eurolager. Flavours include a tad more malt than I expected, similar to Estrella Damm in that sense. Just another lager.
11.2 oz. bottle. Pours golden, clear, minimal white head. Aroma was skunky, malty, grains. Taste was grassy, sweet malt.
Butelka, sławny koncerniak, pijalne kiedy schłodzone tak że nie czuć już smaku.

I had it on tap. It pours golden with almost no head or lacing. The aroma is corn and fruit. The taste is corn, grain, and fruit. It’s sweet, clean, and inoffensive. This is pretty decent for what it is.

Clear golden with medium white head. Aroma is noble hops, tartness. Some musty basement stuff. Taste is the usual lager bitterness with some really bad artificial grainy sweetness. More grains in the finish. Easy to drink, but that’s it...
Charakterystyczna zielona butelka. Dobre, diacetyl - zielona butelka. Trudno pomylić ten smak. Klarowne, ziołowe. Dobry jak na koncerniaka.

(can, 5,0% abv) clear golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of pale malts and powdered sugar, quite dusty, with a light hint of banana skins and some caramel. flavour is mostly the same, lots of dusty pale malts, caramel and powdered sugar, with perhaps the faintest hint of kidney beans and an empty finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.
In the glass it pours a hazy yellow color. The nose has some grass with a little skunkiness. Taste actually has a little sweetness to it with some grass and some rice. Not bad but hard to drink.

Tuli testattua rinnakkain Carlsberg 4.5% ja Pirkka 3-olut 4.5%. Molemmat kirkkaan kullankeltaisia oluita. Carlsbergissa säilyvämpi ja hieman pitsiä jättävä vaahto, kun Pirkassa vaahtoa ei ole juuri lainkaan. Carlsberg myös poreilee selvästi Pirkkaa enemmän. Carlsbergille pisteet tästä. Tuoksu Carlsbergissä aavistuksen vahvempi, mutta vain peruslagermaisen maltainen ja hieman tunkkainen. Maultaan molemmat hieman vetisiä ja kivennäisvesimäisiä, mutta Carlsbergissä hieman pilsin ominaisuuksia ja voimaista makua, jolla se peittoaa tälläkin osuudella Pirkan.

On a ce qu’on a.
Pas de nez sinon le houblon saaz.
Bouche ultra légère, aqueuse, petites notes de céréales par principe. Le saaz donne un côté vert mais aussi un fond rance désagréable.

A boring but correct one. Not especially cheap so I’m usually looking for something else when I want something to drink outside during hot afternoons, but I’d not spit on it if there’s nothing available at a better price. What else to say about it? Sweeter than other industrial piss, average taste, wheat aromas... It’s okay. PARTIALLY APPROVED BY TAVERNY’S BLACK METAL CREW!
Good brew. I would have this one again. It would of tasted better if there was a little more sweetness to it. It’s an ok beer.
Can beer from supermarket. Nice golden color, very clear in glass. It makes average foam when poured. It is a little sweet as a first taste, then malt comes over, but I like it.
One of the more plain lagers. It’s promising bubbly, golden appearance disappoints in its lack of substance and bland aftertaste. Refreshing on a hot day but nothing special.
330ml can. At kolonihaven with ben and Pete. Small head. Yellowish. Watery texture. Weak aroma. Weak taste. Cheap beer.
Fine ordinary beer. The power of Denmark. Rated from 330ml can. Aarhus July 14, 2016

Besk och lätt brödig. Ljus och klar. Liten doft och smak, den var inte rolig alls

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can from market. Pours pale golden color with white head. Aroma and taste are grainy, bready and metallic.

Złote, klarowne, piana poprawna.
W aromacie i smaku nuty słodowe. 
Goryczka niska.
Bready, grainy, thin yet too sweet, no discernable hop character, watery, sweet, Low bitterness, slightly metallic finish.
Bottle. Clear golden colour. Taste of malts,grain,bread, huge carbonation, watery body, no bitterness.

Pretty green bottle. 11.2 oz, no date.

Pours a very clear, very carbonated, straw color. About one finger white head. Light head retention, light lacing.

Aroma is Euro lager aroma. Bready, light floral hops.

Taste is Euro lager taste. Creamy taste, very lightly bitter.Mostly sweet, but not overly sweet.

Mouthfeel is creamy, a little dry, crisp, refreshing.  A little watery.

Overall, it’s really good. Not a whole lot of descriptives about it, but it’s solid. Typical Euro lager, but better overall than most. I would suggest trying it. I would buy it again for sure.

500ml can. I don’t remember Carlsberg being this bad. Was it, or am I just getting older? Pours a pale yellow with a white head. On the nose very faint notes of hard water, faint floral notes, and various sugars. Taste wise, sweet, with sugary notes, light caramel, and light mineral hopping that heads into cardboardy malt notes,a taste reminiscent of corn syrup, and faint metallic bitterness in the finish. It tastes like Budweiser with a slightly different hop profile. If it was revealed that this was a beer-like product, I wouldn’t be shocked. Thumbs down.
can @ supermarket (denmark) pale colour, light body, high carbonated, but for me just an another lager without any special notes
A nice and drinkable beer. Not much to say except that its one of the better ones among those like it....
A typical basic Pils. Reminds me of a smoother Mickey’s. I mean nothing awesome, but a good drinking beer.

Bottle 0.5
Российская лицензия.
Довольно-таки безвкусный евролагер. В послевкусии пробивается слабенькая, еле заметная горчинка.

One of the most plain easy drinkable pilsner you can get. It is nothing special wrong or good about it. 1500 ratings…..I do not need to write any more. You know what you get.
[Can someone brought into my house]
Aroma from bread and cheese; light golden in colour; light bitter taste; soft carbonation; short finish.
Deep golden,Sweet in taste,Absence of bitterness,Taste of apple and honey,1 finger head disappear quickly

lubie carlsberga / i like carlsberg 

może to kwestia marketingu a może sentymentu do skandynawii gdzie wszystko proste jak trzeba / maybe it is because of marketing or maybe my sentyment to the scandinavia where white is white and black is black
prawdopodobnie nie jest to najlepsze piwo świata / probably it is NOT the best beer in the world 
ale na stroget w ciepły wiosenny wieczór delikatna goryczthe magic ka tworzy pewna magie / still the dedicate bitterness adds on to the magic on stroget on a warm summer night
czasem tak trzeba / sometimes irresistable
Nice glow, honey nose, smooth finish. But it is just a Carlsberg. That can be a good or a bad thing.
This is properly the best beer in town... It’s awesome. Try it, if you haven’t tried it.
Arôme sur le malt. Goût métallique, de malt et beaucoup d’acidité. J’aime pas ! Etait t’elle normale ou pas ?
Honey apple flavour, sweet in taste, dark golden in colour, one among the best cheap beers

Dark golden with medium carbonation 
Absence of bitterness 
Sweet and honey flavour
Light beer, with clear aspect and light color, soft carbonation, lightly bitter, (bought a 50cl bottle in Brno supermarket).

500 ml can. Tipical golden color with an unusual large white head for a pilsener. Cheap beer bar smell. Sweet taste, grains, very waterish, but in the refreshing way, not in the "i don’t want to drink this piss" way. Aftertaste is ok, and probably low hangover. Meh.

Cereal, hoppy, minimal notes of citrus and yeast, minimal white head not persistant, light body, golden, taste of cereal, bitter quite absent....i drank this beer many times during years and obviously it is not a great beer but it remains one of my personal best beers, easily drinkable in any occasion without effort.
Pretty average pilsner. Pours yellow with decent white head. Highly carbonated. Very little flavour of note.

Too gasy and way to carbonated to enjoy in larger quantities. It is also very abrupt and the taste kinda disappears after you swallow the beer. 

Strange. I drank 3 bottles and couldnt drink anymore. And that in a span of 2 hours.

0.33 l can. Pours a yellow-pale golden color with almost disappearing head. Metallic and sweet aroma. Bitter taste with watery sweet aftermath and somehow bitter finishing. Maybe it wasn’t chilled enough but it wasn’t a pleasant beer.
Drank in bottle, Portugal. Average pills, bitter and well-carbonated. No distinctive characteristics.
It’s 2Pac day!! 330 ml bottle. Clear yellow golden color with white head. Malty aroma, grainy. Sweet taste, metallic notes. Light thin body with average carbonation.
Draught. Light hoppy aroma with yeasty notes. The flavour is light bitter. The body is light and the texture is watery. Soft carbonation. Plain but nostalgy to me.

1/18/16 Chicago - (Two 20 oz pours at Vaughn’s Northwest via Carlsberg wave glass). Clear blonde pour, heavy carbonation, slight white head. Light aroma and taste of mild hops. Smooth going down. Decent mega brewed beer.

0.5l can in moscow, brewed in st.petersburg. "carlsberg premium beer", 4.6% alcohol. pours a clear pale golden with a medium white head and little lacing. aroma of grass, hay, metal. grassy slightly bitter and salty flavour.
Drank this many times and I imagine it was once crisp, hoppy and grassy. Nowadays it tastes sweetish and plastic-like. Sad.
Flaske og fad. farven er lys gyldengul med en hvid skumkrone. Aromaen er malt og græs medens smagen er maltet med en let bitter afslutning.
Couleur dorée, bonne mousse blanche. Nez de houblon doux. Gout malté leger avec céréales douces, puis houblonné avec très légère amertume. Pils très classique mais agréable

Barwa jasnozłota, wręcz "sikowa", klarowne. W aromacie w zasadzie nic się nie dzieje, słodowe, lekko utlenione. W smaku słodowe, ale głównie to pustka, goryczki zero, bardzo wysokie wysycenie, w miarę pijalne nawet. Woda i nic więcej, nie ma się czym zachwycać. Powiedziałbym, że prawdopodobnie najgorsze piwo na świecie, chociaż jest kilka gorszych. Ale niewiele raczej.

50 cl can. Genereic, mass-produced pilsener, and a nice looking one. Light yellow, nice white head. Not much aroma. Medium to thin mouthfeel, some citrus and clove notes in the flavour, A bit sweet apple freshness at the back, nice carbonation. Never really bothered to taste this properly untill now, but it turns out to be a nice all-rounder. Sweeter than the Tuborg Grøn and not so "sharp" in the carbonation.

0,33 l Flasche. Aroma: Grasig, leicht hopfig, leicht säuerlich. Erscheinung: Goldgelbes Bier mit weißem, grobporigen, recht stabilem Schaum, der eine gute Gardine erzeugt. Geschmack: Säuerlich, leicht malzig süß, kaum hopfig geschweige denn bitter. Nachgeschmack: Wässrig, leicht malzig süß, leicht säuerlich. Gesamt: Beliebig austauschbares Standardpils.

Can, 33 cl. Clear golden body with a small white head and visible carbonation. Dull aroma with light malt and hops. Dry watery taste with light bitterness. Generic and boring. Light body with average carbonation. Dry and bitter finish. Not bad, but very forgettable.

Pours pale golden. Just another lager, but good one for the first round. Malty, grainy.

ワイワイ飲むにはちょうどいい感じだと思う。

2015/11/18
高円寺 AEON Liquorで購入。225円くらい。キャベツ、ほうれん草、豆腐、イベリコ豚のパテ。
easily drinkable beer. do not bothers you while eating meal.i do not like too much aroma in a beer so thşs was perfect for me.
Denne pilsner har et gyldent og klart udseende med et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en maltet aroma og en lidt bitter eftersmag. En traditionel pilsner. Medium karbonering.
Can at home. Pours pale yellow. Aroma of malts, grain, light hop. Taste is malty, with a bit grainy taste, light cardboard. Doll

Clear gold color with medium white foam. Aroma of malt and has bit of sourness to it, interesting in a way. Taste, is very pale with bit of sourness and cider like taste, not too bad but neither the best.
Golden with a medium white head. Not much aroma. A bit of yeast and hops. Taste grainy with a bit of bitterness. Watery! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I find this beer quite allright actually. I really like the fresh aroma it gives off and the way it fills your mouth. The taste however gives some to wish for, but I don’t think it’s bad. In essence this is a beer that’s far from great and doesn’t try to be, but still manages to cling to what is my best description of it: okay.
Clean golden colour. Head disappearing quickly. Malty aroma, Malt and corn in taste. Generally borring.
Can that says premium beer, 5%. Poured to a shaker glass. Yellow in color, quick white head, no lacing or retention. Aroma of skunk and wet cardboard. Tastes about the same. Nasty.

Not that Good van. Tucategyveleg. Egyszerű és szomjoltó. És egyszerű. És szomjoltó.
Negédes.
Sin ser nada del otro mundo, mejor que unas cuantas de las lager industriales de mayor venta. Aroma y sabor malteados, clara, burbujeante, ligeramente dulzona con escaso cuerpo. Refrescante y bebible
Kolor jasna słomka. Piana srednie oczka, redukuje sie do malej warstwy. W aromacie slodowosc, skunks. W smaku chlebek. Goryczka srednia jak na lager. Wysycenie srednie
How : bottle Appearance : clear golden, medium white head. Aroma : hint of floral and some light citrus in the back. Palate : thin body, average to high carbonation.
Pours clear golden with big head. Tap at SAS lounge Oslo. Metallic and unpleasant with a very bad aftertaste.

Barwa jasna, piana biała dość sztywna.
W aromacie lekkie nuty słodwe.
W smaku wodniste, głównie słodowe.
I can not distinguish from the one brewed in China, its imported which I find in a supermarket in HK
----- I’ve tried it before joining to the RateBeer. -----

Can brewed by Sinebrychoff. A light yellow, a head is small and white. Aroma has malts and sweetness, some cardboard. Taste is slightly more balanced than aroma, malts, no bitterness, short and slightly musty end. Light+ bodied, slightly harsh to drink. Just malts, boring.

Can at home.
International.
No surprises here. 😀
Clean and crisp.
Good thirst quencher on a hot summer’s day.

Bottle. Pours a clear fizzy yellow with a thin white head that leaves low lace. Nose is of grass and cereals. Taste is dry and cereals-centric. Lightly bitter. Body is medium and carbonation medium-high. Overall I thought it was OK, not the worst macro option out there.

The foam is coarse, white and persistent. It has a fresh aroma of grain, some hops and some malt. The taste is rich and well hopped, partially malted and also has a very light floral flavor. It is a quite excellent thirst quencher which is actually better than the reputation it has among many beer enthusiasts.
Canned. Color of bright amber. No head, slightly visible fizz. Aroma: yeast, wheat. Palate is felt on the tongue. First, the taste is sweet, later it becomes bitter.
Caned. Golden color with small white head. A little aroma of hops, taste is same as aroma. Quite ordinary and simple pilsner.
Bottle. Golden clear pour with a frothy head. Grains, sweat, green grass and some malty sweetness.
A decent pilsner from Denmark that is surely drinkable. It does not knock you off your feet, but is a good quick thirstkiller.
Bottle pour. Aroma is like most other pilsners and the taste did too. Pretty good, would buy again.
Can. Pours transparent gold with white head. Tastes bitter and yeasty. Very watered down. Bitter finish. Not great but does the trick.
Lager pâle classique, rien d’intéressant autre que le fait d’être désaltérante, sans notes désagréables. Bue ci et là en bouteille ou à la pression.

0,33 bottle marked as Carlsberg "Hof" with 4,2% ABV from systembolaget - Directly compared to the export version this is has a milder, more restrained aroma. The flavor is not as offensive as with the export. Mild grains, hay and white bread. Less apple (acetaldehyde) in the finish. It’s okay, and a classic, but there are better macro pilsners out there (i’m looking at you, germany and czech republic!)

Flaska pizzeria tomassino örebro. Klar äppeljuicefärgad. Brödig doft och smak. Lite hö och minimal beska. Lätt vattnig. Den extrema värmen ute i kontrast till den kalla ölen förskönar nog betyget en del
Dourada,límpida,translúcida,alta carbonatação;no aroma malte,lúpulo,suave floral;no sabor malte,panificação e um leve amargor finalizando,refrescante,boa drinkability,final seco um pouquinho amargo.
En pression dans une brasserie parisienne, légère mousse, couleur jaune pale, une bière désaltérante et rafraîchissante pour l’été.
Pale color, no head. Thin body and bellow average carbo .Metalic taste with a bit of hops. Dry finish .One more beer for people who don’t resist the power of marketing.

Bottle at a sports pub while watching women’s basketball (Lithuania won). Clear bright gold in colour, active bubbling almost until the end, small and brief white head. On the nose it’s kinda stale wet hay and grassy, not at all exciting, but not at all bad. Tastes of fake hoppy bitterness, grainy sweet and grassy, quite tolerable though. Dryish on the palate. Active carbonation, but the overall flatness prevents it from any crispness or from being refreshing. Yea, there was a period I thought this was prime shit.

In Legado de Yuste glass. Playing KB Dark Side. Easy to drink. One of the good macro lagers. Soft. Avg 2.72. 

1 Nov 2016. Euro 2016 Limited Edition. In Teku glass. Playing Magic 2015. All to be expected in a good euro lager. Refreshing and easy drinking. Nothing special in taste and aroma but not unpleasant either. Avg 3

16 Agosto 2021. De Carrefour. Nueva etiqueta y nueva chapa. En vaso shaker. En almuerzo, con sushi y pollo guisado. Lager insulsa, insípida, aunque sin nada desagradable. Aunque la etiqueten como Pilsner no tiene nada de ello, es una euro pale lager vulgar y corriente. Aburre pero refresca. Avg 2.3
Drank at S&G big pilsener tasting, blindly comparing 24 pilseners. Taste for most pilseners was the same, some grains, bit hoppy, quite malty and mostly bit metallic.
25cl bottle. A traditional well-known lager, in its lovely green bottle. Great sweet bitter balance, and nicely coloured too. A watery mouth and pale taste prevails however.
Clear light golden, unstable airy white head. Sweetish malty flavour and aroma. Dry with hints of hops. Fresh and clean finish. Certainly drinkable when ice cold.

12/06/2015 @ Work drink. 33cl bottle.
From the bottle. Little hay & hops, thin, boring.

BOTTLE 50CL. Bottled 23-ARP-2015 by Carlsberg Ukraine at 5% ABV. Clear yellow, a creamy off-white head. A sweet malty aroma, sweet bread. some grassy and lemony hops. The taste is malt sweetness, grassy, quite sweet but with enough herbal and slightly pungent hop bitterness in the finish. Not that bad.
Little bitter and sour. Aroma is not bad but its no longer palate. İts an avarage soft beer

Clear yellow with no head. Smells of apples. Taste is mostly dry, but nothing complex. This is one of the better macro lagers that I have had. It doesn’t get me excited or anything, but it is very drinkable.
500ml bottle, brewed in Russia. Pours pale yellow with a medium white head. Malty and slightly metallic aroma. Taste is the same. Better than Tuborg Green, but not by far.

Draught pint at BATS, Shangri-La, Jakarta on 29/04/15. Clear golden colour with no head to speak of. Carbonated, bordering on fizzy. Aroma of bread, grass. Pretty standard commercial lager, but a poor one. Why this I S popular is lost om me.

One of the best tasting Euro Lagers-German Pilseners in the world.
It’s slightly better than Heineken, Stella and much better than all AAL.

Copenhagen 24/4 2015. 33 cl can from Netto. Pours clear yellow with white head. Rather persistent. Aroma of malts and some sourness. Medium carbonation. Taste is bland. A little sourness - not much else. Pretty refreshing on a summerday - but that goes for a glass of cold water as well.
Poured from bottle, clear gold with medium white head. Aroma with notes of bread, grass and hay. Taste is bitter sweet and dry. Not very tasty but drinkable on a warm day.

bottle @ DTU s-huset: Pours claer golden with ok white creamy head and some lacing. aroma/taste: bread, hints of caramel and some floral notes. palette: medium carbonation, thin body, some barley sweetness, low to medium bitterness, short duration and a watery texture. Overall: uninspiring pilsner
Really enjoyed this beer! It reminded me of Ukrainian "Obolon". The same light taste.

Pours light clear gold. Light white head. Aroma of pear orange and nice bread. Taste of citrus pear and good grains. No cheap cereal flavor. Pretty smooth balance of CO2. Cold, refreshing, tasty for a pilsner.
Bez rewelacji. Aromat słodowy, wygląd słaby, a w smaku co najwyżej "ujdzie". Jeżeli to jest prawdopodobnie najlepsze piwo na świecie to ja prawdopodobnie jestem prezydentem Polski...

33cl bottle@home in Carlsberg tall glass. Approx 10 degrees C. My hardest review to date! This is THE beer of my life. Grew up with it. My late father prefered it to Tuborg, the choice readily available at the time. Tried Tuborg myself as a youngster as is was the preferred brew of my intellecutal friends trying to emulate the working classes. Found out how much better Carslberg, then Hof, tasted and never looked back. Even persuaded my girlfriend, now my life’s companon, that Carlsberg is superior in taste. Today , the family, including our 22 year old son, agree. Carlsberg is the standard upon which pilsners/lagers are measured. And though not among the great, it fares well. LIght golden yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, citrus, bread and pine. Taste slightly sweet and malty. I strikes me that I am drinking this too warm! Should be about 5 degrees, but then again, I get a long, malty aftertaste, which is more than I bargained for. Nuff said! I still like this old stablemate. Perhaps more that I should, but it just is a damn nice lager! Pobably not the best in the world, but one of the very goood macro lagers.
On tap at 5k Kildares. Glycogenic tasting pilsner from Denmark. Danky feel to it, flavorful at best, harsh at worst. Gets the job done, easily drank brew.

Old rating. Straight from the bottle. Noticeably skunkiness present. Slight hint of pear and citrus albeit very minimal. Little to no body. Little to no flavour outside of grain. Not even a good pilsner. Just doesn’t taste fresh.

0,5 l plechovka z Coop Jednoty vyrobené v Srbsku. Svetlejšia farba, hustá "jarová" pena, vonia to ako pivo. Chuť slabá, po horkosti ani náznak, po prehltnutí zostáva na jazyku zvláštna pachuť. Mizerné europivo, vypiť len v prípade núdze v zahraničí...

Poured from a 330 CL bottle into a pint glass. 
Aroma- ahhh, the green glass skunkiness strikes again. 
Appearance- Straw yellow with almost no head
Taste- has an almost citrus flavor with some grain thrown in
Palate- A light bodied brew with moderate carbonation. 
Overall- an ok beer. I am sure this beer has suffered in the US market when craft beer took off.
Jak wszyscy wiemy, nie ma nic w tym piwie. Kiedyś było dobre, teraz jest niedobre.  I na pewno nie jest to pilsner.
Aroma is much like any other good pilsner, malty and fresh. Goes in very well. Low on CO2. One of my favourite easy-drinking beers!

Tasted 12/1/2017. Draught at Harry’s Bar, Changi Airport, Singapore; $S9. Poured a crystal clear pale amber with a 5mm bright-white open foam head that diminished quickly to a collar that laced poorly. Carbonation virtually nil with very rare coarse bubbles. Aroma slightly of lager malt if lucky. Taste is slightly malty with low bitterness as it warms. Light body. Smooth with a short moderately strong malty finish. Bottle:- named Carlsberg Copenhagen 1847 on neck label. Poured a crystal clear pale amber colour with a two-finger white frothy head that retained OK and laced OK. Carbonation high with lots of fine to medium sized bubbles. Aroma of grain and light malt is quite pleasant but typical of a lager. Taste of slight sweetness and slight hops bitterness. Light body. Crisp refreshing mouthfeel but one to drink quickly to enjoy the best it has to offer. Typical macro-lager, certainly not a pilsner.
Pours a clear yellowish color. Aroma and taste are grassy and some grainy malts.
En meget flad pilsner. Smager ikke af meget, dog er kuldioxiden velfordelt.
It has pale colour, barely tasty and almost water. This beer does not estimule any sense or sensation. Anyway, It seems to be one of these beers to have very cold in a hot summer day though.
On draught. Massive corn and straw. Pale gold with minimal white head. Taste is crisp and slight malt grain. Moderate bitterness on finish.
Pale yellow pour. Aroma of grass clippings and malts. Flavor is about the same. Crisp, and drinkable.
330ml bottle into glass. Slight sweet nose. Tiny flimsy head. Yellow with medium carbonation. Spritzy with a little malt then small tinny hop hit. Good clean finish. Refreshing if nothing else.

33cl bottle at home; Nordic Collection. Clear golden with a medium white head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Bitter with some sweet tones. Grain, malts, hay and some citrus. An ok pilsener.

8/20/20: This review is from a half liter can. Why do brewers use clear and green glass? Anyway - 

Upon opening, the nose was of grain and hops. After warming, there was a hint of tomato paste (!). What can I say? "There are more things, Horatio, in beer and wine then are dreamt of in your flavor wheels," to paraphrase the Bard. And then there are individual palates. No, I did not drink this with tomato sauce. The color is the usual pale yellow with a thick white head that laces and dissolves to a thin head. Mouthfeel has a soft edge with slight crispness.  The after taste's bitterness is balanced and lingers. The taste is light malt. BBY 4/21


This review is significantly higher. I attribute this to a more experienced palate.


Original Review 2.0 in 2015
Pours a pale lager yellow with a white head. Nose is faint cereal. Taste is weak malt, weak bitterness. Disappointing for a brewery with its history going back to Louis Pasteur and the beginning of the science of brewing. Oh, well. 11.2 oz ridiculous green bottle from a 12 pack poured in to a Carlsberg glass with laser etching on the outside bottom of the glass where it is useless (check the Budweiser glass where the etching is on the inside where it has a function),

Tasted under its exported alias Carlsberg Copenhagen 1847 for this rating. White, medium thick, very sticky head leaving complex lacing on the edge of the glass; colour is a cristal clear pale golden blonde with steady sparkling. Aroma lightstruck as expected (green bottle!), minerally, grainy, with a strong iron presence and hints of white bread, cheese spread and a bit of grass. Sweetish malty and corny taste, slight sourish graininess, thinnish and metallic with sharpish, minerally carbonation; finish of grassy and herbal ’Euro’ hops, more so than usual in a ’macro lager’ and ensuring a medium long, dryish finish, a bit astringently chemical as well. "That calls for a Carlsberg"? Not really, but I have to admit I had worse in this style. To classify this as a genuine ’Pilsener’, though, seems a bit unjust if compared to the classic Bohemian and German Pilseners!
Pale yellow pour. Aroma of grass clippings and malts. Flavor is about the same. Crisp, and drinkable.

Flaske, rett fra kjøleskapet på hytta: klar gylden med kort gardin/filmskum. Overraskende frisk aroma av epler og furunål, men smaken har en kunstig sødme i seg som kombinert med grønne epler trekker ned førsteinntrykket.
Bottle. Clear, yellow pour, thin medium head that doesn’t last long. Cereal, grains, slight herbal hop finish.
This beer is alright, its not a wery tastefull beer but i will say its a party beer..
hay, cereal, nuts, toast, floral, herbs, roastedcitrus, spruce, cheese, leather, earthy, cooked vegetables, smoke, pale, frothy, light-med sweetness, light-med body

25cl bottle at home. It pours a clear golden yellow colour with a thick and decent white head that lasts. Aroma is skunky, malty, very grainy and bread like and overall very yeasty. Taste is clean and crispy, with a very smooth bread flavor, a little brown sugar and sweet caramel profile, malty and a little bit bitter at the finish. It has a light body profile with a good amount of carbonation. It’s not superb, but it’s not that bad either. It’s a very drinkable beer.
A bright yellow pilsner with white head. Aroma is light fruity / malty. Taste is light bitter. A good beer, can drink a lot of them.

500ml can served in an ordinary glass.
A: Pours a pale golden yellow color forming a big bubbled and aired white head. Clear body, standard Euro Lager. Good retention and tons lacings left
S: Sweet grains, Lager yeasts and flowery hops. Good malty profile with classic bready Lager yeasts. Hops are also bit citrus 
T: Follows the nose. Sweet grains upfront, bready Lager yeasts tempered with citrus hops. Finish is smoothly bitter
M: Smooth and light body. Good carbonation. Upfront is sweet and bitter but aftertaste is smooth and grainy
O: Easy drinking beer. Classic Euro Lager. Nothing but an average session Lager
[ BA Review @ 10/12/2012 ]

0.33L bottle. Pours clear straw color with a thin white head. Aromas are fairly standard pilsener: primarily herby, noble hops and some mild cereal grain. Not much in the middle, then a long mild, dry hop linger. Thin body with a creamy(ish) mouthfee and active carbonation. Overall, nothing offensive, refreshing enough, but just pretty standard continental lager.

Transfer from BA review on 8-3-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance – The beer pours a clear golden color with a small white head of a more fizzy nature. There are tons of carbonation bubbles seen streaming up through the body of the brew popping at the surface as the head of the beer fades fast to leave very little lacing on the sides of the glass.

 Smell – The aroma is on the lighter side overall but is of a mainly grainy and malty in smell. Mixed with these smells is a little bit of grass, hay and lemon as well.

 Taste – The taste begins with a smooth bready malt taste mixed with a bit of a caramel sweetness. As the taste advances a little bit of grassiness begins developing on the tongue. The grassiness grows a bit stronger, which in the end with the malt and the lighter caramel flavors, leaves a crisp and clean taste to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel – The body of the beer is on the slightly thinner side with a carbonation level that is rather average. It is pretty much dead on in terms of carbonation and feel for the lighter tastes and smoothness of the brew making it very easy to drink.

 Overall – Not a flavor powerhouse by any means, but it is rather refreshing and easy drinking brew.

Nothing good about this beer, don’t know why I wasted money buying it. Even on draft, it’s bland, thin, grainy straw taste, metallic aroma, weak appearance. Taste was pale malt, maybe some hoppy bitterness, for the bottled version the finish was the downfall, an odd astringent artificial bitterness, truly made me cringe. On draft finishes cleaner than the bottled version but still doesn’t strike me as refreshing. I recommend any European macro lager, except maybe Tuborg (which is also brewed by Carlsberg) over this one. Will be avoiding this going forward.

I got this beer in a WORLD BEERS packet (possibly the worst beer related buy I ever spent money on - the packet itself I mean, beers were alright).
A small green bottle of 250 ml, with only its neck covered with a label, while a relief of the word CARLSBERG can be found four times around the bottle.
I crack the bottle open and a smell of malts goes straight into my nose. The head is white in colour when I pour it, one finger in height and seems thick in texture. A lot of bubbles rising hastily to the top. The head disappears after a while, leaving a thin film covering the sutface of the beer, but no lacing around the glass.
The aroma of this beer comes mostly from the malts, with a nice strong smell. Some hops aroma too, but very faint.
The taste is very malty too, thus sweet. But only at first, since the aftertaste is pleasantly bitter. Very refreshing on a hot day like this one.
Dry on the palate, quite thin on the body and light carbonation, give this beer a high drinkability.
Overall a very nice beer. I had it many times before but mostly straight from the bottle and I could also easily find a cold one at my local bar. Now that I can’t find it around the corner anymore (except in cans which I’d rather not) I appreciate it much more.

Draught in Hong Kong. Clear yellow beer with a medium white head of short duration. Nose and taste of grainy sweet malts balanced by a light grassy hop bitterness. Medium body with average carbonation. Better than most Asian lagers but certainly not "the best lager in the world".

Tried from bottle as Carlsberg Hof. Clear yellow to golden color, small white head that disappears fairly quickly. Smell is pretty superficial, taste is a little better. Malts, hay, lightly grains, slightly bitter. Average lager.
Dentro de las grandes cervezas producidas a nivel mundial considero la Carlsberg la mejor de ellas. Parecida a la Heineken pero con mejor gusto y paladar.

From bottle. Served in a 25cl Pilsner Glass. Crystal clear.
Aromatic notes: bready and Salz hop.
Disappointingly basic !
For summer only and if you made sport before, otherwise it’s not worthwhile drinking such a p...
Draught at the Grant Arms, Birmingham. Quite prodigiously fizzy - remarkably so. Not much flavour, but not offensive and quite refreshing. Very easy to drink.
Bottle...light tan color, thick head. taste is ricey with some funky aftertste but pretty drinkable to have at a game over and over again without caring.

I do not write reviews typically, though I was compelled to do so in this case. I feel that Carlsberg is being given a bad name to all of the ale and IPA lovers, and to a Lager guy, this is an excellent beer. Looking at the top 50 of this website, it is ale after ale, and I just wonder how much of the rating has to do with ale lovers being more vocal. This is an excellent lager, fans of Amstel and Stella would agree.

I’m attempting to reach the next level in my continental award, and was quite suprised to see I’ve never reviewed a beer from Denmark, so my 300th review is this ubiqutious product. I expect all of us will have had a glass at some point, so I’ll sum it up as typical mass-produced generic, lowest common denominator Euro swill. As for being "probably the best lager in the world", probably not even the best lager on the highest shelf of the smallest offy.
Pint @ George. Meh. Smells rusty and looks nondescript. Tastes rather bland with a less-than-pleasant aftertaste. Not much to like about this one, but it seems to go great with football.

very nice for a lager, finaly something that stands out !  like everything a lager should have, light looking body, good foam, carbonation that is just right, easy drinkable, a unique(-er) taste ! probably the best lagerin the world ? could be yeah :p but way to much other ones to trie before i can say that !

Gold with decent, creamy, white head / Sweeter corn and honey nose / Medium body, sweet and fat with low carbonation, somewhat  cloying, with fair finish / Simple, dull flavors of corn and honey / Below average.
0,5l bottle. Brewed in Serbia by Carlsberg Srbija. 5%. A clear blond lager with average aroma, soft taste and watery finish.
Thin aroma has hay and bit hops. Clear straw yellow, short head. Taste is plain and thin, bit metallic. Short finish. Thin feel. Nothing special.
No character at all. Very boring beer. Pale colour, flat, a little bit carbonation and some bitterness.
On tap and on bottle. Typical macro brewed lager => tasteless. I don’t recommend it...
Standaard als het maar zijn kan. Licht zoete tonen als bloemen en graan in aroma alsmede in smaak, waaronder hazelnoot, met flauwe bitters aan het eind. Uit blik.
Taste is easy to forget - bothing but bitter with no special palate. White foam, stays long. Golden colour with some dark nute. Just another commercial lager.
On tap at the Dray. Pours light yellow with a big four finger head. Smell lager yeast, dough. Taste a bit metallic, lagery. Certainly not "probably the best lager in the world".

Not sure why but I live this beer. Pretty standard lagar. Easy drink ability   Crisp and clean. Good stuff but I can see why others dislike
