Cerveza suave y que se bebe bastante fácil pero no es nada del otro mundo...

Pours gold with a pretty darn impressive head and lacing for a pale lager.  Green bottle creates a bit of skunking, but there is also some good hay and grass (noble hops?) in the aroma.  Taste is light with a nice hops kick in the middle and end.  Dang, this is pretty good.  Aftertaste is nice as well.  Great summer sipper.  It’s got Stella and Kirin Ichiban beat, IMO - prior to tonight (June 29, 2012), those were my favorite pale lagers.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.
From can. Clear yellow colour with small head. Aroma and flavour is malty sweetish.

Probably the most overrated beer in the world. As far as danish pilsner goes, both Tuborg and Ceres are better. ’Hof’ is the slightly sweeter choice of the three, whereas Tuborg’s ’Green’ is the dry choice. Ceres Top somewhere in between. All in all this is everything that’s wrong with massproduced goatpiss.

Can. Brewed in Ceylon by Lion Brewery. 4.8%. Golden with thin white dissipating head and no lacing. Smells bready with a metallic tinge and a hint of honey. Flavor has a hint if honey, too. Crisp and fairly high carbonation but not watery. Light dry finish, but not bitter. Pretty good for a light beer.
Draft. No head. Light straw to gold in color. Noble hops on the aroma, bordering on noble hops. Taste is mostly malt forward with a slight hop finish.

Bottle. Pours a yellow body, with a low white head that diminishes quickly, leving almost no lace. Very grassy aroma, almost no taste, no bitterness at all, like drinking soda... Thin body, ok carbonation level, watery texture. Honestly, I wasn’t expecting much, but I surely thought that this beer was better that the other lagers. Disappointment.

In honor of me being awesome and the UEFA EURO 2012 matches heating up, I consumed this today. Can: (440ml) The Official beer of the UEFA Cup...that must make it fantastic... The nose is far from the grassy graphic on the can.  This semi skunky lager was surprisingly simple to consume.  I longed for another as the bright golden liquid quickly diminished from the glass.  Drippy bright white lacing.  Not much corn.  Medium bodied and refreshing.  No finish to speak of.  I can see why people get out hand when consuming this.

Unpleasant appearance and aroma. Drinkable when already drunk or if it’s the only choice available (but even then I’d probably leave it). Carlsberg has a few reasonable beers in its range. This, their flagship lager, however is just plain bad.

Location/Date:Draft at RFD’s, June 8th, 2012 pre-SAVOR



Appearance: Pours a gold clear. 
 

Aroma: Aroma is light malt, citrus.
 

Taste: Light bitterness, malt, no bad aftertaste.
   

Palate:Light body



Summary: An easy to drink pale lager that, by virtue of being on draft, prevents the green bottle skunky flavor.
Transferring my data before I used to rate at Ratebeer. I’ll add a more detailed description as I drink it again
On tap at Steinbeck’s in Decatur, GA. Light beige color, good carbonation. Some Maltiness. Not a great beer, but not awful.
Clear golden.  Tastes like fermented creamed corn.  No head.  Fizzy.  Smells.
On tap, Norway. Golden color with small white head. Aroma has sweet hops. Flavor is average. Easy drinkable, of course.
pale, clear, skunky, woody, dough, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, medium sweetness, lightly bitter,

For a pale lager I’ve always found this one dependable. The hops are usually often so low in this style that you don’t notice them, but for Carlsberg you do, and I think they’re well integrated with the malt. "Clean" is the word of the day. Macrolagers get much, much worse than this.
Can, 33cl@home. pours clear golden with a small white head. Slightly grainy aroma. Flavor, some grain. a bit of hops. Clean bulk lager but no spirit or feeling.
This is the taste of Denmark. Works best in a square in Copenhagen with a red sausage and bread. The taste is fresh, light and malty with faint hop notes.

Thanks to Seymour for this.  Pours clear pale yellow with a small white head.  The aroma has pale malt, phenolic spice, corn and cream.  Fairly light body with soft carbonation for the style.  The flavor starts off with pale malt and lots of peppery spice.  The finish has some sourness added and a fruitiness that give it a sweet-tart flavor with mixing of the spices.  Okay for the style.

Dieses Bier ist sehr Süffig und ein bisschen zu mild und wässrig. Schwacher Geschmack nach hopfen, dazu eine säuerliche note im Nachgeschmack. Da es sehr Süffig ist, ist es für Partys gut geeignet, doch sind die 5% alc. zu beachten, da es vorallem Leute die wenig Alkohol trinken wegen der wässrigkeit leicht unterschätzen könnten. Fazit: Mittelmäßig, ich hatte nur 5min was von diesem Bier (dann war´s schon leer), das ist zu wenig, vorallem in dieser Preisklasse.
	
Test vom 4.9.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,9,14,8,9,9 - 9,80

Nothing special from this beer.
Tastes as if it is off, very grain/bread like with a strange bitter-sweet aftertaste that is generally quite unpleasant.

Bottle:
Medium airy white head, disappears quick and leaves some islands floating on top of a clear yellow golden colored beer.
Smell malts, hops, herbs, grass ish, typical smell. Everybody knows what it smells like.
The taste is so very typical too; hops, malts, bitter, light herby…
Light bitter grassy herby malty aftertaste.
Medium carbo, soft tingly mouthfeel, low to lightly medium body and a light watery texture.
What a beer! Hehe…   ;-)

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours amber with about a finger of white head. Light aroma of some bready malt and floral hops. Taste is the same, lightly bitter. Medium-light bodied with a somewhat thin texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, not bad. I would drink it again.
Pale gold lasting white head. Slightly hoppy aroma. Its an alright pale lager some hop on finish

In lack of things to do I might as well live rate this one from Kastrup Copenhagen SAS lounge. Taped by my self into a completely standard milk-glass, this one pours a clear golden body with a small quickly fading white lager-head. It smells light grainy and malt sweet. The aroma is as standardized and macro-boring as they get, still no bad aromas. It tastes also quite grainy and dull. Sweet malty with a hint of watered down hops. Not much excitement pumping through my veins drinking this, and not my choice #1 on this national day of Norway, but in lack of alternatives the devil eats flies. Thank you, and farewell. 17.05.2012
Malty, dry, but not very many hops. Drinkable a nice if cold. Just another lager.
Awful, just awful. Lack of body, thin texture, very very poor head... Nothing I would ever recommend!
Bottle. Not a bad pilsener. Like expected, all the usual pilsener hints. Some hops there too. Refreshing. Not bad.

Can at home. Pours a clear straw colour with a small white head. Grassy aroma with some sweet corn. The flavour is slightly acidic with more grass and sweet corn, along with some fruits. Thin and watery mouth feel, but with an okay medium bitterness. Not a very exciting beer.

C’mon people, this beer really deserves some higher overall ratings. Poured a cool engraved green 330mL bottle into a nucleated pint glass. Nice golden-amber color with fluffy white foam which subsided but left a little lace. Overall fairly neutral, but faint aromas of mild malt, freshly cut grains, white bread and pronounced flowery, delicately peppery and musky hops. Like Heineken but crisper; more refined like Stella, but better yet. Despite the green bottle and being shipped across the Atlantic Ocean, no oxidation or spoilage problems. Lasting evidence of superior Danish brewing science. Nice subdued and balanced flavor, just a little malt sweetness and hops bitterness. No obvious adjunct faults. Light body, spritzy carbonation, refreshingly dry finish. "Probably the world’s best lager"? Probably not, but a damn good one, and one of my category favorites. Recommended over any American macro.

Can 0,5l - S.C. Carlsrom Beverage Co. S.R.L. Romania. 
Appearance: Clear golden color with a large white head. 
Aroma: malt, lemon, grass, corn 
Taste:  light sweetness, lightly sour and a moderate bitter taste
Palate: lively carbonation, medium body
Overall: a good pale lager. A plus for not being so skunky.
0,5l can and bottle. Can is brewed by Saku, Estonia and bottle in Lithuania. Doesn’t make any difference where its brewed. Same "I-taste-same-in-every-position" story. Less carbonation please.
Tap at local bar. Gold color, medium white head. Malty taste, slightly bitter finish. Ok lager.

Can, produced by  S.C. Carlsrom Beverage Co. S.R.L. Romania.
Pale golden liquid with long white head.
Aroma has notes of bread, malt and corn.
Light bittersweet taste with an average carbonation.
dough, grass, hay, soy sauce, pale, hazy, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, fizzy, bitter,
Light straw color; Light to medium body; Aroma of malt, & grain; Flavor of slight sweet malt, some hops, and grain; Not that bland but a little watery; Decent overall.

Botella de 330ml.Vaso Pilsner. Saboreada muchas veces.Color dorado pálido. Corona blanca que sin ser compacta presenta buena retención. Aromas habituales en las Euro Pale Lager: lígero malteado, levadura lager y aromas florales y herbaceos de lúpulo. Sabor malteado moderado, sin dulzor. Amargor seco en el intermedio que permanece hasta el final. Paladar fresco. Cuerpo lígero, carbonatación media. Agradable asimilación. 
330ml.Bottle. Footed Pilsner glass. Enjoyed many times. Pale Golden. Crystal clear. White crown not really thick but shows fairly good retention. Usual Euro Pale Lafer smelling: slightly malty, notes of lager yeast , floral/hoppy aromas. Mildy malty flavor, no sweetness. Dry bitter in the middle lingers to the finish. Crisp mouthfeel. Light body, medium carbonation. Pleasant drinkability.

Originally rated March 2005. Pours a light golden colour with a foamy head that leaves some lacing. Aromas are light, some sweet malt. Very smooth mouthfeel. Taste is slightly bitter at the end, and then it goes into a crisp sweet aftertaste. I like that good refreshing taste. One of my favorite bar beers, for swillling action. Better from the bottle.
The budweiser of Copenhagen. Cheap. Session. Slam. Yes may I have another. No brain. No thought. No taste. Social. A filler.

330 ml can. Pours clear yellow with a decent foamy white head. Neutral aroma with hints of malt and hops. Waterlike taste has hints of malt and hops. Light bodied and watery mouthfeel. Slightly too stingy carbonation. Short finish. Nothing really bothers in the beer because it doesn´t really taste like anything.
golden straw color, aroma of grain, skunk, flavors of grain, hay, skunk, its alright for the style, but its a really bad style

330 ml bottle bought somewhere in Copenhagen by a friend. Pours clear pale yellowish golden with a white head that leaves some trace while dissipating. Smell is malty sweet with bread and hints of caramel and floral hops. Taste is sweet, slightly bitter, slightly floral and slightly metallic with bread and hints of caramel and orange peal. Mouthfeel is heavily carbonated, slightly watery and thin to medium bodied. Finish is short-lived and sweet with yeasty old bread.

can    pale yellow  white head   slight grainy aroma  . a hint of bitterness on the taste  but overall just another average watery bland commercial lager with nothing going for it  . Cannot understand how this stuff is so popular .
Cheap and chemical, usual beer, not for joy. Very promoted, and has lots of retail points. yo cant expect much from industrial powder beer.

Can 330ml. Pours clear yellow with medium white head. Aroma is honey with metallic hints. Taste is medium bitter. Watery body with good carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piss Piss Piss Piss Piss lager beer which looks yellow and tastes of straw and wine and not piss as such but merely a rather inferior alcholic beverage to those great real ales us British citizens have come accustomed to, certainly this lager should go back to Denmark where Peter Schmichael can drink it with bacon.
Faint malt aroma. Pale yellow. Crisp bitterness that quickly cleans the palate. Has a hint of skunkiness but not enough to be a distraction. Surprisingly refreshing and light.

I’ve drank Carlsberg a million times and will again I’m sure. An average commercial lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes.  First reviewed 1/1/2009.  Poured from a 12 oz can into a pint glass.

Carlsberg pours a golden straw color, with a quickly fading 3 cm head. Leaves no head or any lacing on the glass.
A little bit skunky in the nose, but I get a slightly sweet and hoppy aroma.
The most noticeable taste is the grainy, semi-sweet malt. The taste is somewhat light, but pleasant. Hops kick in with a nuanced citrus kick, and I am left with a little bit of sulfur at the end. A pretty simple lager flavor, but not too bad. 
Pretty light-bodied, but not as watery as other macros. Smooth, but not much bite. Lower than average carbonation, maybe due to the can.
Light carbonation and slightly sweet taste make it easy enough to drink. Not a bad tasting beer, but not something I would go out of my way to get. 
"Probably the best beer in the world." Not so much.
Bottle. Pours clear yellow with medium white head. Aroma is honey with metallic hints. Taste is medium bitter. Watery body with good carbonation.
Gold colour. Aroma of grains, skunky. Nothing special, just a regular commercial lager.

A simple lager with very little flavor or aroma. This won’t complement anything but many trips to the bathroom!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
středně tmavá zlatá barva, vůně výryzná po praženém sladu. Středně hořká chuť s těžkým nasládlým dozvukem.

330ml bottle pours a pale golden color with a small white head that leaves only a small trace of lace on the glass.  Aroma is light grains and grassy hops.  Taste is light malty sweetness with a strong bitter finish.  Light to medium body and acceptable carbonation.  A slight step up from a typical macro lager.
On tap in Dubai of all places. Pretty similar to the UK version, still a light mass market lager, but slightly better than many peers.
World famous Pale Lager. Nothing interesting, but not so bad seeing the price.

German Version, 5% ABV
Wässriger, hell zitrusartiger Beginn. Überhaupt kaum aromatisch, zum Ende gering bitter. Hallo Geschmack, wo bist du? 6/5/8/4/6/4
I have had way to many of these on many weekends but still like the taste, and the simple way it gives me. Not a wow factor here but good cheep beer.
Clear golden color with average white head. Aroma of grain. Very standard lager with taste of hay.

A: Translucent gold, with soft white head that disappears as expected

S: What you can smell is grassy and very continental

T: Soft continental hops give an overall floral character which is balanced against subtle sweet malts... 

M: smooth and clean

O: simple and enjoyable... good for a long night

When 2pac said "this beer wasnt too fucken great. my dickhead mate eddie liked it. dickhead." he expressed some animosity towards a friend who presumably encouraged him to try the beer. 



The beer pours a very nice golden color with a big white head that leaves lots of lacing on the glass. 



The aroma is a sort of mixture of corn flakes and corn tortilla chips. The beer is very sweet smelling and lightly fruity. 



The flavor thankfully does not follow the corn on corn aroma ques. In fact it tastes clean and only mildly sweet. The beer has a well defined crisp malt character and a light toastiness. The beer is very light on hops but does display a mild amount of spiciness. 



I also do not trust Eddie’s taste in beer.
That’s it, the everywhere beer and everytime to drink it! Good and simple one!

Bottle 330ml @ home

Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain and floral hops. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Una cerveza refrescante para el verano o para tomar en compañia de amigos, no es mala pero prefiero otras cervezas de este tipo.
When I see this I don’t get that excited. It’s okay, but not the world’s best beer by a long shot.

a decent "drinking lager", but even for that has too much uncomfortable bitterness and no inner balance. a nice standard for mass consumption, but there are a lot more neutral, uncharacteristic beer out there to enjoy.
Norway, Epcot. Clear golden; white head. Aroma of grain; typical pale lager, but no skunk or anything. Light bodied. Really good for a generic macro pale lager.
Can. A typical nordic style lager for the masses. Pale yellow colour. Aroma of malt and yeast, a little spicy. Taste is yeasty-sweet, medium bodied.
Weak and well below average lager with a slight slimy aftertaste, plenty of carbonation
Bottle. Nothing at all wrong with this beer. Just doesn’t stand out from the pack of pale lagers that swamps the market
Nice every day lager. Bittersweet taste with a bitter finish.... Not bad....

Clean light orange fizzy lager with white head. Smells like another Euro pilsner, maybe a bit more malty. Taste is quite sweet - if anything. No hops or characters, as to be expected. At the bottom of its class.
Bottle. Pours yellow with no head or lacing.aroma is not evident. Taste is light and mildly sweet. Ok

0.33 bottle. Easy to omit hops aroma. Clear, straw-colored liquid with big, thin head disappearing nearly as fast as it appears. Barely noticeable bitter taste paired with superbly light body and thin texture. Vigorous bubble sensation and slightly sour, abrupt finish. Very average, commerce pale lager, boring and unworthy of attention.

.5l bottle found in a Belgrade supermarket. Long overlooked that I hadn’t rated this one. Ends up a nice enough Euro macro lager, some sharp features. But weak soda-water is the main body of this, lemon, grain. Spritely carbonation, robust and nice infrastructure but not interesting in the end. Not far off, but on the nicer side, of the north-western European ’greens’ .. tuborg and heineken. Dont think it would give me a headache
Sample at KC Beerfest 10-22.  Comes pale yellow with a small white head.  Faint aroma of malt and grass.  Taste is metallic with some malt.  Average at best.

Hotel in Shenzhen, China. Pours typical lager yellow, with a modest head. Taste has a solid back bone of malt and the finish is hoppy with lemon and a bit floral I think. No skunkiness. Probably the best macro I’ve had. Medium palate, not too thin and stuck around but not too long.

Pint on draft pours straw with thin white head.  Aroma is weak a bit of hay and the usual lager malt aromas. Taste is a bit.sour but very light layered with sweet malt.  Body is medium and finish is a bit lingering with sweet malt.  Way better than macro brewed lagers
Bottle 33cl. Golden colour, off-white head. Aroma is malted, cereal. Taste light bitterness. On palate soft body with lively carbonation, Bitter finish.

A very boring and simple pilsner without any variation in the aroma and palete. Although some bitterness is found.
Ironically this is the one beer I have been drinking the most:-).
Lättdrucken öl som passar bra till pölse och till annan skräpmat. Men ingen finöl direkt...
50cl bottle. Pours pale golden with a small white head. Fruity malty smell, fruity malty taste, refreshing. Malty finish.
Bottle. Color golden yellow with small head. Aroma grass, lemon. Taste lemon, grass.

500ml Bottle.  Appearance is golden yellow color with fizzy, off-white head.  Aroma is sweet malts with sustained grassy and herbal hop notes.  Flavor is bubble-gum sweet with hints of grass and herb and some wheat flavors moving into the finish.  Palate is light- to medium-bodied, thin and somewhat watery texture, fizzy carbonation, and a weak but sweet finish.  Just another weak European lager.
Ölen alla svenskar har druckit? Klaasisk ljus pilsnar med vitt snabbt försvinnande skum. Svag doft av hö och gräs. Ganska söt med antydan av majs. Tråkig

I had a friend from Denmark. Soren. He swore this was the greatest of beers. After trying it, I was perplexed. Upon further investigation he had only tried macrobrews and his national pride also boosted the rating to this flacid, simple carbo water

33cl bottle. Drank out of the bottle, so not sure of appearance. The nose has lemon, pale malt and a litle big of vegetable oil. The taste has lemon and pale malt. The palate has a light structure and texture but it cleans ok. Overall, one of the better mass-produced lagers.
Mi ricordo quando ero piccino, che bevevo la Carlsberg e pensavo di bere la miglior birra del pianeta...
473ml can, Canadian packaging says 5% ABV. I found this to be a fairly generic European lager. Nothing all that great or bad.

12oz bottle. Pours golden and clear with a thin short-lived white head with large (but not quite soapy) bubbles. Aroma is grainy with touches of bready sweetness and slight floral hops. Flavor starts malty and bready with subtle notes of oxidation/cardboard. Slight grassiness that fades to a balanced finish with a neutral hop bitterness and some grainy malt sweetness. Grainy slightly yeasty after-taste. Mouthfeel is medium in body with surprisingly soft carbonation. Overall, drinkable - not terrible for a session beer - but not nothing great. It would definitely be better if it were fresher.
Bottle common. Contrary to their slogan, this is nowhere near the world’s best beer - just another generic pale macro.

12 ounce bottle from Whole Foods Market, Charlottesville, VA, opened 3/17/11. Ah yes, the joys of the green bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a medium fizzy white head that fades quickly. Once the mass quantities of skunkiness clear out a bit, an aroma of grassy hops, more skunk, corn, faint grainy notes. Kinda musty. The taste is toasted grain, corn and grass. Tart finish. Thin bodied. Not good.

Refrigerated green bottle poured into a shaker.  Medium lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and smooth texture.  Taste is medium light bready malt with a hint of crisp hops in the finish.  Simple, but really good for a pale lager.
Tap@ Strandby marketplace. Small head good carbonation. Low aroma but a fresh dry pilsner taste close to nothing . Grew up with this beer.  Nothing much than a thirst killer

Very pale straw colour with a white head.  The aroma is vaguely tropical lager-like.  Clean and light with a little bit of light grassiness.  A touch of sweet cereal malt.  The flavour is moderately bitter although there is very little in the way of hop character.  Watery palate (no surprise there) but I’ve certainly had worse beers in this category.

Bottle, Danish version: Pale golden with a white, very small head. Grainy, green aroma - like most Danish mainstream pilsners. Medium sweet with late small and very mild grassy bitterness. Bland and unpersonal, but OK in very small quantities.

Regular beer. Nothing too special. Bit of a cripsy mouthfeel. Slightly more Regular beer. Nothing too special. Bit of a cripsy mouthfeel. Slightly more wort-like then others. Decent but not too great.
the good classic beer of the world, one of my favorite when I am abroad and home.
Yellow with white head. Weak smell of bread and malt and weak alcoholtastes. Quite boring beer but works okay if you are thirsty.

0,33 l can at home. ABV 4,5%. Fingerthick, creamy, white head on a clear, pale golden body. Fair lacing. Perfume, sweet bubble gum, light malts and flowers on the nose. Sweet, bitter flavors and a taste and feeling of cardboard. The finish is long and bitter with chemical notes. Watery, bland and light bodied.

From a 330ml bottle on 13/7/2011. Brewed in Australia by Foster’s under the ’supervision’  of Carlsberg, ABV 4.8%. Pours a light yellow straw colour with a decent head. What aroma can be detected is unpleasant. Little flavour is evident either, just a slight hint of sweet grainy malt, and the faintest hint of citrus hops. A very ordinary lager.

4,6% version. Clear pale yellow with a white head. Aromas of some malt but very bland and dull. Light body and quite watery, malt in the taste. Weak bitterness and a light sweetness. Drinkable but boring.
500ml can. Golden colour. Aroma of malts, grains, hops. Bit of a metallic taste to it. Standard stuff, although not the worst choice.
Golden, big frothy white head. Malty but unclean aroma. Flavour is nothing to be exited about. Not much of anything. Some grass, smome malt... The whloe imression is a bit "gloomy".

On tap at a restaurant in Ebeltoft. But a rating based on approx. 100.000 earlier samples in cans, bottles, and taps... A pale yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma is sweet malts with a yeasty and hoppy nose. Taste is hoppy and dry with a metallic, shortlived aftertaste. Light and dry palate. Your standard pale lager, but there are worse around...
Not bad considering...  had it a bunch of times in Taiwan and just now in a can in Kuala Lampur.  A little better than most beers in Taiwan, but then most beers in Taiwan...

Bottle @ home. Pours clear light golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grass, apples. Taste is malt, light grassy hops and sweet fruit. Thin to medium body, high carbonation. Not the worst macro lager out there

Pours a pale… ah, whatever, you all know exactly what a standard macro brewery pale lager looks like. Aroma is sweet malts and hops, quite clean. Medium sweet and light bitter taste. Slightly metallic feel, but not too pronounced. Light, thin and boring, but not exactly bad.

[33 cl bottle, from Kiwi, Valle, Oslo]
Good tasting pale larger.  Again, I was shocked at the low ratings.  Clean, crisp, refreshing malty taste.  This is Denmark’s version of Budweiser, but much better.

Pours a golden color with a white head. Some semblance of hops in the aroma. Not much in the flavor department, unoffensive is the best word for it. Easy to drink, but that’s not a surprise based on how little flavor it has.

Bottle @ home. Pours a golden, slightly orange, yellow appearance with a white head. Fairly strong lager aroma from even a couple of feet away that’s also a fairly bland and pale malty. Nice pale malty lager body with a touch of fruity sweetness. Fairly crisp finish. One of the better pale lagers.

On Tap. Pours deep golden hue with light carbonation.  Aroma is of light bready malt and slight hint of hops.  Light, smooth body.  Taste is a little bit of malt, a little bit of hops but mostly tasteless.  I wonder if people drank this beer with closed eyes would they realize the drink beer?
golden, white foam, sparkling, medium bitterness, medium body, pretty watery but there are worse beers around (*cough*Heineken*cough*)

Die Flasche des deutschen Carlsberg sieht ganz ok aus. 
Im Geschmack kommt eine übertriebene Bitterkeit zum Vorschein, die sich auch in den Nachgeschmack durchzieht. 
Da nützt auch das etwas zitronige Aroma im Mittelteil nichts. 
Mode-Bier ohne große Finessen.Test vom 24.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Not a lot going on but better than Sort Guld IMO. Pours a light yellow. Aroma is malty with bread. Taste is fairly weak but decently enjoyable. Unlike some other big brands (eg Heineken), carbonation is balanced.
Can. Pale clear yellow with a medium white head. Aroma and taste is malt and grain. Pretty watery. Decent carbonation.

330ml can



Bland, metallic pale lager with little to no taste. Generic lager, nothing special.
275 ml bottle, Sheffield, UK. Medium gold colour, thick frothy head. sweet peppery aroma, sweet flavour then transition to a long dry finish. One of the better cheap lagers around.
Aroma is somewhat lacking and skunky. Appearance is golden, clear with fizzy white head.  Light, bitter taste with an unpleasant aftertaste.
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma is skunky hop and a little sweet malt. Flavor is sweet malt with some fruity apple notes.

Rating #512, bottle at the union 
 


Well, even though this was one of the first beers I ever tried, even though it is probably the danish national beer, and even though I’ve been way to drunk in this brew way too many times, I’ve never really noticed all the facettes about it. So, when I was at a meeting in the union and Carlsberg Hof was served, I took the chance as I’d never buy this stuff by myself anymore. This is of course the standard danish bottled version at 4,6% ABV. Appearance is quite standard: Deep golden and with a somewhat lasting, bubbly head. The first dissapointment was the aroma. Allthough, I already at the time had realised that this wasn’t gonna blow me away in a mouth and tongue orgasm, I expected more from the aroma than this indistinct sour aroma that oozed from the glass. Luckily, the flavour was way better. This is actually a rather well-tasting pale lager. It starts out with the sourishness from the aroma, but then it actually shows some slightly traceable yeast and some rather obvious malts. In a way, these malts seems more roasted than in the usual standard lager, and the flavour all in all seems not as diluted as many other big commercial macrobrew brands. Finish is bitter hopped, but of course not more than making sure that it appeals to the hordes of beer drinking festival guests and random guys at couches in their living rooms. Palate is soft, but carbonation is a bit to strong for my liking, and thereupon the brew seems a bit watery. All in all a fair standard pils, no better than a lot of other brands, but absolutely not worse either.
Bottle at Hogan’s in Gainesville, FL.  Drinkable, but nothing exciting about this one.  Very typical Euro pale lager.
Carlsberg is best enjoyed in the original glass and chilled to 3°C. Drink it fast to prevent it from warming up and flatten. Being served from a draught is far out the best way to enjoy this beer.
Bottle. Pours gold, no head. Not really much to talk about, but better than a bud I guess

Halvány sárgás szín, nagyon élénken pezseg, hófehér habja villámgyorsan eltűnik. Illata kissé malátás és kartonpapíros, akárcsak az íze, ráadásul baromi vizes, na meg persze irreálisan drága... Egy semmilyen, semmire sem jó sör ez. Nem tudom minek létezik.

Can into a pint glass...Pours a pissy super clear, light white head, gone right away...The smell and taste are both just god awful. Aroma is light hops with skunkiness. The taste is skunky too but has a horrible aftertaste that is just so bitter piss water it almost makes me choke when I swallow.

tap@bar: macro pale lager, very middling, very inoffensive, I can make out some corn and fleeting hops /// Had it again on draft a couple of times, I am going to up the score, it is not the worst pale lager & I have given far worse pale lagers the same score as I gave this one originally / if ever for some odd reason I were to choose between pale lagers, I might pick this one.
A watery boring mass produced beer. this was a big hit back in the 70’s as all the locals thought it was an import. Typical lager with all the bells and whistles, made for the masses.

Draught@Radisson Royal Hotel Bar, Copenhagen. Bought for me by a colleague and drunk to be polite. Actually not as completely foul as anticipated, just deeply bland and lacking in all areas. I suppose at least it was fresh being so close to the source. Faced with a choice between this and a soft drink I would probably go for the latter every time in order to save my liver for more worthy drinks that have some flavour to them. As shit mass produced pissy lagers go its probably not as bad as the likes of Fosters/Carling, but it ploughs a similar furrow.

Bottle. Tried at Wembley Stadium prior to Birmingham Citys stupendous Carling Cup victory. A massive £4.20 a pint it was pretty band but with more taste than I had expected. Some biiterness, quite smooth and drinkable if theres nothing else around. As my son Adam pointed oit it was quite ironical that this was the only beer available at a final sponsored by Carling. A choice of evils I suppose. What a match though!
Clean, crisp, euro lager. There is really not much more to say, it’s good after a hot days work.
Probably erm... yeah... a beer... I think. I’m not sure. I’ve had worse, I’ll have to admit.
Light yellow colour with little head. Aroma is quite hoppy and grainy. Taste is malty with some corn and a light bitter hoppy finish. Not bad but "Probably not the best beer in the world".
Multiple tastings. Getting caught up on life beer list. Never been a fan of these so have stayed away from them for awhile. Bland macro tasting lager.
A decent beer when you’re just thirsty. Pale yellow colour. Decent tasting lager that doesn’t stand out from the rest, but doesn’t disappoint either.

Erős marketinggel nyomul a sörgyár(csoport). Különben semmi extra.
Világos sárga, szénsavas, komlós egyszerű cucc. Iható...

Carlsberg Premium has a thick, white head, and a very clear, golden appearance, with lots of bubbles streaming up and not much lacing left behind. The aroma is a typical faint beer smell, and the taste is likewise an ordinary European pilsner flavor, yet with a stronger hop bite at the back end than one would expect. Mouth-feel is light and watery, and Carlsberg Premium finishes refreshing and mostly dry. Overall, it’s pretty good and worth a try.

RJT
Poor beer, that is just sublimated by the marketing around it. Simple lager with no particularity

Pours golden with a medium white head.  Has a typical grassy aroma of an average pale lager.  There is somewhat of a spice to the taste that I rather enjoy.  Light body with a clean finish.  This is a decent macro and I wish the bars in my area carried it.  I wouldn’t mind having one every now and then.
For a macro this isn’t’ pure garbage. I usually see it in the paper covered 12 packs, that is how i obtained my non-skunked bottle. It is a pale gold with a subtle grainy nose. Worth a tick.
It’s a very decent lager, it’s a nice European lager great look, and pretty nice taste
Not the worst pale lager with a good graininess to it along with a very crisp flavor, although the skunkiness of it is almost as much as Moosehead.

Tasted on 1/28/11 from a 330mL bottle purchased from Cost Plus in the Beers of the World pack.  Pours clear light orange with a thick white head that slowly recedes to thick lace.  The nose is light hay malt, some corn, light sweetness, and hops that have some floral and earthy qualities.  The flavor is lightly sweet hay malt up front, some corn on the middle, and lightly bitter and earthy hops on the back.  The body is very light with lively carbonation and a shorty lightly bitter hops finish.

330 ml. Bottle. Lager Glass. Poured a foamy white head that vanished in about a minute. Left a bit of lace on the surface and on the glass. Color is a clear gold. Aroma is dominated by malt. Cereal and bread aroma. Malt up front strong and sweet with flavor, tastes of cereals and sugar. Undertones of hop, and finishes slightly bitter. Crisp and clean. Standard mass market lager.
Not good, not bad. Not really into musky beers, but all around a decent beer for a huge company conglomerate beer. Not too shabby.
Clear pale golden with a small white head. Aroma is light malty and not much else. It has a light sweetness followed by a slight bitterness. A bit watery. 180111
Bottle.  Pours the standard pee-yellow that you’d expect.  Doesn’t smell as, frankly, off-putting as some of these macro lagers can get.  Flavor is meh...some straw/hay...not much hoppiness, no malt.

0,5 l bottle, bought in a random store, Bp, I think it was brewed at Carlsberg Serbia...

Poured pale golden with a foamy white head. Looks good. But smells average or worst. Straw and sourish yeast, minimal malt. Medium-weak body, sweet pale malt character, the bottom yeast with some grassy-herbal hop. Hoppy straw "aftertaste". Boring.

pours clear golden with decent head, no retention at all. minimum of pale malts, bread (no crust), sugary cheap graininess, very fruity and slightly sweet apples, few herbal-grassy notes. short bland finish. boring, not good but still drinkable if offered by a friend.
citrus, grass, golden, clear, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, thin feel, lively,
Pale color.  Pale aroma.  Pale flavor.  Pale soul.  Pale bottle.  But it’s only 2 bucks at the British Open Pub.
To me this is just another light lager to me with a slightly earthy-dirty tase.
500ml can, brewed in Croatia. Quickly disappearing foam with a little CO2, grainy malt smell at first, and salty hop taste after the taste. Clean medium bodied beer, but not the best.

Bottle (660ml): Pours a pale straw yellow, average sized, bubbly white head that fades.   Clean & with gain & hops aroma.   Some hop bitter to begin with & grain with hints of some citrus fruits.   Light bodied although not too watery with okay carbonation.   It is what it is, cheap pale lager aimed at the masses. Nothing exciting or special about it, just a solid cheap lager that is very drinkable.   (Full review at )
The taste is boring and watery, and it smells like a party you had some days ago when you forgot to clean up the floor.
Not unpleasant but very dull and boring beerm evem as a pale lager. Propably not the best beer in the world!
As I’ve said for numerous beers in the past, must be sampled ice cold to get through the pain. But to be quite honest I don’t mind this puppy at all.
Typical pale lager pour and smell, has a mildly sweet taste with woody afternotes, not bad for a megalager

head: bubbly , white away fast 

colour: clear, watery gold 

smell: pilsner malts, irony , watery and thin 

taste: refreshing, watery, irnoy, malty , a hint of sourness , but flat overall taste , it isn’t great but i must say carlsberg compared to belgian pils is still a bit beter

I like the bottle and it is probably my favourite sauna beer. It’s one of the better bulks, especially in this bottle. I find the can version much worse. It is malty and grainy. It is just the way I I want it to be in the sauna and sometimes even after it. Extra points for that.

My sister bought me a 355ml bottle at a 7-11 in Mexico City.Well the beer its not much dissapointing cause i didnt expect much from a Euro.Macro’Lager.
Has a lot of carbonation,a weak-grassy hop flavor and a nuce abundant foamy head.Other than that its a plain average Lager
In bottle; only ordered this as it was all the restaurant in paris had. Typical lager, nothing special at all ... would not order again
Why bother, I mean seriously? Tastes almost nothing, watered down lager-appearance and when you actually do manage to find a hint of taste it is almost unpleasant.

Draught. A beer that I always felt should be so much more. on first sip it can be nutty and vibrant but by the third mouthful is just bland. the fact it is now the main beer in so many football stadia is depressing

25cl bottle won at a pub quiz.
Certainly wouldn’t buy this beer.  I remember how bad it was in Copenhagen
Bottle @ home. Pale golden pour. Aroma has grassy hop and some malt, not bad. Flavour is quite malty, but only faintly sweet. Nice simple lager.
Solid enough pale lager, reasonably clean and balanced with better hop character than the UK version.

500 ml bottle @ home. Rated @ 22.3.2009.

Golden colour, medium-sized frothy head. Malty aroma with a hint of fruit. Malty taste, slightly metallic flavour. Light bodied, watery mouthfeel with lively carbonation. Basic lager.
This is a lager of Denmark. Aroma of sourness, with maybe some grassy notes. Doesn’t taste as bad as it smells, which is a good thing. Clean, crisp, with a good hop bitterness.
Fra dåse, flot gylden farve med flot hvidt skum, smager godt tørst slukker når den er iskold, ok fylde, igennem en god pilsner

Somewhat surprised that I hadn’t rated this - but then again, probably another one from the pre-ratebeer days.  Can’t see why I would have gone out of my way for a common macro-lager.  In any case, this was on draft at a random pub in La Defense in Paris.  Actually better than I recalled by quite a bit.  Medium gold, OK head, clear.  Aroma was actually nicely of floral hops.  Flavor was slightly sweet pale malt, a hint of DMS, and a faint floral finish.  Not bad for what it is.

Keg Extra Cold. Darlington FC. Lurid, almost fluorescent yellow. A medium white head, with decent lacing. Bitter notes, but on the whole overwhelmingly sickly sweet. Aroma is corn and damp cardboard. Nothing else detectable. This is however, very refreshing and cooling. Dry on the finish. Fine for washing away the dust.

Can 50 cl. A quite deep and smooth pils near to Germans one, nice body and perfume, properly hopped.
Good malt flavor, above the average of usual pils.

Cannette 500 ml. 5%. Couleur janue or, mousse blanche. Arômes de malt et maïs. Goût de céréales, maïs et très léger houblon. En général, assez fade. Mais se boit bien froide quand il fait très chaud, ça passe.
pours very nice head and retains well. This is one of the top macro beers and its nice on a hot summer day.

This is the Bud of Denmark. Aroma of sourness, with maybe some grassy notes. Doesn’t taste as bad as it smells, which is a very good thing. Clean, crisp, with a good hop bitterness that does give this beer something.

0,5 bottle 5% alc. Very popular beer in Europe but it is not good. Large corporation. Not the best.
 Soft sweety flavor. Hops less then average.  Usual supermarket crap. 
I will never else buy it.
This beer is much sweeter than I expected. It is light and drinkable, but the taste is too sweet and weak.
Bière blonde transparente avec une belle mousse, ample en bouche, arrière goût acide-amer intense.

Can, brewed by Saku (in Estonia) who is owned by Carlsberg. This beer is a safely played grassy lager to please the average taste. It does have a distinctive grassiness, which is why I cant call it "probably the most average beer in the world" like I wanted.

12oz can (5%) brought back from Costa Rica by my wife 

Appearance: Clear light yellow with a nice frothy white head that dissipates fairly quickly, no lacing in the glass 

Aroma: Pale malts, corn, yeasty 

Taste: Malts, yeasty, citrus with some medicinal flavors in the finish 

Not bad, not good...........
Not a bad beer, considering how easy it is to find. Lacks much depth in character, but it’s not like you have to go out of your way to get one.
Very clear, very light yellow, good head.  Green bottle equals skunky aroma.  Not my fault.  Overwhelming skunky aroma equals skunky hops taste.  Not my fault.  Yuck.  Brown bottle please!
Had on tap at Harps Pub, Chicago, IL.  Pours a clear golden yellow with medium head.  Taste is of straw, hay, and corn.  Boring pilsner.

On Tap- The beer has a light golden color with a light head. it seemed to have a slight sweet aroma, not offensive. The taste was a bit sweet and came across as crisp & clean, nothing distinct. Carlsberg is easy to drink and is good when having more than one. Again this is a middle of the road, non-offensive Danish beer. This is a very popular beer in Singapore and Malaysia.

Bottle from Systembolaget labeled as Carlsberg Export. Typical pale yellow beer with white head. Fruity aroma is stingy and has some hops. Sweetish malty aroma with a touch of hoppyness. Light to medium body. A drinkable, crispy mass lager beer.

Bottle.

Golden with a medium white head. Not so tasty, some grain, grass and bread. Also some metal. Thin body, very basic. It is likely to take some time before I drink this again.

the bottle was a total rip off of grolsch.  made in denmark.  I’m supposed to be swedish.  danish is close.  swedish people do some okay shit!  reason, volvo, arguably ikea, but this beer is not good.  barely any flavor.  maybe that’s the point.  lost my drive to drink after 1.5.  guess that’s not really a negative.  not buy again.
This is quite thin, but when you keep it in your mouth, there’s roast and caramel taste. [0,33 l can]

average creamy white head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. sparkling thin yellow body. aroma: light bread moderate hoppy. if and ff: light sweet moderate bitter; short duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation and metallic finish. sweet balanced overtone, tasty, slightly resembles a BP. R$8, it is worth R$5. doesnt stand at all to its mojo: probably the best in the world. 8s

Bottle from a "Kaiser" in Budapest, brewed by "Carlsberg Srbija".
Golden colour with a medium white head.
Grassy, yeasty nose.
Malty flavour, its light aroma contains mainly cereal malt, then some spicy/grassy hops and yeasty notes.
The finish is light spicy and dry.
A lower kinded, average pale stuff, not a big experience...

Draught @ Geronimo, Hagalund. Pale golden colour with next to non-existent white head. Weak grainy aroma with a hint of grass. Thin-bodied with somewhat grainy flavour along with some bitterness. Quite basic Nordic pale lager.

Out of bottle, an easy-drinking summer slugger, nothing more. Got it because the bottle was really neat, no sticker just embossed glass. Little or no reason to give this bear credence over other macrotypes. Good but probably will not get this again though.

I didn’t bring any of my own home made beer to the familys Midsummer party and Carsberg and Mariestad was what my father had bought. The Carslberg was pale with a fine white but short foam. The aroma was light malty. Taste is smooth without much bitterness and other tastes. Easy to drink but no beer I would pay much money for.
if carlsberg made beer, it would taste very average. on a hot day when you feel like you are dying of thirst, its passable
This is a pretty standard European pale lager. Nothing flashy, just a good session able beer.
Bottle@Norway.  Golden beer with a light head.  The aroma is lightly dry, and the flavour is lightly dry and yeasty.  Overall an average lager.

Draught in Chinese restaurant, London. Soapy hoppy aroma. Golden yellow colour. Dry hoppy flavour. Sharp on palate. Probably the best lager in the world? You’re having a laugh but it isn’t the worst either.
Well a pretty average bber,nothing special,a bit light,but generally OK,its aroma is quite tempting though.
Bottled, can and on tap. Golden color, with thin white head. Aromas malts and some fruit. Taste, grainy sweet with short aftertaste. If you are thirsty, it’s OK, but nothing more.

A - Yeasty
A - Light straw color with thin white head
T - Sweet with a light dry finish
P - Medium body with soft carbonation
O - Can’t believe it took me this long to try this beer. I was pleasantly surprised by this mass produced lager.

33 cl bottle. Pours clear, pale gold. Nice, foamy, medium-sized white head. Faint flowery hop aroma. Hint of corn. Ditto for flavor, plus a light sweetness that seems a bit artificial somehow. Hop returns somewhat bitterish in aftertaste. Watery and thin, as these things tend to be. Medium carbonation. Certainly not the best beer in the world, but a decent macrobrew lager.
Draught (Vesterbro Bryghus, Copenhagen) - Dark gold in colour. Malty aroma with hints of grain. Malty taste with corn and grain.
Pours a pale, yellowish clear color with a thin white head. Slightly skunky aroma with a similar taste. Light mouth feel, not bad, your typical light pils.

Bottle. Lightly yellow. A small head, that won’t hold. Sour, somhing not pleasant inside the smell, some spices. Taste: better then expected, but pale lager never will be my kind of beer probably. A littlle bit spiced-citrus taste.

Continuing my journey into the grey, regulated world of the Norwegian commercial beer scene with this classic Scandinavian macrolager: Carlsberg. Once an exotic import from Denmark, this is now just as common in Norwegian grocery bags as Ringnes or Hansa. Pours a pale orange clear body with virtually no head. Taste is mellow and bland. No points for originality to be found anywhere. Balanced in the usual malt/hop ration, very drinkable, and not bad. Just - as is usually the case with these beers - not very good either.
Weak bodied and pours straw in the glass. Nose and taste is slightly sour hops and malts. Rated 1/3/2000
Looks like pee at the Doctor’s office, scent is malts and some bread. Taste is, well, what there is is malty water. Better than the American macro’s but not by much.
Gold...clear...beer colored. The skunky nose I expected, but what followed was a bit of a surprise. It was maltier and more substantial than I imagined, with a little hop bite. Not terrible.

Clear, golden yellow colour with moderate carbonation and a fluffy white head. Yeasty, wheat aroma, very similar to most mass produced lagers. Bitter, watery taste with a hopped touch to it. Its stock standard. Ain’t terrible, ain’t great.
Pours a medium-light yellow with no head. Medium-high carbonation. Aroma is weak, but a bit of hay. Taste is pretty smooth, but a bit skunky.

Twelve ounce green bottle. Pours a clear light straw body with a small white head that immediately falls flat. No lacing. Aroma is wretched skunk(love those green bottles), nothing else comes through. Taste mirrors aroma, with skunky and sulfuric Euro-lager hops gone bad. Faint adjuncts. Horrid!
Pours a pale yellow color, almost no head at all.  Taste is pretty bland, kind of watery.  Little bit more of a kick than some of the other macros out there.  Go Liverpool!
(bottle) light gold with small white head. Slightly musty grassy hops aroma. Flavor is light malt with grassy hops finish.

500 ml can from Off licence, Labelled Carlsberg Export. Bready sweet aroma, clear pale straw colour. Big frothy head very lacey. Not much in the taste department, but smooth, i think wet bread when I’m drinking this. Drinkable macro best for swilling at the end of the night.

Can 50 cl from Casino Supermarket in Pontarlier (F). Golden blond, slightly sparkling, fine white foam. Aroma medium malt and hop, touch of acetone or plastic. Mouth sweet, bland, with bitterness of grains, then a short and dry end. Probably not the best of the world.

Carlsberg Breweries, Copenhagen, Denmark--Carlsburg Premium Beer--By Appointment To The Royal Danish Court--2009 11.2 oz. Green Bottle.  5.00% ABV--15 IBU’s.?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Pale Lager.  Big pillowy dense lacy white head.  Clear thin bright yellow gold color.  Crisp mild hop front.  Zesty dry sweet crisp thin butter caramel Pils malt Pale Lager all malt body.  Dry mild citrus clean refreshing quenching easy end.  Well made Macro Pale Lager.  Tasty.  Sampled 3/24/2009.  6-Pack $8.99.
Despite this being brewed at 5% Carlsberg Export for the UK market, the taste is average with no flavour just a bog standard lager, however it is drinkable on a townie night out for example
Contrary to many, I like this beer for its simplicity. It is indeed not a complex beer, but a good beer for a hot day, when you just want to cool down.

Pours a clear yellow with a thick white head. It has a mild aroma of grassy malt and tastes, likewise, of grassy malt. It is a very nondescript, lowest-common-denominator beer. It has no obvious defects, but nothing praiseworthy either. Overall, a very bland, mediocre beer.

Can.

A - Light straw yellow color with a large foamy white head. Decent retention.

S - Grainy, sweet corn smell with light hops.

T - Fairly light and clean. Good amount of corn, adjunct lager. Some citrus hops but the hops have more bitterness than citrus. Slight metallic and mineral taste.

M - Light, crisp, and somewhat drying.

D - Decent drinkability. Like the rest of the style it is easy to drink a lot and the flavor isn’t offensive, but it isn’t great. A bit less sweet, corn adjunct than others.

Notes: The slogan is "Probably the best lager in the world." This definitely isn’t true for me at least, but as far as similar beers go, this is pretty good. If you are in a place with limited beer selection, this isn’t a bad choice.
Typical Carlsberg, nothing to cheer about. Good for a lunch, but definately nothing for a tasting avent.
Aroma of sourness, with maybe some grassy notes.  Doesn’t taste as bad as it smells, which is a very good thing.  Clean, crisp, with a good hop bitterness that does give this beer something.
Draft.  Golden pour with thin head.  Grain and corn.  Crisp finish.  Not bad but not exciting.
One of only a couple of Danish imports readily available. Crisp flavor, pilsnerish, almost, but stronger
Sweet, malty grain flavor, very crisp clean finish.  Nothing special, but a decent mass produced beer.
Yellow with a fragmented head. Aroma of corn, rice and grass. The flavour is weak with sweet notes of corn and a metallic finish.

Few beers have such nostalgic value to me as Carlsberg. I was first introduced to this beer when I was on active duty in the U.S. Navy and my ship pulled into Copenhagen, Denmark for a liberty port visit. I remember drinking Carlsberg at every bar and restaurant I went, mostly because it was not only the city’s hometown beer, but of all Denmark’s as well. Having visited many other European cities I noticed it was popular and available everywhere I went. I remember thinking it was okay at the time but it didn’t leave much of a long-term impression on me.

Now that I’ve matured as an appreciator of beer I’m able to sit down and analyze Carlsberg for what it really is: the Budweiser of Europe. I don’t mean that as a compliment nor as a criticism, but mostly just a cultural comparison. It’s a drinkable beer with a decent taste but there isn’t anything remarkable about it.

POUR, COLOR AND AROMA

The beer pours smoothly to a clear straw color and forms a well-proportioned, bright white, foamy head which never completely dissipates and leaves significant lacing on the glass. Upon first pouring this beer has a very active amount of carbonation, but as it sits it calms down to the point of being almost completely tepid. This would be normal for a craftier brew like a brown ale or stout, but since Carlsberg is a pilsner it’s quite strange.

The aroma is fairly standard for a beer of the type, but the difference is this beer has a distinctly sweeter scent. It’s just slightly floral and fruity, not just standard malts as most beers of the type. 

TASTE

I haven’t tasted Carlsberg in nearly two years but all those memories came rushing back as I drank my first bottle. I remember thinking this beer tasted pretty generic at the time and drinking it now I find that to still be true. 

Anyone who’s ever had Budweiser, Miller, or Coors will be familiar with the basic taste of Carlsberg. The difference being this beer is slightly sweeter and doesn’t have the green apple aftertaste of the big American lagers. This is a pilsner after all, so it has a much crisper, cleaner taste than a standard lager. 

In fact, the problem with Carlsberg is that it’s so clean it’s bland. There isn’t much of a distinctive flavor noticeable here. It’s a generic beer taste that’s almost watery.

FINISH

I remember drinking a round of Carlsberg with my shipmates and noticing everyone comment to the effect that the beer was easy to drink. This is probably what makes it such a top seller since people will opt for a beer that’s easy to drink over a beer that’s well-flavored. 

Carlsberg’s thin taste is complimented by a smooth finish. Had it been even remotely coarse I think this would have been a mediocre beer, but the fact it drinks as if it were water puts it in good standing with most drinkers.

BODY

I don’t know of too many pilsners that are anything other than light in weight. Such beers are intentionally light in body and Carlsberg is no exception. I wasn’t able to confirm the amount of calories per serving, but I would guess it’s fewer than 150. Additionally, at 5% ABV it’s a bit more potent than Americans are used to for this style of beer. But then again this is the type of beer that can and should be accompanied by food so most drinkers probably wouldn’t feel overwhelmed.

FINAL THOUGHTS

I was under the misconception that Carlsberg is considered a fantastic brew on a global scale, but after doing a little research on the internet I realized it’s generally considered average no matter who you ask. I guess it’s that crown on the label that threw me.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AXzOcGg7LhQ

Aroma-Very light malt based with some slight hay/grass hops.
Appearance-Bright medium dark straw with white frothy head
Flavour-Cereal malt driven with plenty of well rounded bitterness
Mouthfeel-Dry and crisp with out being fresh.
Overall- for the style, this beer meets all criteria without being a stand out.

Danish Version:

Sweet malt with mild earth note.  Golden with very thin white head and no lacing.  Medium sweet malt with mild fruit flavour.  Medium bodied lager with mild bitter finish.

Can at home from local supermarket. ABV 5,5%. Pours a pale golden color with a thick foamy, white head. Corny and slightly malty average lager aroma. A bit grainy watery yet fresh flavor that is actually not quite bad at all. Nothing interesting going on, but that was to be expected from mass market lager.

I would have to throw this into the whole euro-lager ring, and based on that, this is a more drinkable beer than most. This is a simple beer, kinda on the lighter side but still good. I wasn’t expecting this to knock me out and it didn’t, but it was smooth and refreshing. You can count on this beer, unlike some of the other euro-lagers.
330ml bottle. Clearand bright gold colour with a modest white head that is nothing special. Basic malt and grain aromas that do nothing to enhance the experience. Lacks flavour and substance.

Draught, England.
Another standard pale lager. Skunky malts, mildy bitter and hoppy.
Bottle.  Aroma is fruity and macro lager.  Pale gold with a small white head the mostly diminished and left some lace.  Taste is ok.  Palate is watery soft.  Overall a substandard brew.

500 mL Can. Pale gold body with a small fast-dissipating fizzy head. Aroma of yeast, bread, earth, corn husk, and a sharp phenolic note. There is a nuttiness that stands out in the taste but is followed by a somewhat metallic aftertaste and a thinness in the finish. Forget it :(

Tap on Heron Island, QLD.

I drank a ton of this stuff on Heron Island. I wasn’t great, but it was the best they had and around 4 in the afternoon, after a day of exploring the reef this really hit the spot. Kind of standard, bready lager with a wee bit of hop snap and of course none of the skunking what for being on tap.

Pours yellow with little to no head, aroma is bready and taste has a bit of hops up front and leads to some malt sweetness with a bit of bitter from the alcohol.  Average lager with a bit more flavor than the other macros.
Tap. Another boring pale lager. Aroma is light, and cardboard. Sweet taste with light bitterness. Thin and watery in the palate. Yellow colour, with a thin fizzy head.
Bottle - from World Market. - Low aroma but some hops smell.  Very light tasting beer barley any hop flavor, no malt flavor. Golden with white head that dies off quickly.  Not very exciting.

12oz bottle.  Pours a clear pale gold color with a foamy white head that fades quickly.  Aroma is cooked corn and some skunkiness. Very light in body with a crisp mouthfeel. Taste is grain husks and an herbal flavor with overcooked hops. Finish is dry and crisp. Another average Euro lager.
Nothing really special about this one.  Pale yellow color.  Aroma is basically skunked.  Taste is pretty much the same.  It’s kind of like a Heineken in a way with just a little more flavor.
Bottle. There is nothing wrong with this beer. Neutral and easy to drink with nice bread tones. Good standard lager.

(Gr-btl, Gr-lbl)



gl-lct, ^co2, light body, spicy T1 §hop-bitter T2 pils T3 hop-bitter Tf.

Pours pale yellow with almost no head.
Aroma shows skunky Euro hops and stale cigarette smoke, with just the faintest hint of sweet malt.
Flavours include more of the stale cigarette smoke along with some sweet cooked corn.
Watery body, but the carbonation is alright (as in not too high).
Wow, and I didn’t think they could make anything worse than Carlsberg elephant.
0.5l bottle. Large white head, but poor lacing. Pale golden color, clear.  None aroma, weak taste, sour finish. Light body.
Liked better than I expected. Cloudy yellow body with a standard white head. Floral, metalic aroma. Malty thin taste with a crisp dry finish.
Germanic hopping and plenty of caramel malts. Quite thick as the boistrous carbonation subsides. Stale but it definitely has some pretty groovy flavours.
Pale golden color with a decent white head. Weak typical macrolager malt aroma with hints of hay and grass. Macroflavor, lightly malty, some bread and hay. Probably not the best beer in the world.

Bottle.  Only bought b/c I have never rated it.  It’s about what I expected.  Pours a light gold color with a decent sized white head head.   Skunky aroma, some metal, maybe a little grass, and maybe they threw a hop in their for good measure.  Pretty flat, at least it goes down easy.  Not too swift.

from tap in our favourite ’trapani’ bar. Nice golden colour with nice white and stable head. Smell: malty and sweet, just like the taste: a bit too sweet, malty, grainy, stew. This beer misses something but is easily drinkable and not bad at all!
Tap, 25 cl. Blonde, beautifully white light foamy pils. Grainy aroman not very strong. Grainy taste, light sweet, enjoyable to drink.
Bottle, 1998-06-07, Carlsbergs best "standard" lager - much better in Denmark/on site!

On tap @ Hyttfade ,Hirtshals.Pours clear golden with a small white head.Aroma of corn and cooked veggies with a hint of grass.Extermly fruity with some malt and some bitterness .Over-carbonation hides the flavors,if any.Thin body .No good.
This must be the worst beer I ever have tasted, I really don’t like it at all

Can in KL. Gold color, rising bubbles, fizzy head with no retention. Aroma is plywood and bland grain with with the occasional whiff of skunk. I might even smell some hops, albeit stale ones. Palate is soft, medium carbo, slightly sticky. Flavors are tolerable. Slight acetylaldehyde and also slight sulfur. Fairly balanced, finishes a bit on the sweet side but still fairly crisp. Not bad for what it is.
Not much here.  Very light body.  Sweet, but not much flavor.  Drinkable.  Sort of.
Run-of-the-mill mass produced pale lager. Typical lager with a light-body. Nothing special.
On tap at White Horse Tavern, St. George’s, Bermuda.  Typical light lager with thin white head and pale yellow body.  Nothing special.
33cl bottle. Pours golden color, lacing. Refreshing, malty taste. average lager.
Tap. Pours golden with attractive but diminishing head. Aromas of grass and sea shore. Flavors of grass, sweet malt, lemon and sea salt. Nice body and finish for the style.
Best enjoyed while watching  Liverpool FC. Goes great with a crisp apple.  .
Probably the best beer in the world.... Not for me. But it’s not as bad as many other big brewery lagers. Standing in front of my barbeque, it’s actually quite enjoyable

From 500ml can.  Golden yellow tall white head. Strong aroma of Saaz and sweet malt. Smooth fresh and hoppy, finishes with a very fine sweet maltiness. This is one of my favorite Euro lagers. It is soo fresh and hoppy a great pilsner although macro brew. I think Carlsberg is kick ass for what it.  I could drink it everyday!!
Standard non-interesting commercial lager with no specific taste other than mass production...

500ml can poured into a pint glass. Poured a clear yellow with a 1/2 head that didn’t last. Produced a bit of lacing. Light aroma of sweet malts and faint traces of hops. Tastes of some sweet malts with a light hop bittecrness. There’s also a faint hint of citrus fruits. It’s risp & smooth. Goes down easy. It’s drinkable alright but for the wrong reasons; It lacks flavour. Overall it’s a pretty inoffensive brew that’s easy to drink. It’s usually one of the standbys in my fridge.
Traditionally golden lager, with a tiny and quickly evaportaing head. The smell is fresh as the summer, grassy hops and honeyish malt. The taste is fruitsyrupy sweet and bready malty.
I was once told that if you pour this in a very peculiar and special way, that this beer is amazing.  I don’t buy it.

Canadian version on tap.  Pours a clear yellow gold with small white head.  Mild aroma of light grain.  Taste of sweet corn and grass.  No finish, light body.  Maybe a cut above the typical Molbatt stuff but still not very good.

Re-rate from pint can. Aroma: Woody, slightly lemony hop aroma, an almost English hop character. Some light hay hangs in there somewhat. Appearance: Gold pour with strong carbonation; a thin white head that fades into a patchy ring. Flavor: More fruity than you’d want a Pils to be; white grape and hay tussle; lemon takes over a bit more toward the finish, but it’s not terribly assertive. Maybe a touch of wood lingers on, but just a touch. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, long finish. Overall: As said by other reviewers, this can barely be called a Pilsener. Still, it’s an acceptable beer in a pinch, especially if you were able to get it reasonably fresh. This is certainly an improvement over the bottle rate I had a few years back.

500 ML can in Pakistan. Crystal clear light golden in color, medium white head. Light cereal and lawn clipping scents. Sweet corny taste, but slight hops give a decent bitter follow.The little flavor that is there is well balanced, but this is overall very un-impressive.
No bad, no great.Lager says it all.Denmarks Coors.Poors small head,yellow in color.Boring,Boring,Boring
Golden colour with a little head. Had a weak malty taste. No real aroma. No great taste either. A bit refreshing but there are much better drinks that can fill that role. A drink and nothing else.

This beer it’s my favourite, because has a good balance of bitter and aromas.
The smells is rich in cereals with a touch of hop aroma.
The tap Danish version is more better than the others.

29.08.2009, 0,5l Can. Yellow colour with white head. Weak malty aroma. Refreshing and easy drinkable but not tastefull. Ok pale lager. New Tasting 24.07.2010, 0,5l PET Bottle as Carlsberg HOF, 4,2% ABV, Swedish version. Nice bitterness. 15.01.2011, 0,5l PET Bottle labeled carlsberg export, abv 5,1. From Systembolaget Charlottenberg. This beer has a lovely aromatic hopping, so I changed the rating from 2,4 to 2,7.
I was expecting this to be skunky, but it wasn’t luckily.  It’s just fine, but it’s far from anything special.

On tap at Elephant and Castle. Clear yellow pour with a moderate white foam, mild retention. Aroma is sweet malts, barley. Taste is fairly bland, weak malty taste, corn, very mild hops. Finish is dry, but crisp. Refreshing, but boring.

11.2 ounce bottle - $1.49 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a clear, golden body with a moderate-sized, white head.

Smell: As expected, the handsome green bottle has left this skunked. I’ll take a few minutes to organize the cans of soup in my pantry, giving it time to waft away. BAK! Alright, so it’s lightly sweetish malts flecked by some metallic hints.

Taste: Light pale maltiness with some grainy hints and a soft cereal sweetness and a perceived touch of light corn syrup. Yeah, there’re those metallic hints again, as if the change from my $1.49 bottle was somehow planted in my bottle. Floral, subtly spicy hops with a mild bitterness. Finishes drying and crisp, but those metallic hints just won’t let up.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Pass. The skunkiness was hindering, but they completely lost me at the metallic tastes. I would like to look at your coin collection, not lick it.

Pours pale gold with a thin, fluffy white head that has poor retention. Aroma is sweet malt, grits, a hint of grass and minerally wet limestone. Flavor is sweet malt, planty hops, grassy hops, mineral water, more grass and mineral to the finish. Palate is thin, prickly and somewhat dry throughout. Average, pale lager, maybe a little better, inoffensive, but very weak nose and flavor.

Draught at Olearys Visby.

Very light coulor and a bad big bubble head.

A small malt aroma.
Dull!

Poured from a 12oz. bottle into a pint glass.

The color is a gold/yellow with some sudsy head on the top of the beer. No lacing.

The smell is a grainy with a little corn flavor, with a slight hop aroma.

The taste is sweet with some grainy malt feel, is a little dry and crisp.

This beer has a bit of a crisp easy feel to it that makes for great drinkability. Is pleasant to have and is really enjoyable.

330ml Bottle, Honolulu. This was recommended to my by my best friend. He has been drink a lot of this recently. Skunky nose with an aroma hint of nose. Reminds me of an Old Milwaukee. Has a nice smooth flavor going down, not much of a palate. This is getting better as it warms, but really nothing memorable.

"Probably the best lager in the world" says the slogan. Well I don’t think so. This is thin with almost no nose, a light malt flavour and very light hoppiness. It’s also extremely fizzy and thin. In fact it’s almost tasteless though, to be fair, it’s not actually offensive like some mass produced lagers. It just doesn’t satisfy. Avoid!

Absolutely awful.  The aroma was void of anything, no hops, no malts.... where is the beer aroma?  The appearance was a golden color with a little fluffy white head.  The flavor is malty, not much else.  The malts are light and faint, nothing rememberable.  The beer got rougher and rougher to drink.  Skunks quickly
Draught at ocsc.   This is surprisingly better tasting than I thought.  Maybe I just really needed a beer after work.  Either way, it’s not terrible.

Overall Impression: 
A decent golden lager, not the worst, but certainly a macro.

Pours out a nice light golden brew with a small rocky white cap. Looks pretty decent in my glass begging to be drank quickly. The aroma is pretty plain with notable hops, a light sweetness and some crappy malts. No skunk is a good thing. The taste is pretty good and pretty average - kinda sweet but fairly clean with ok malts and a nice bitter finish. A bit rough around the edges but goes down without complaints.
Pale golden colour with a small head. Malty aroma and also malty flavour with a slight bitterness and metallic notes. Boring and tasteless.
Clear yellow of color with a white head. An aroma of citrus, hay and weak hops. A flavor of citrus, hops, bisquit and weak sweets.

500 ml Tallboy - Smells a bit unlike something you expect to be as good as this is - wet hayish. Cleary yellow, but almost, just about hazy. Almost makes you think your going to taste apple juice as it rushes down the glass to your mouth and then it’s sweet beer. Well, the smell is sweet but it tastes standard lager-ish with a very nice hop finish, slightly bold but soft around the edges. The carbonation is quite nice on the throat as well.
Bottle. Brewed in Denmark, so its the original. That doesn’t hewlp though. Still boring. Needs some more taste
Bottle. Clear yellow with a medium frothy head. Below average retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is very faint malt and adjunckts. Flavor is malt, corn, cardboard and minimal hops. Thin body..

the smell was just extremely faint and corny, pale yellow. horrible artificial corny taste, though not a strong unpleasant flavour it is overwhelmingly unpleasant. way too carbonated and they have the nerve to describe it as "possibly the best beer in the world" on the can. wow

(on draft in Hong Kong) pale golden color, almost no head, very faint hoppy aroma, generally unremarkable flavour, bitter but not very long finish

(can in Middle East - brewed in Turkey) clear pale gold with tall white head; faint spicy aroma; balanced but not much flavour; rather boring and uninspired
Pours pale golden.  Mild hop taste but pretty faint.  Not horrible but not anything great.

The 500ml can sold in Quebec can be bought for as less as 2,69$.  New, so it’s fresh.  And really not bad.  Graham cookie in the smell and taste.  Pretty malty, notes of some sweetness, light and subtle hopping, slightly tongue tingling but this isn’t leading to such a great finish or product.  Still a very decent macro beer, especially in can, I believe.
Can. Pale gold, clear, head goes away quick. Smells a little sweet, not much flavour.Not offensive but nothing special.
Pours with a foamy head, clear golden colour, but the story is that is tastes like grains and hops and nothing else. Nothing more, nothing less. No surprises, and sometimes that’s a good thing.

Draft @ HKG airport. Non-existent nose. Honestly, there’s no smell. Taste is pretty watery, but is clean, crisp and nicely bitter towards the end. Faint, faint hops back there somewhere. Not bad for an export lager.
Bubbly, cold and on the hoppy side of refreshing. Not a hell of a lot to say about a beer that is just another export lager.
33cl can poured to glass. Pours a clear golden colour with a medium size white head that vanishes quickly.
Too bitter for my tastes.  Colour is fantastic, the smell is nothing to write home about.  Smooth, but not smooth enough.

~Pours a clear gold color with big rocky white head. Head last and leaves nice lacing.
~Dusty hop scent, a bit skunky with mild malts in aroma.
~Corn and water taste. Malts for sweetness. Hops slightly noticeable.
~Light to medium feel. Smooth. Sweet finish.
~Lame beer. I will drink it. Just boring and bland.
Not a very luxurious beer, but I enjoy it the most at an outdoor bar or beer garden during the summer months.  Just something about this beer and those conditions.

This review was done from beer on tap, golden yellow and crystal clear is the color of the beer with a suprisingly thick white head. The smell is terrific but dosn’t really match the sent of your typical lager, mellow with banana’s and nuts makes this brew smell great but strange for the style. The taste is a disappointment, stale, slightly skunky, and strong tasting rotten malts. Not a bad mouth feel but nothing special. The beer isn’t horrible but unless this is given to me I wont drink it.

Pours a banana-gold with a small frothy head. Aroma is par with other Western European pale lagers, which isn’t saying much. It’s mostly of cereal, in other words, and vague. Flavor is quite decent; Robust for a lager. You can actually taste malt and hop. Not profoundly so, but this one actually has flavor. Mouthfeel is spritzy, and thicker than most lagers. Not a bad pale at all. One could do a lot worse with pale lager. Overall, good minus.
Watery. Smells like pee. Flat head, small finish. I couldn’t stand another one.
Can. Thin head that quickly goes, slight hop/malt aroma. Medium bodied, low carbonation, mild hop bitterness.

(Draught at Old English Pub, Copenhagen, 24 May 2009) Golden colour with brief, white head. Malty, grassy nose with notes of bread, hay and a touch of butter. Malty, bready taste with grass, bread and a short finish with modest bitterness. Fairly thin body with some malt sweetness throughout. Well, it’s not awful but definitely boring. Tried it at Vinstue 90, Copenhagen, on the same day. They serve it with a slow pour, it takes 10-15 minutes. It gives a firmer, rocky head and a more fresh aroma with slightly more hints of grassy hops and toffee. Slightly better, but it’s still Carlsberg.

Pretty bloody weak, but inoffensive. A good thing to drink on a liver destroying bender, as it doesn’t remotely bloat you. There’s at least 100 beers I’d prefer, but it’s not going to kill you with shittiness at least. Meh.

Color is golden but lighter than other pale lagers. It has creamy foam and smooth palate as silk. Rather sweet and mild in comparison with Japanese counterpart. No stimulation to my tongue is one of the best character of this beer.

Pours a golden color with a white head.  Skunky aroma with some earth tones and little hops.  Flavor isn’t as skunky as the aroma is but it’s still there.  More of the earthy tones come out on the flavor with a hint of some floral hops.  Overall decent for a pale lager.
Overly malty, especially in the aftertaste, like a skunkier Heineken, not awful. Definite European skunk.

Bottle. Pours gold with a small white head. Nose of pale malt and some skunk.  The taste is quite simple and common, but it does have some quality to it. There is an earthy taste that I like, and a hoppy aftertaste.

Pour from a green 12oz bottle. Golden yellow beer with one finger of white head that soon fizzles, leaving a thin coating on top of the brew. Faint but pleasant aroma of sweet grain with a hint of hops. Pleasant malty flavor, lightly hopped, well balanced finish. No metallic, vegetal, or adjunct overtones. Medium mouthfeel. Not extraordinary but a competent lager that does justice to the style.

This must be what the sweat off a skunk’s ass-crack tastes like.

It is as light, fizzy, and yellow as a pilsner can get. It had an extremely skunky smell and taste and the god awful taste lingered on my tongue for way too long.

I was exhausted and thought I grabbed Carling. This awful taste in my mouth is completely my fault for not paying attention.

The city of Copenhaven must tap into their public sewers for this gem.
I’ll drink it if it’s at a party, but it’s not worth the export price. Very Heinikenish with a sweet, slightly bitter taste with corn body.
is sold with a pale gold livery in the UK as Carlsberg Export...it is what it is...

Bottle. Pours straw color with fluffy white head. The aroma is a little skunky at first pour, but dissipates as it breathes; once the skunk is gone, a somewhat pleasant grassy and herbal note shines through, with some sweet malt in there, too. The flavor is not so great. Very sweet, rather metallic. There’s an odd, semi-dry corn husk deal in the finish. The aftertaste is really strange... all that sweetness morphs into a fruit punch type taste, accompanied by paper and sawdust. Blah.
stinky aroma of mushrooms and some herbs, flavor is rather sweet, body is watery and finish is hoppy sweet, bad beer.
12 oz bottle.... tastes like a heineken light nothing special here.... bitter and tastes like its sat in the sun for days
A nice brew, enjoyed best with a nice plate of carbs and a soccer game. FIrst enjoyed a nice 28oz of carlsberg at a TFC game. Solid brew, and the more I drank the better it tasted. TFC!
First time trying a Carlsberg left me wishing I hadn’t. Very hoppy odor and golden color. Flat tasting after the initial hop jolt. Might be better on a really hot day.
0,33 l can. 4,6 % ABV. Pours very pale, with a small white head. Dont pick up any aroma at all. Sweet malty taste-typical industrial lager.
Who wouldn’t drink a beer that is on liverpool’s shirt? A really classic and nice one...

Bottle bb 4 feb 10, Bottled in NZ
Pours clear,lite pale yellow, good compact head.
Aroma is slightly aged, slight baked beans aroma, some high alcohols and a solventy background.
Flavour is a good balance of malt and meduim bitterness, but a slight solvent background.
Overall better than the european carlsberg, I just found the solventy aroma/flavour ruined a well balanced lager.

bah... the carlsberg made in denmark (hof) it ok: a nice crisp pretty spot on pilsener. the one brewed in other parts of the world blends straight in to the blandness of mass marketed green bottle fizz. the score i give is a blend of those.
