Golden, had a nice head for a few seconds.  while the hops are skunked, it still has a decent aroma to it.  If I was in Denmark right now this might be a decent cheap lager, but I’m not.  At least I got the export 5% abv version.
50 ml Can, 4,5% Norwegian, Rignes version. Apperance; Light golden, clear with a minimal white head. Aroma; Malt with a flavor of malt, light light bitter.

There is nothing positive I can say about Carlsberg Lager.The UK version is not even 5% as  listed on the database,its a ridiculous 3.8 % bull shit.Skunky aroma from the lame green bottles.Flavours of carboard flavoured malt.Syrupy and too sweet ..with a burst of harsh dry hop bitterness. My taste buds need a vacation.
12 oz bottle.  Poured a clear yellow with a thin white head.  The aroma was corny and grassy.  The flavor was skunky.  Not the best.
Bottle.  I didnt pour this in a glass.  Smells skunky, corny, and straw.  Tastes skunky, over carbonated, some bread crust, some corn, and a decent bitter hop finish.  Not bad.
Golden color with a thin but foamy white head and moderate carbonation. Skunky and slightly sour aroma. Creamy mouth feel with the flavor of wheat and a mildly dry finish.
Smells of skunk, tastes even worse. Had my stomach rolling the entire next day.
Bottle. Not very good. Your basic pale lager. Skunk aroma, some corn and malts. Very smooth flavor. Light bodied. Pale yellow pour.

The can said "Probably the Best Beer in the World."  What can I say?  "Probably Not."  Pours that pale-urine-yellow of someone only slightly dehydrated. A metallic, skunky nose.  Fizzy head that disappears in seconds.  If served ice, ice cold you could probably joke this down.  Otherwise don’t bother.

Doesn’t look fantastic. Pretty simple nice aroma though - malt with a tad bit of sweetness. Crisp and clean, it’s easy on the palate. Delicate malty flavour without being overpowering. Slight fragrant aftertaste to it and, a little tinge of some kind of sugary feel in the middle. Nice bitter on the low to medium end. Hoppiness is well balanced. Starts and finishes simple. None of the fancy spicy, woody, nutty or metallic undertones - this brew is of trustworthy straight character. Can’t really go wrong if you are reaching out for a time tested thirst quencher, which you don’t have to be too intellectual about. Real value for money. One of the better mass produced light body lagers.

33cl bottle from Willow Bend Liquors (Tampa, FL). Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a one finger white head that settles quickly but still laces the glass. Aroma is sweet and grassy with notes of bread, yeast, petrochemicals, nuts, and some hints of caramel and honey. Flavor is sweet and floral with notes of bready yeast, grain, grass, and honey. Generally light body with a clean grassy finish.

green bottle, 330 ml. engraved, with euro 2008 label.

A: clear golden colour, white head, suprisingly lasting
S: malt, grainy, nothing much there.
T: malt, almost tasteless.
M: thin beer, light body
D: easy drinking lager, made for hot summer days. headache in bonus

Not a beer you should buy for the taste. Bland taste, I get the feeling Im drinking a mix of chemicals, beer extract with some added booze to get the alcohol level up. It looks alright in the glass but thats about it.

had this in hong kong sitting at the fleet landing, it was all they had on the first floor, but that was okay, it was a nice brew to just sit with and chill.

pours a pale yellow with a medium size white foamy head, nice lacing.

smell is of grain, some hops, and malt in the back.

taste is clean, grain, corn, sweet malt, and ends a little dry.

Canned, with 4.5%. Golden, frothy white head. Sweetish, mineral and a tad metallic aroma. Sweet sugary flavor, light maltiness, strangely alcoholic and herbal bite in the finish. Unpleasant ESL aromas actually. Soft & mouthfilling carbonation. Always nice to see a modest ABV beer with honest malt liquor flavor.

Golden pour with thin white head. Sweet nose of corn and other adjuncts, . Flavor is sweet with a light impression of hops. Watery, bland, a tad perfumey. Another imported beer that isn’t worth the money or drinking.
Gold pour with a white head. Flavor is mostly pale malts. Nothing too complex. Light body.
My Danish cousins drink a lot of this. It has a yellow appearance with a medium white foam head. Has a readily apparent smell of hops. No bitter aftertaste.
Thin golden pour with a creamy white head. Taste has corn and some malts ,abit sweet, but really nothing to write home about.

Bottle.  Pours a light golden yellow with a thin, white, clingy head.  Taste is of some malt, some grass and some corn.  Has a little sweetness to it.  Aroma is of malt and corn.  Fairly watery, kind of bland, with some bitterness.  Has a decent drinkability to it and is fairly refreshing.  Was better served in the bottle. Not a bad buy when it is on sale (6 pack for $5), but otherwise it is overpriced.
Pours pale yellow into a shaker. Head quickly recedes to nothing. Sour hay aromas. Crisp, sweet and slightly stale upfront with a hint of bitter hops in the finish.
Another non-descript pale lager. Looks pleasant enough, but doesn’t get beyond sweet malts and a hint of tired hops. Left a slightly metallic after taste.
Half decent for a session. Slight smell of grass and a touch of skunk, not unpleasant though. Taste is hoppy and a bit bitter.

Canette 500ml. De couleur dorée et claire. Nez de grains de malt pâle, de maïs sucré avec des notes herbeuses, de légumes bouillis ainsi que des traces d alcool métalliques. Mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen mais croustillant ainsi qu une texture aux notes aqueuses et sirupeuses. Léger goût de grains de malt pâle accompagné dun léger goût de légumes bouillis sucrés lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût de maïs plutôt sucré puis en finale lon retrouve un léger goût herbeux (faibles notes de houblon herbeux). Post-goût court et aux petites notes sèches, aux petites notes amères de  houblon herbeux avec une petite sensation métallique.

Feb 2, 2007  
Can in Amsterdam. Eggy smell. Hoppy, eggy and watery taste. Just another lager, but macrohouse. Quite poppy with lots of mouthfeel.
This reddish yellow lager poured with a frothy white head that quickly dissipated and a floral aroma. There is a flat skunky flavor with some bitterness at the finish.

Draught as Carlsberg Export @ The Papermill A.K.A. Paperchase, EC2. Typical grainy malt, metallic hop pub swill, immortalized as fizzy piss by Tom at The Wenlock. Has replaced Kronenbourg as my weekly fizzy (pale) yellow lunchtime beer when I’m out with my work mates, so from one Carlsberg brew to the next it seems. Apparently, so good the Danes hate to see it leave, I think it’s more out of embarrassment myself...although I still regret not having one at the pub adjacent to the brewery during EBF.

Bottle from the famed around the world multipack from my sister.  Clear yellow with small, creamy, long lasting white head appearance.  Aroma of corn and yeast and some hops, all very light though.  Flavor is light lager with some malt backbone, hops as well, actually not all that bad.  Creamy medium body.  This is better than some of the others that ive been tasting but stephanie says "i can’t drink any more of these corny lager."
Obviously so mass produced this lager is everywhere. There really is nothing good to say about Carlsberg. Ive never wanted more than 2 pints before.

Mild hoppy nose with hints of citrus. Sweet aromas. 
A pale yellow appearance with a rocky white head that disappears.
Flavours of weak hops and malt, some bitterness. Virtually no aftertaste. 
The only really good thing is that its extremely easy to drink, and refreshing when cold. Probably not the best beer in the world.

Pours clear light gold with a couple fingers of white head. Light aroma is sweetish and malty - sort of honey, caramel and hay. Not bad. Mouthfeel is light but at least a hint of texture. Fairly smooth, at least none of the prickly, dry feel of many PLs. Light, webby lacing. Flavor shows a light malt presence - honey/caramel/hay and even a bit of smokiness toward finish. Very light hoppy bite overlays and provides a hint of a pinch in finish. Overall fair mass-produced PL. 330 ml bottle from Rum Runner.

can.  Poured cleam gold with thin carbonated head.  Sweet grainy pale malt aroma. Light body, highly carbonated, clean finish. Bready malts, hay-ish, faint peppery hop presence. Not bad, a nice change from generic North American lagers.

330 mL. Pours a pale yellow with high carbonation and an acceptable white head. Aroma of sweet malt, grass, faint hops.
Flavor is slight dry and sour with a bit of mild hops. Overall not a bad macro.
Crushed with Jakebra.  Awesome for pound pint nights.  By the time youre through a few of them, you dont care how many or how fuckin nast it is.  Not good and offensively bad.

Can 4.5% brewed by Sinebrychoff in Finland. 
Very basic European lager. 
Mild aroma.
Yellow with a white head that doesn’t stick around. Grainy, some mild hops, bitter finish. Average lager.
Bottle.  Malty aroma.  Light golden body, small white head.  Flavor is mild and very smooth.  Watery and not much else.

danish beer on tap at a british pub?... clear goldish yellow with a substantial soft white head... lots of lacing may be caused by a dirty glass. sweet fruity aroma with grassy hop notes, pale malt, faint spice and light pleasant skunk. the flavor is pretty much the same but with much more pronounced skunkiness. light spice and mild bitterness come before a clean crisp finish. medium bodied. carbonation keeps the palate clean for more beer...

Imported bottle.  Doesn’t matter where you go or where you drink it, this is piss the world over.  Bog-standard lager colour, thin head, insipid ’flavour’ and a nasty chemical aftertaste.  If Carlsberg sponsored English football teams they’d sponsor the biggest bunch of gobshites known to man.  They do?
Clear yellow with a thin white head with nice lacing.  Skunky green bottle pils aroma, dry malt, light hops.  Taste is light malt with a decent body, good hoppiness and a lasting bitterness.

rating#735 (i used to drink this a lot, so forgot to rate it when i started drinking beer).
clear yellow, nice white head,
aroma is mainly your typical macro lager, but i sense a little hops too. flavor is a little sourish, a little hoppy, sweet and faint bitterness in the end. not much taste. reasonable session beer. i sense a little fruit in there??
Clear yellow lager pour, plenty carbonation, ok head, taste is generic lager but with a decent dry crisp finish.  Average lager really.
This pours a golden yellow and has a surprisingly longer lasting head than most.  There is a fine taste and good bitterness.
This review is for the Carlsberg Lager brewed locally here in Cyprus (first ever outside of Denmark), both on draught and bottled. I’’ve tasted CL in other countries and it’s just not the same.

(Good) draught. Pours light golden, with exuberant and durable head, with some lacing. Citrus and hops on the nose, and hops and extremely sweet fruit on the palate, with faints notes of yeast. Not the worst, but probably not the best beer in the world.
bottle. has a grassy, hoppy aroma. pours a very lilght clear yellow. has a sweet fruity taste. maybe apple(red licorce). taste is decent but nothing stands out.
Very floral stinky nose ( got marijuana in there ).  Hops evident.  Pour clear yellow.  Great refreshing taste.  Apples and other light fruit.  Finish has some banana.  Overall very nice
This beer is love at first sip! Adorable aroma,  contemporary appearance(not exactly as the picture shown). Not to mention its amazing flavor. Do yourself a favor and try this beer. You’ll love it.

Poured pale golden with a thin head. Grainy aroma. Slight touch of malt with a pronounced bitterness on the finish. For a pale lager it is not bad and has a bit more character than most of it’s American counterparts.
An extremely drinkable beer with a yellow pour. I would recommend it. Easily found.
old with the green livery all over the world as Carlsberg Lager or Carlsberg Beer.

Pint served in imperial pint glass.

[Eyes] Pale clean yellow, thin  head, minimal, no lacing.

[Nouse] Not a lot, some faint grany malt

[Mouth]  fresh in the beginning a little hop bite in the finish. aftertaste is quick... a bland lager...

On tap at Von Trier in Milwaukee.  Pale goldenrod color.  Aroma was grassy and sour.  Flavor was similar, very grassy and malty, with a sour finish.  Better than American macros, that’s the best you can say about it.

(Bottle) Pours a yellow color with a foamy white head. Sweet Euro lager aroma of grains and vegetable. Sweet malty taste, with some grass/straw hop notes. Clean finish. Mouthfeel and palate decent for a pale lager. Better than most American pale lagers if you are willing to pay the price.
Hmmm, not sure why I just tried this.  Macro beer color.  Macro beer aroma.  Macro beer flavor.  Waste of time and money.
Aroma is corn and malt.  Expected gold color.  Flavor is floral.....sulfur compounds.  White head.  Not too much malt flavor.  Body is light.  Not a fan.
Pale yellow beer with a small white head.  Slight malt and grassy hop aroma. Little in the way of malt, low bitterness, for the style -  again grassy taste to the beer. Plain tasting lager - safe.

33 cL bottle poured into a pilsener glass. Pale golden yellow with a fizzy white head that rises and falls quickly. No lace.
Aroma is sweety toasty malt. Nothing else.
Flavor is crackery malt with some graininess and a light, barely detectable fruitiness.
Thin bodied and highly carbonated, finish is not quite clean enough for the style. Pretty refreshing and very drinkable. A minor step up from American macros.

7 oz draught sample.  Yellow pour with a small fizzy white head.  Aroma of straw.  Mild barnyard flavoring with an even finish.  Crushes Bud and Heineken in the category, but then again not much doesn’t.
Draught. Golden color, white head. Malty aroma and flavor, with a slightly hoppy finish, which is a pleasant surprise. High carbonation, slightly watery mouthfeel. Could be worse.

Bottle...  Your usual pale lager look with a cracker malt and tangy hop aroma.  It’s like Stella Artios’ twin.  Kind of boring but gets over 1 point becaue it is somewhat refreshing on this hot day that I’m drinking it.
A good lager. Not GREAT color or aroma but it did have good flavor to it. No weird bite like alot of european lagers.
An average lager, weak flavour...grainy and a slight hint of malts.  It is easy drinking on a hot summers day.  A generic big brewery lager

Very malty aroma, grainy.  Its color is dark yellow, slightly orange, white foam.  The flavor is a little heavier than a regular pale lager, the mouthfeel a little thicker.  The finish has just a slight impression of hops.  In an uninteresting style, this one is relatively good.
50cl Can. A lager with faint flavours, a bit malty and grainy sweet, dry hoppy finish.

Bottle.  Poured pale gold with thick white head.  Aroma of malt and citrus.  Rather bland flavour with a bit of maltiness and a fair amount of bitterness.  Thirst quenching.  A fair finish.  Rather good for a macro lager.

Not really that great, is it really the so called best beer in the World, I dont think so. I will say its better than other lagers such as Carling and Fosters in my opinion though. It has a fizzy taste and isnt totally bland. Not my pint though.
Bottle. Poured a pale yellow body. Aroma is light grain and crip hops. Flavor is weak, light grain and hops.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow-golden with a large but dissipating foamy white head. Aroma is a slight hint of malt and straw. Flavor is clean and watery, with a bit of nondescript malt. Inoffensive but uninteresting.
light yellow, nose is uhhm corn and some bitter hops, kinda skunky, kinda bland thin body and weird finish, maybe a bad bottle
Bottle. Pours clear yellow with a white head. Corny malt aroma, some straw. Flavor has a light balance of malt and hops. Not awful.
Poured clear gold.  White foamy head.  Medium mouthfeel. Flavor of malts and light hos. Not much finish.  Pretty ordinary.

La bière se présente avec une couleur or et une mousse blanche modeste qui reste. Au nez on découvre des arômes de céréales et de pain blanc. En bouche le corps est mince-moyen avec une effervescence faible-moyenne. On goute des saveurs de grain et d’herbe avec une finale légèrement houblonnée.
Well I can’t believe I have never rated this yet.....hey it’s carlsberg everybody.  At least you aren’t drinking Heinken or Amstel, right?
Why this is in the 11th percentile right now is beyond me. This is "the" English macro. Its more drinkable than our "King of Beers", but not by all that much.

Back, many, many years ago, during my college days, Carlsberg was considered “a beer to die for” But then that’s when my every day beer was Atlas Prager and Lone Star.

This is a decent beer. A bit hoppy but quite drinkable. Pours a clear golden color. Certainly a much better choice then Heinekens. but not a really top beer.

Nice beer. Quite aromatic, refreshing. Hops are doing a good job here. A bit watery, but thats a given for an euro lager This is the beer non beer lovers should be going with instead of heineken. Affordable for everyday drinking.
chiara non molta schiuna persistenza medio corta note lievi di malto leggero erbaceo amaro in bocca piuttosto frizzante malto e finale amarognolo

Pours a clear gold, with a super thin white head.  Aroma is a bit funky, and similar to most mass produced European lagers. Flavor is mostly malty and grain, with a bit of spice.  However, it’s bitter without the nice hop notes.  Palate has a bit of fizz, and finishes a bit dry for my tastes.  Carbonation gives this the ability to be tasted  few more times after its finised.  Overall a drinkable, and flavorful pale lager, but not really my cup of tea.
very nice beer, not too bitter and very "drinkable" not too expensive, can tastes much better than bottle

To me this is a very decent and drinkable lager beer. Very clean and smooth tasting with a good balance of hops, malts, grain, etc. This beer is a fine example of a beer Canadian and American macro brewers should aspire to as a minimum standard in how their lagers taste and the quality and care put into brewing them. We are not there yet.

Had a couple of bottles of this at Copenhagen’s airport years ago and thought  it was an OK beer (maybe was just glad to get anything wet after a bad, bad, bad SAS flight). Locally purchased version didn’t taste that great... bland flavor / skunky smell... with a sugary and flat aftertaste... can’t recommend (must, however, finish the 12-pack... but won’t buy again). Cheers!
Not a bad tasting beer. Good beer to drink socially. A ton better than Miller Genuine Draft, and I would def. drink this beer while watching a lakers basketball game on my couch at home!

It’s carlsberg it’s a good beer. Not all beers have to be finely crafted, for a macro brewed european lager I think carlsberg is up there at he top of the list with stella. It’s light and crisp with a thin malt character and mild but aromatic hops. Good fresh bite and crisp finish on a hot day this is a good alternative especially if you are somewhere that finer beer is not available.

Tasted 7/27/08.  12oz bottle.  Filtered with a golden hue.  Quickly dissipating finger width of white head.  Mild grainy aroma.  Medium bodied and well carbonated.  Skunky green bottled beer, but a tad better than most.  Moderate bitterness and a slight hop profile.  Grainy cereal malts.  Crisp and quenching.  Leaves a tingle across the tongue.  Solid for the style and better than most in this class!

This beer is a weird one for me.  I often find that when I start to drink this beer, I don’t really fancy it.  But the more I drink it, the better it gets.  Has a hoppy bite to it, with a pleasant aftertaste.  Official sponsor for Liverpool Football Club, which is why I tried it in the first place.  Very decent beer.

Despite the rating this one has recieved, I was impressed with this brew. Had this one in Crans-Montana, Switzerland. Golden amber color with a decent white head. Aroma of malts with a touch of hops. Smooth and crisp with just a small hop bite. Not bad at all, wouldnt go out of my way for it but I wouldnt turn one down.

11.2oz bottle.  Filtered, pale yellow-gold color.  Malty dough flavors, with a smooth crisp green European hop bite.  Easy drinking and light bodied.  Better than a lot of other comparable macro swill, but hardly worth seeking out.
Nice, fresh and just a damn good beer for any occasion. Had a few a few months ago after my initial tasting. Loved it ever more!
pale, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, slick feel, lively,
339 ml can. yellow colour. white head. taste is papery, bit hop. not as goos as I hoped.
Thanks to ruco.  Drank it during Eurocup Final 2008.  Sorry ghawener.  Terrible, terrible, terrible......Taste rubber like.

Canned. Clear yellow beer with a medium white head. Some lace formation, otherwise the head diminishes fast. Lightly malty aroma  has grassy hops and is quite metallic. Some grassy lemon in the finish. Dryish flavor with light to medium bitter finish. Light body. Unfresh due to robus hops. Overcarbonated, fizzy mouthfeel. Overall a very boring pale lager.

Yellow well carbonated beer with a white large disappearing head. Aroma is malty with some hints of hops and citrus. The flavor is rather sweet, though the carbonation rather takes over too muich of the maltiness. Hops is slightly more apparent bringing a decent freshness to it.
Can 0,33 l, brewed in Finland 4.5 %. Drank straight from can. Slightly sour, but bitterish flavor. I have a feeling this might be brewed slightly to finnish taste as it’s pretty sourish.
Clear golden with large white creamy head. Sweet fruity aroma with floral hops and caramel notes. Flavor is moderate sweet with fruity and notes leading to a mild Bitter end.

Bottle--Saw the beer all over Europe, I’m glad I knew better than to pay European price for one.  We can mark down that at least I’ve tried it.  Pale gold color with no real sell.  Kind of watery with a touch of bitterness.  Nothing special.
Bottle.  For a pale production lager this was pretty drinkable, im glad we get the extra abv point but i guess since we have 12oz serving sizes that probably accounts for the difference. eh.
Yellow coloured beer with small diminishing white head and medium carbonation. Little hoppy aroma. Bit bitter wattery palate. Finish is bitter and hoppy which sweetens off.

Cant stand the way lagers smell. Skunk! Straight out the bottle its expectedly sharp but falls off to bland. Rather extreme ends. I can appreciate this beer but "give me a Heineken" so I dont look pretentious.

12oz bottle: Honey gold pour with a fizzy, pearl head.  Green bottle hops meet the nose, noting fresh cut grass with a piney undertone.  The skunky hops are met with a sweet toffee note in the body.  Some light clover honey notes as well.  The hops really dominate, and not in a good way.  Skunky, green bottle beer.  Pretty lackluster in all areas.

Bottle from World Market in Davis, CA. Pours a pale gold color and barely has a smell to it. Clean and refreshing taste, but just another typical pale lager. Drink it really cold and it may even seem like a good beer.
Rather refreshing but not sure I could put down more than a couple of these.  Pale gold pour with small foam head.  Smooth and mild on the pallet but a little odd hop bitterness-dry finish.
I’ve had wildly different opinions on Carlsberg as the consistency from batch to batch seems more inconsistent than you’d expect.

Date: 06/08/2000

Mode: Bottle

Source: Wild Wing Cafe, Marietta



yellow, odorless, light malt flavor with a hint of bitterness



Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 3/10; Flavor: 3/10; Palate: 3/10; Overall: 7/20

Rating: 1.7/5.0
Score: *+/4

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Immediate skunky aroma right off the bat.  Nice golden color with a decent looking soapy head.  A bit more complex in flavor than I would have thought.  Some medicinal bitterness, followed by a clean aftertaste.  Not too too bad but not that good either.  I’m thinking I might not purchase again.

Bottle. Golden color with a white head. Light smell of malt and maybe some bitter hops. Crips taste with notes of white bread, sweet malt, light citrus and some rice/corn?. Light bitterness in the short aftertaste. Very boring, but drinkable if cold.
...bottle.  Disappointing, but it’s not horrible.  Decent flavor, but hard to distinguish what it is.  Lacks body and flavor, but not horrible, it’s drinkable.

Bottles in Malawi.  As this was one of the few options for my time in Malawi, I grew to kind of like it despite the fact that it’s certainly not a great beer.  Light to medium yellow, typically a minimal bubbly head.  Slight malt, minimal hops.  More grain than anything.  Watery, but refreshing.
Bottle. Pours a straw yellow colour. Aroma is nowhere to be found. Flavor is appalling. Probably the worst beer in the world!
Bottle 0.33 l. Served after a tough Trapez dinghy race. Refreshing as usual, when you are very thirsty, and that’s probably all there is to say about Hof.

Keg (who cares where)

Light gold, fizzy, no head. No appreciable aroma. Plain malty taste, no appreciable hops. As it warms, some hops do come through, but they are a bit harsh and chemical. Thin finish not worth mentioning. When this actually becomes warm, it’s a bit dire. Drink cold, drink tasteless.
had a fairly skunky scent to it. has a straw yellow color goes down pretty smooth and easy
One of my favorites a very smooth brew initial hoppy smell slight sweetness and a slight bitter finish ... this one won’t let you down sucks to pay $32 for an import though
This brew has a similar skunky aroma to the elephant beer. its straw yellow in colour, and lemony in the finish. fine creaminess and a small head.
bottle, golden color, grassy nose, nice body with smooth finish and slight cardboard hops

daneses culeros.
no vale la pena mentir, la mayoria de cervezas huelen igual y el sabor es lo unico que las puede hacer sobresalir entre otras.  samuel adams = overrated y + $ en anuncios

Rated: june 2007

Bottle green, 500 ml

Appearance: Quite nice colour, very nice white head, regular in structure, quickly and systematically decreasing.

Aroma: Little bit skunkness, wattery and little bit malty, almost no alcohol felt and some faint grainy aroma, rather can’t feel hops

Flavour:  Gently malty, mineral from carbonation, good beer for a hot day, some very wattery grainy touch that fits my idea of a pale lager, no adjunctives what’s also big plus for it and no nasty hoppy skunkness that makes this beer undoubtedly far more drinkable than for example Heineken, some traces of lemon, no distinctive aftertaste.

Palate: Palate is thin, body is light, texture is wattery, finish feel is mineral.
For a lager this is not all that bad.  Has more of a hoppy flavor than most lagers, yet still goes down smooth.

The top is not actually beautiful, but not as ugly as with finnish lagers. There’s a surprisingly strong, a bit malty aroma. The flavor isn’t that strong, but there’s a little hint of hops in the finish, which is something you can’t expect from a finnish lager. This is almost as good as plain stock lagers come, which means drinkable. Oh, don’t let it get even a little warm.
I’ve drunk a lot of this. very easy to drink and get drunk with, but gets awful when warm. very pale in every aspect.

Aarhus, DK.
Bottled.
This is my gold standard - so it must be 2,5. Some malt and fruity yeast. Hops low - a beer that does not dare.
A bit of skunky sweetness on the nose but very mild. A little taste of hops. Boring Danish pilsner.

Can, april 08. Clear, pale, golden color with a medium, disappearing white head. Skunky, lighstrucked aroma with some cabbage notes. Shy (affortunately). Bittersweet flavor. Some corny notes. Artifficial, methallic finish. Medium to light mouthfeel, fizzy with an almost bitter aftertaste. Typical, lightstrucked (even in a can!) pale lager.

Pale yellow with white head.  Aroma of corn and perfumy sweet malts.  Taste of corn, with a tongue curdling astringent finish that only gets a little better as the rest of the bottle is tossed into the aether, rather than into my mouth.  Yuckity-yuck.

It comes out of the tap a clear golden amber with a decent, fine-bubbled white head. Aroma is nice and strong and quite malty. Flavor is rich, malty, good for a lager, with just a hint of hops. It goes down smooth with just a touch of hop bitterness. Not spectacular, but all right.
goes down easily.  Had it on tap in the UK.  Mix between a Fosters and Heineken.  Some body.  Best cold.

bottles (2).  ok flavor, though mine were quite bitter. i had a second one just to be sure, but i got the same impression.  gotta love anything danish, though the color and head are lousy.  didn’t really care for the aroma either.
11.2 oz bottle: pours golden brown decent white head, aroma is just malt, flavor typical lager not much to find here, no real off flavors so its drinkable.

Tallboy can with no date purchased in Casablanca. First thoughts: Feh. Nothing special here. A lot like other beers commonly available in Morocco (33 Export, Castel Beer, Stork, etc) except its 50% more expensive. 

Just a general basic beer. Tastes, looks, and smells like a beer ought to, without standing out in any category. Not bad with bar food; an insult to any other chow.
Smells like a locker room... Tastes like soccer hooligans and corn.... not really into this beer maybe its better over seas when its not skunked.

Pours pale, clear yellow, slightly dark. Good bubbling. Nice sticky foam head, white and a little dense. Decent hop aroma., with gum and esters present. Bland, dull flavor, but it has a little redeeming hop character. The feel is quite thick for a lager, but okay. Rather heavy finish, with a little hop bitterness aftertaaste. It leaves a lot of lacing on the glass.

A 12oz bottle with no date. The beer poured a light yellow body with a fizzy white head. smell is a bit skunky and bitter. The taste is mild bitter with a watered down taste. Good carbonation.

Bottle.
Horrible. i could have saved money and bought budweiser. Bottle 33cl. Golden clear body with medium size white head. A little hops in the nose. Very mild and anonymous flavour.
Piwo uwielbiane przez mojego szwagra. Jak dla mnie za dużo goryczki i zapach jakby się tam gandzia znalazła.
A good lager beer, but not great.  Kind of like the Miller or Bud of the US, only better.  No strong flavors, but on draft, served cold, this beer had a decent quality.
Gold pour,good carbonation,head back to mild cover.Aroma grassy,malty.Flavour malt good bitter,very thirst quenching beer,has a melon like flavour also at the finish with a good bitterness.
It’s a standard yellow Lager. It looks like a standard yellow lager. It smells like a standard yellow lager. It tastes like a standard yellow lager.
Bottle 33cl. Golden clear body with medium size white head. A little hops in the nose. Very mild and anonymous flavour.
there was nothing else, i was bored, i wrote it down and now i find myself typing out of duty... bland, boring, mass produced lager. golden, hoppy, mild and unexciting.

Not a horrible beer, not a great one either. But standard, wherever you go. Carlsberg in Thailand is the same as Carlsberg in San Francisco. Pours golden, with very slight hoppiness. Very mild, clean and flavorless.
gold body and little white head. very little aroma of malt and hops.nothing special. bitter in the finish, but againd nothing special. A normal beer.
A szokásos tömeg lager.Nagy melegben,hidegen csapolva jólesik.Ennél többet nem is nyújt de nem is akar.
Pours pale yellow with white head. Some malt in aroma and some hops. OK body. Bitter taste and a little watery.
Pours a pale golden yellow.  Not bad, but not good, either.  The aroma is slightly skunky, but that’s no surprise with a green bottle.
Bottle: Golden with white head and good lace.  Weak hoppy aroma with some malt.  Sweet malty flavour accented with some corn.  Clean, light-bodied.  Very industrial.

330 ml bottle 20717916.  Pours golden yellow with a little bit of white head.  Typical looking pale lager. Maybe a slight hint of hops.  Or maybe it’s just a skunky scent.  A little watered down.  Nothing special here.  It’s no different than most of the US macros.

341ml bottle. 

Pours your average clear yellowy gold, good sized white head but fades quickly. Aroma of corn, cereals and a musty skunky smell that I don’t like at all. The flavour has some malty sweetness and a bit of a biscuity, bready finish that I find uncommon for such mass produced lagers. A bit watery but not too bad. Decent macro lager, but better from the bottle since you don’t have to deal with the small so much.
Not a bad import - possibly a decent session brew. A lot better than most macro imports. Nice balance of hops - keep it cold.
Bottle. Some minimal hops, some bitterness, a decent macro.  But it is just another European beer in a green bottle. Not bad when fresh, nearing nasty when skunked.

On tap.  I was impressed by this one.  Hops are present, there is some bite to it.  There’s a little bit of the normal lager sweetness that I don’t like, but much less than other brews that are listed in this same category.  Not super interesting, but a decent beer.
A mass produced "euro"- lager, but one of the better ones. Really refreshing bitter flavor, the taste is a bit metallic, but not too much. Nothing special, but still better than Tuborg Green...

Weird. Until just now, I kind of liked this beer here at Bodega Brew Pub downtown La Crosse, Wis. But now upon closer examination, it seems a little thin and lame. Does have some head and lace. Pale yellow gold color. Faint beery aroma. Some hops in flavor, slightly bittersweet finish.

I don’t know why--(perhaps its the hops)-but I love the smell of Carlsberg. It reminds me of when I first tried a sip of my Dad’s beer in the 50’s, when i was ust a little shaver. Not a heavy beer, but it has that hoppy, slightly metallic taste that I crave. It’s usually about $6.99/six pk. around NE Ohio,
Just another mega-swill unfortunately. Not particular interested in ’brewed under licence beers’.
average beer.  below average flavor. clear in color and there really isn’t anything else to say, except that I will avoid this beer next time.

This rating will probably change, but the last few times I have bought Carlsberg it has been horribly skunky.  As I recall it is a beer that I like, though right now it is in the "drink-it-to-make-room-in-the-beer-fridge" category.
Once again its just beer, nothing at all exciting.  Save your money unless its on special and get a Bud.  Way too much better Euro stuff out there to drink this.

Poured from bottle. Clear with a pale golden color and lively carbonation which delivers a long-lasting head. Smells of flowery ganja. Thin mouthfeel, but well balanced with a sweet, smooth finish. Not the "best beer in the world," as they proclaim on cans in Europe, but a decent lager.

Some beers are better in certain scenarios. I don’t really like to go out to the bar and order $15 Rocheforts on a regular basis, so as an old standby, Carlsberg provides a refreshing change of pace from the typical Heineken crowd, and has a nice mouth feel to go along with decent flavor when served chilled.
Typical sweet pale lager, but with a smightly earthy and dark malt flavor. Not bad.
Yep, it’s far from great but certainly not that terrible in my eyes. On tap somewhere in town, erm better than water.
Esperava muito mais dessa famosa loirinha. Talvez minha nota baixa se deva ao excesso de expectativa...
Not a great beer but definitely pretty good for a pale lager. Way better on tap!
Meh. It won’t cure illnesses, but not as bad as the rating shows. A decent beer inside (or outside) the ballbark on a hot, summer day. Otherwise, forget it.

i mean it’s a pale lager, what do you expect?  it’s not supposed to be an incredibly flavorful beer.  a yellowish clear bber with slight head and some carbonation.  mostly a malt flavor with some hop balance but no overriding flavor.  not good, but it is a lager

12 oz. bottle poured into my trusty stein- poured transparent light golden yellow, moderate carbonation, white bubbly head formed and disappeared.  Aroma of malt with a light hop note.  Hits the mouth with a thin watery body, an odd hop taste on the end of it, sort of like it was added in after brewing.  Odd to even me considering the style.

(Can) It looks like the classic pale lager: pale yellow and a small head. Little aroma, metallic and hoppy. Flavor is a lot better, it’s very malty and a bit hoppy, leaves a sweet-like sensation. It was better than I expected.

Uninspiring. Better than common, cheap American Brews, but not by much. Gold in color, hardly any white head. Clear body. Smell is chemically hoppy with pine. . .maybe? Flavor is iffy and slightly skunky, sour. Dry texture and metallicy finish.
Bottle 0,5L, produced by BBH (licensed). Typical europilsner. Clear flavor, taste of hops is chemical, not natural. Not so interesting, probably good after sauna?
Can 33 cl. Pours a clear pale yellow with a medium white had and a thin skunky and hoppy aroma. Taste is a bit malty and hoppy, very watered down. hoppy, but a bit unpleasant finish.

Die Flasche geht schon. Aber das Bier nicht. "Probably the best beer in the world", also das kann ich überhaupt nicht bestätigen. Sehr eigenartiger Schaum, und der Nachgeschmack ist einfach nur eklig. Eine sehr große Enttäuschung.

It’s a golden beer with a modest head. The aroma and flavour is weak with light notes of malt and hops and the carbonation is high. Not defensive in any way, just plain boring. In a blind rating between this Hof and Grøn Tuborg, the only difference is that Tuborg has a little more bitterness...
Bottle.  Pretty much is like any other pale lager, but without the skunk.  Rather unremarkable, but a better alternative than the bottom-of-the-barrels.
Bottle. Nose is slightly sour maltiness, but not too over-anything really. Mouth is much more of the malty, some smoky and fresh hop tones towards the end. Bit watery and straightforward.
Very good pilsner. Very refreshing, good palate end. A classic of european lagers

Bottled. Pours piss colored with a white head. Aroma is powerfully skunky. The aroma is so strong I can smell it from the table as if it were right under my nose. As I bring it closer for a real wiff, I pick up some beef jerky and smoke notes. Flavor as the slightest hint of smoke to it. Medium malt body. Semi-sweet, with the smoke notes coming out slightly more as you go. Certainly one of the best if not the best pale lager(s) I have had.

Can. Slightly sweet malt nose with a touch of apple. Clear bright yellow with active carbonation and a patchy head. Flavor is mild and vaguely sour. No depth, but nothing foul. Probably not the best beer in the world.
Bottle.  One of those few good macro pale lagers.  Slightly sweet, nice body, rough finish.  Really enjoyed it.
12 ounce bottle available at Total Wine Liquors Fort Lauderdale FL for $1.79

Carlsberg lager - Probably the Best Website in the World...
That is just my opinion...
I love it...

Wow, this is rated very low, but it’s one of the best, most flavorful lagers I have had in a long time.  Maybe that has more to do with my recent luck with lagers.  I had it at Disney’s Epcot at the Norwegian restaurant with some Norwegian food.  It was really good for a lager.

10/4/07: Bottle. 
 Pale golden-yellow body with a bubbly, medium to small, white head.  Some lace.  Aroma and flavor are both lager-like.
Very light head, has both an initial and lasting bitterness which i find pleasing, i’m a big fan of liverpool football so I had to get a sixer of this beer
Bottle. Quite liked this beer. Strong. Great advertising. Pours a great golden colour. Relaxing beer. Slightly light body though.

[i]Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget[/i]. Pale golden with medium white head. Skunky and sourish malt aroma, a bit sweet with some bitterness. Light in body. Definitely not the best beer in the world.

0.5l bottle. Pours golden body with smaller head. Aroma is nice malty and with some citrus hops. Flavor is metallic! Very light bitter and pleasantly watery, not too much, but that metallic thing ruins everything. Shows in finish, too. This is claimed to be the best lager in the world. Well, definitely not!
Bottle. Pours gold with a small white head. The taste is quite simple and common, but it does have some quality to it. There is an earthy taste that I like, and a hoppy aftertaste.

Boring, unpleasant beer that is both bland and fizzy, yet still oddly bitter.  As a result, it is neither tasty nor particularly easy to drink.  I always pass on this stuff.  At least it’s better than Tuborg, which is saying almost nothing since I positivley hate Tuborg.
33 cl bottle. Pours a nice golden color with a white head. Aroma of hops. A very drinkable beer (gotta have at least two to make it count). Forever a Danish classic.

(as ’export’ brewed in sweden at 5.1%) 33cl green bottle.   Gold, clear, frothy white head.   Weak grassy, grainy aroma, some skunk.   Flavor is mostly   watery grainy with some sweetness and almost no hops.   Boring, but drinkable. (3,3,5,3,8;2.2)                      (as Carlsberg Beer, 4.6% danish version)   Pretty much the same beer, maybe slightly less graininess and more sweetness.   Same score.             (as Carlsberg Hof at 4.2%)   33cl bottle.   Ultra bland variant of the standard Carlsberg.   Very watery palate, almost no flavor. (3,3,4,2,7;1.9)
Very good fallback beer. No frills. Very much a relaxing beer. Watery texture, but not detrimental. Bearable aftertaste

Bottle. Golden straw-color with a fluffy white head that stayed as a quarter-inch ring on top of beer. It left a nice lacing on the glass. Minimal aroma. Tastes of sweet malt. Pretty standard European lager. Would make a good lawn mower or session beer.

Sampled as Carlsberg Export in UK. Goodness me, the head just shoots up pilsner glass when poured. Nothing much in mouth. Easy drunk, but not much taste at all. 

Next Morning....god what a sore head..now I know why it was cheap.

This, however, is nothing compared to Cypriot Carlsberg...........would rate that FAR higher
Largely boring, but dependable. Just like macros in North America, perhaps a little better, but not much. Perhaps the only reason to choose it over local macros would be to feel more "cultured"?
Light and Skuny beer.  This doesnt stand out amongst other European brands. Overall its a subpar brew that I prob will not get again.
Tra le lager insulse che invadono il mercato, questa è una delle meno fastidiose; bevuta numerose volte in diverse occasioni, l’ultima a Castellina Marittima (PI).
Not good, but about the same as other pale lagers. Nothing unique about this one. Drinkable when cold.
11.2 oz bottle. Aroma is slightly skunky. Taste is same, light and skunky. Easy to drink.

Had lots of this on the brewery tour in Copenhagen and recently had a bottle over here.  Aroma is pure skunk with nothing else even showing up.  Flavor is boring and has a sicking sourness to it. I’ve had lagers from Eastern Euro countries that don’t exist anymore which are way better than this.  The tour is free in Copenhagen so go ahead and take it but there are lots of better things to do there.
Green 33cL bottle.  Clear golden color.  Strong skunk hop aroma.  Flavor is mellow with a medicinal hop bitterness finish.
Strong skunk aroma, but if you can get past it, you might find some grass and cherry. Yellow color, thin head. Nice balance of grain and honey. Faint grass finish. Not a bad mass produced beer.

I drank alot of this in Europe , This is a top notch beer for sure I really enjoy drinking Carlsberg. This is refreshing and crisp tasting. In Ireland they make every imported beer with malted barley that caused all the beer to taste sweeter and thicker then its Canadian brewed version , I like the version here better then Irelands but Carlsberg is pretty good never the less.

Bottle 0.33L.
Clear pale yellow body with an average, frothy, white head, mostly diminishing with a fair lacing.
Light malty and hoppy aroma, with an unpleasant skunky, sulphuric note.
Flavour is light sweet and moderate bitter.
Light-to-medium body, watery texture; soft carbonation; metallic feeling in the finish.
Really not satisfactory, if not as a thirst quencher when properly chilled.

500ml can. pours yellow/gold with small white head. the most middle of the road of all the beers ive had. subtle balanced aromas and flavours. its a fine beer but no challenge or complexity. price reasonable but nothing to go out of your way to get.
Carlsberg in cyprus !!! The best beer for me. A cold carlsberg in a hot summer is very enjoyable in my country
I like this one.   It probably is the best beer in the world.   Its just right for me Its a step up from most lagers, and cheaper than alot of the darker beers I like.  Its great on a hot day.

330 mL bottle.  Pours a pale, clear, yellow color; white, fizzy head initially, 1.5 cm tall.  The head diminishes quickly.  Very mild aroma, can’t put my finger on it.  Non-distinct flavor initially, finishes mildly bitter.  In general I feel as though this beer is too watery and is no longer appealing once above the chilled temp.  Pretty disappointing.

can.
This is probably not the best beer in the world.
No aroma, less taste, and thin and watery  mouthfeel.

This is a classic beer.  I remember the commercials as a child with the famed Carlsberg Clydesdales.  Haven’t seen those in years, makes me wonder if they still have those.  This beverage has an alright aroma, typical beer aroma.  The colour is a nice golden colour.  It has a smooth mouthfeel.  The taste is bland, similar to other beers of the style.  One thing of note is that this beer tastes better cold than at room temperature.

RB #1000, clearly a personal RB milestone. And this beer deserves to be amongst the first 1000 and it deserves this exact spot. Why?  Well H.C. Andersen said "Herfra min verden går" (From here my world endeavours). This holds true for this exact beer and my beerworld as well. In the lack of diversity one "learns" to adapt and accept a beer like this as "what beer is". This isn’t bad, just the way Carlsberg over the years have excerted their attitude towards the Danish beerscene has been bad, they have improved. Their people are all talented brewers, they just happen to work in a company that has to sell in big quantities to sustain in a global market - therefore it becomes mainstream. But on a warm summerday this beer does exactly what it should and the product they produce is ALWAYS the same - fact. If one likes it or not is a point of opinion and not a question about fact.



Therefore this is my rating 1000, 999 beers before this that all have been one big adventure thanks to a lot of nice people and hopefully many more beers and nice ratebeerians to come. CHEERS!



Darn, I guess I have to rate the bloody beer:



33 cL can. Pours golden yellow with a huge chalk white and creamy head disappearing within the first 30 seconds but leaving some lacing. Corn and malty slight sweet aroma. Corn sweet flavoured. Mild bitterness into the finish. Straight forward lager. Solid

330 ml bottle - While I remember thoroughly enjoying this at KL Airport I can only put it down to heat and exhaustion I was suffering at time. Pale yellow with a quickly dying white head. Medium to high carbonation. Thin bodied.  Low bitterness with a slightly grassy flavour.
Pale yellow in colour with low to medium carbonation and a thin white head. Light bodied with a slightly bitter mouthfeel and finish. Watery and average but great on a hot day!
Pale gold with a thin white head, no redeaming features to speak of - thin,tasteless and unmemorable, another bog standard beer.
This is ok, now that I’ve had other lagers that are better and have more hop smell, and more hope taste, I don’t like this anymore, not as much as I used to at least.

Had on Tap at Fado in Austin. Lightish gold, with little white head.  A slightly malty, heavily yeasty smell, with an overly bready, yeasty taste that was overpowering towards the end of the beer.  Smooth overall, but with a sweetish yeasty, maybe skunky aftertaste.

CAN. BOTTLE, TAP. Tried in Denmark last vacation. Nice yellow pale color, with mid white head, very refreshing flavor, good to hot days.

Cerveja clara e refrescante.

Bottle -- Very pale yellow with a medium fluffy white head that doesn’t hang around too long and leaves a little lacing. Aroma, which  jumps out at you the second you open the bottle, is standard European lager, with some skunkiness. Flavour is also standard European lager although with a little more metallic bitterness than usual. Watery mouthfeel. Not great, not awful -- just a run-of-the-mill European lager.

Pours a weak yellow colour with a thin froathy head that leaves a film ontop. Aroma is grainy and somewhat flowery.  A little sweet with a strong malty base, not enough hops. Over carbonated. But not a bad staple beer. But pretty boring.
Rerate: Well, carlsberg smartened up and started brewing this beer in Denmark where it should be brewed. So it looks a little better,  the head is more stable and frothy, the aroma is very grainy, and the flavor is hoppier than the Canadian brewed version.

Can.  Sweet,malty aroma.  It’s got a foamy white head, and is a light yellow color.  The flavor is a little bit apple-ish.  It’s got a very watery mouthfeel, and a slightly sweet aftertaste.  I don’t know, maybe I’ll buy this again, but I might not.
Bottle. Some maltiness and grain flavour, but fairly clean tasting premium lager. Drinkable if not exactly memorable. Doesn’t taste like cardboard.
better than the skunky, metallic cousin that is more readily available in the uk (hope i’ve got this one right) and the sponsors of liverpool f.c - so some redeeming features!

i have enjoyed this beer. probably a repetetive effect. good carbonation and an interesting old time (dad’s) beer taste. mildly fruity and even mildy burnt toffee sweet. refreshing with a loose as a goose finish. mildly bready.

[281-20070503] Tap @ Owl&Firkin (Markham, ON). Grainy yeast aroma. Clear, yellow body with medium bubbles and a short-lived white bubbly head. Grainy bread flavour. Fairly smooth, light-medium body. Not much going on but repeatable if fresh. (5/3/5/3/10) 2.6



[1545B-20080722] Tap. Aroma of straw-covered beer-drenched floor and wet grains. Clear, yellow brown body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Tinny grains and watery straw flavour. Medium body. Great for watching the game, but it didn’t bring Toronto any luck in this match. (4/2/5/2/11) 2.4

(@ TFC game vs. Montreal, BMO Field; Toronto, ON)
I had it on a plane ride. It was this or Coors light so I choose this having never tried it before. It wasn’t bad, but nothing special at all. Wouldn’t buy it, but I’d drink it for free again. :)

Canned 50cl. A yellow beer. Sweet flowery and malty aroma. Corny. The nose is alright. Graniy, flavors of corn, watery, soapy. There are some medicinal notes. A hint of peaches, very slightly smoky. Extremly faint buttery, grassy bitterness. Poor dry finish.

Rated 4/20/07:  Single bottle from the shop down the road, always been curious about this and the Elephant (next up in the lineup) but never wanted to spend the cash on an entire sixer. Deep yellow pour, creamy white head that collapses, and decent lacing. Poured into a glass at an arms length away and I could immediately smell the aroma....unfortunately is was a strong scent of euro-skunk. The beer has a fuller mouthfeel than I expected but it’s tacky. Flavor is decent rather uneventful, light malts with some grainy adjunct flavors and stale grass. Drinkable but soon forgotten.

Pale yellow appearance with an average size head and good lacing.  Understated, grassy aroma.  Bland, inoffensive taste, lightly hopped, with a cereal-like, sweet malt flavor.  Watery, light-bodied, decently carbonated mouthfeel leading to a short lived, slightly bitter finish.
Poured into a dimpled mug...light golden color with an extremely small head.  The scent was lemony with some light biscuity tones.  A very forgetable beer.
meh. typical skunky euro lager. Why do people think this skunk adds to the beer. Has to be server super cold, to get rid of that skunk, otherwise, close to undrinkable.
Typical skunky hop flavor.  Ok when cold but just not very good ...............
A really ordinary lager with almost no taste and also no smell at all. Also some oxidation.
Not much to say about this one that hasnt been said already. Vague malty nose and a weak hobby bitter finish. Thin body...mainstream
11.2oz bottle-pours a white head and yellow color.  Aroma is grain, lime.  Taste is grain/light malt, lime/light hops.  OK carbonation.

I don’t know why brewers use a green bottle.  Any beer put into one invariably tastes similar to any other.  This was no exception. Not that it was really bad just average.  Pale yellow with a flakey white head, decent aroma complete with a skunky taste due to too much light meeting the beer.  Better on tap.

Actually, not a very bad pale lager. It has decent flavor, decent carbonatin, a nice head that leaves lacing, and there are mild flavored hops that give it a bit of bitterness. I paired this with a spice pasta dish, here in the tropics, and it went down very well and was re-freshing. You get the sense that there aren’t a lot of adjuncts in here, so a decent pale lager.

Bottle. Clear light golden color, white head. Aroma light, hoppy. Thin body. Tatse sweet, and a very light hop, ...
a industrial product.
Bottle. Pours yellow. Fizzy. Sulphur smell. Raunchy, dirty taste. Slightly sweet. Sad.
Probably the most boring beer in the world. No offensive off-flavors like Corona, just watery and made for the masses.
yellow body with a white head and a light hoppy aroma a moderate sweet taste and a average sweet finish  a medium body
Draft.This is not the best beer in the world but i guess the most famous.Easy to drink golden colour grainy aroma tast of hops and water.
A low quality Danish beer that has hit the US and has become a very nice casual drinking beer.  Has a weak palate but the taste is light and sweet. Compares well with Heinekin.

Bottle. 11.2 FL. OZ. Very clear, gold color. Little head that disappears quickly.  Sweet, grainy aroma.  Fizzy palate resembling that of a soft drink.  Flavor is also sweet with a surprisingly clean finish.  Nothing special, but drinkable.

Bottled and Draught
As major beers go, I enjoy this one, although its nothing to write home about on the gourmet front. Pale clear colour, with a quickly disappearing  bubble head. A rather weak palate, but enjoyably crisp. As others have mentioned, some malty tones, but bitter on the aftertaste.

341 bottle:  Some definite malty & sweet tones, but dont’ taste the corn everyone blasts.  Little on thin side & hops not quite there to give little crispness, but this is not undrinkable by any means.  Thin to moderate mouthfeel & body, and finish lacks.  There are far tastier pale lagers out there, but there are also many worse, so these reviews are kind of harsh.
12 oz. bottle at Zeno’s, Penn State.  Poured pale gold with virtually no head.  Typically poopy ass lager.  Very thin with no body.  How is a beer this bad so popular in Europe?  Hmm...marketing?
33 cl bottle. Norwegian version by Ringnes (4,6%). No bitterness. Easy drinking, easy forgotten. Give me a beer, please.
Typical pale lager, with a very weak aroma, taste and coloration. Nothing more to say...

Can bought in Japan. Brewed on licence by the 4th biggest brewer in Japan, Suntory, since 1986. Golden clear colour with a big average lasting white head. Fresh aroma of malt and hops. Fresh clean malty flavour with hoppy bitterness. Leaves a good pringley carbonation on the tongue, wanting you to order more. Actually one of the freshest macro Carlsberg beers I have ever had. Draft in this case does NOT mean like fresh from tap. draught, draft. In Japan draft is a Japanese brewing style where the bottled beer is filtered in a different way. 
Earlier Rating: 1/4/2007 Total Score: 1.7
Golden refreshing waterish beer. A typical world pi**y pale lager. Boooring.

Draft. "Probably The Best beer In The World" the brewery tries to tell the buyer. NO WAY! This brewery uses a lot of money in advertising and commercials in TV, telling the same story: "You need to drink this, if you are a man and part of the game". The problem with this "best beer" being they only sell WHEN the beers on sale very cheap in the supermarkets. Here in Denmark the same brew being sold as Dansk Pilsner (very low price) and earlier as Pokal Pilsner. Carlsberg - Probably a part of the game, at cheating customers. Carlsberg also uses unfair methods to keep imported beers away from bars, pubs, restaurants and the consumer. By its ownership in the danish bottle refund system and its clean marketing and long term contracts.
Must i say, I never buy Carlsberg products and never drinks them, unless its served for free..

This is definitely one of my favourite beers. Sure it’s a macro, and Carlsberg makes a lot of other higher end stuff, but when compared to other generic beers this one is really good. I had it right after a bottle of American Budweiser, so maybe I was prone to love whatever I had next to compare to the worst beer in North America, but I genuinely loved the slightly fruity taste. Minor skunk but nothing terrible, decent grainy malt body. Great finish and aftertaste. Very drinkable. Edit: I don’t adore this beer anymore quite like I did when I was 17 but this is actually something I can enjoy when nothing better is available. One of the more tolerable macro’s out there by my tastes. Edit: As a Liverpool supporter, how the hell can you not enjoy the hell out of this. Drank up lid.

Bottle (export, 5.1%). Pale golden with a white head. Malty and sweaty with a very light bitterness.


Can (hof, 4.2%). Golden colour with a white head. I guess this is all-malt but it still smells of corn. Malty, Carlsberg-sweaty flavour.

For the sake of rating it and getting it out of the way, I ordered it, the only good thing about carlsberg IMHO is the glass, looked nice, good head, smelled very faintly of hops and chemicals, tasted like dishwater, experiment over, NEXT!
Decent lager, but not much of a head, and bit sweet. Quite popular, but unknown why!
has a good hoppy smell out of the bottle... none out of the pour... large white head yet very little carbonation..has a thick body for a lager yet not a lot of flavor..like american keg beer ...
one of the house favorites. easy to drink taste. yeah, it smells skunky and doesnt look like much but for some reason we like it.
Ugly color. Head goes away very quickly.  Taste isn’t that bad.  A little sweet. Not enough bitterness.  I would drink it if it was around, but I won’t go out and buy this again.

Very mild, sweet malty aroma with some slight skunkiness.  Crisp, slightly bitter flavors with a bit of sweet malts and possible adjuncts.  Very light body, very easy to drink... very thirst quenching but not much of a "beer".  I won’t be drinking this again.
Solid contribution to the pale lager category.  Some pretty savage reviews for a decent beer.
Bottled. Typical yellow fizzy beer. Sweet with light bitterness. Nothing much to say for it.
Not impressed, pale and week, not much head, light on the palete with no follow though;  thought it was a light beer.
A great beer, but the price is way to high. Try a cold one and you will love it!
Pale yellow wnd no head at all. Toushes of malt, hops, grape and lemon. Bit thin and watery.
Pale, clear with a small white head. Sweet bready aroma with some light citrus in the background. Kind of skunky flavour, sweet, mildly malty and not very bitter at all. Average.
Tastes like buttered popcorn. Has a buttery taste and a yeasty finish. Not very good.

On tap.  What do you expect its the danish budweiser.  Really glad I didn’t get it out of the green bottle now that I see that.  Cheap, light, and refreshing.  Not worthy of a 2.29...its like a not as bold heiniken.
not too outstanding. light and pretty tasty, but nothing I would go out of my way to find again.

Bottle: yellow clear colour, nice white head.
Aroma of mais(?), sweet bitter nose, wery distinct aroma. Flavor is smouth week versjon of the aroma. Thin body, short finish. This was borring folks!
Got some corn and very light malt in the aroma.Pours a fizzy yellow with a slight white head.Not a whole lot in the way of flavor,some light malt maybe.Thin mouthfeel with a slightly bitter finish.

There was nothing good about this beer at all. It was a poor attempt by a Danish brewer to copy Heineken, which in itself is marginal. 

This poured to a light yellow gold color, with thin white head that disspated quickly and left little lacing. Aroma and flavor were both almost non-existent, and the palate was stale and tasted like wet cardboard.

Pass on this one.
had this lager on many an occasion, standard lager, nothing to write home about
Somewhat weird nose aroma.  Excellent appearance.  Sexy hop flavor noted with slight malty undertones.  Palate is ok.  I wouldn’t mind buying this if it weren’t so expensive.

So many great beers come out of Copenhagen, but this is not one of them.  There just isn’t much going on here.  It is somewhat sweet and somewhat mashie tasting.  Of mild interest is the tart/bitter aftertaste.
Like a Heineken, only much worse.  Skunky aroma.  Odd funky skunky taste with almost soapy like bubbles.

Pale yellow with next to no head. The smell reminds me of festivals. There are also quite a bit cabbage and chemicals to be detected. 
The taste has a strange bitterness that last about 0,1 sec. After that it’s all malts, a bit of vegetables and a strange sweetness.
All in all it’s thin, and uninteresting. But still drinkable.
Can in Amsterdam. Eggy smell. Hoppy, eggy and watery taste. Just another lager, but macrohouse. Quite poppy with lots of mouthfeel.

[b][i]Draught[/b][/i] - bright, golden and clear, with a small, foamy white head that dissipates quickly into a thin ring that leaves quite a lot of lacing in the glass. Aroma is quite sweetly malty, but otherwise not much going on. Some grain perhaps, but smells clean. Flavour is also quite clean, which is good, with malt sweetness and a little bit of lightly citrusy hops in the finish with a touch of bitterness. Medium carbonation. Surprisingly adequate, and in my opinion easily better than Heineken and many other "import" pale lagers. Inoffensive.
Bottle. Golden colour small head. An average lager. A little malt and some bitterness in the finish. Nothing to write home about
25cL bottle.  Light flavored pale lager that is average with most other exported, mass-produced pale lagers.  Fine, but nothing special

Bottle at home and several pubs and restaurants through years.
Pale golden with a white head, quickly gone. Light/moderate malty, moderate hoppy. Light sweet with a fine bitterness. Light body, normal/heavy carbonated.

500 ml. can or bottle. Golden with white, medium head. VERY Sweet taste of malts. I like it.
* i will add about aroma later, because i have snuffle
Indistinguishable light lager, except for a slight citrus taste. Drinkable, but not memorable
Bottle.  Pale yellow color, basically no head, minimal carbonation.  Aroma of straw, mildly sweet taste of water and vague grass hops.  Extremely thin mouthfeel, goes down like slightly sour water.

Pale gold,short lived head. Aroma was watery grains and a hint of skunk. Not much too this actually but went down quick and easy. Better than Becks,Heinies or Grolsch.Palate was not bad just too watery keeping it a 2.

Pretty standard pale lager. Translucent gold in the glass with a minimal white froth for a head. It has slightly hoppier on the palate than similar brews. Hard to believe it took me this long to ever drink one.

Cold 11.2oz bottle:  Pours a clear golden color with minimal alabaster bubbles around edges.  Aroma is of sweet malts and grassy hops. Taste is of grassy hops and sweet malts with hints of citrus.  Watery texture, crisp and well carbonated.  Ending is of earth notes and grass.
Also called HOF. Lowaverage beer, but much attention to this "probably the best beer in the world". A bit more hoppy than Tuborg, which was my preferable beer some years ago.

Drank a bottle of this while having lunch in the Carlsberg offices, Copenhagen. Surrounded by Carlsberg employees I couldn’t exactly spit this stuff out, but rather grinned and nodded profusely while desperately trying to lose my glass behind a plant pot. In fairness it’s not disgusting, just grainy and uninspiring.
I let myself out.

I could smell the skunk before I poured the bottle. I have allergies too, think about it. Pale piss gold with a fizzy lingering head.  Typical of lagers. The universe be damned the smell makes me dry heave. It has a skunky, almost flatulent musty taste. It’s watery typical of a pale lager. I think I finnally found something worse than sapporro.
Goes down pretty smooth, no real after-taste, but for the most part its a typical green-bottled pale lager.

A Mes rate:
What the hell was I doing drinking this? Can’t even remember having it to be honest. Was on my list of rates so sadly it must have passed my lips at some point. Safe to say, my only lasting impression of this is that it was rank.

Carlsberg Export. The only beer available at the family Christmas gathering. I thought i’d rate it just to keep the numbers up!! Standard issue Euro lager. Pale yellow in colour, a quickly dissipating head and strong metallic hop elements in both the aroma and the taste. A last resort!
On tap.  poured light yellow/amber with average white head.  Aroma of grains, tasted hops with metallic hint, finished bitter.  Not a favourite of mine.

Tried again on 01/07/2008. Still seems a bit too sweet, but it is clean, refreshing, and drinkable. // 

Light, clean, hoppy aroma. Clear light gold, with substantial white head. Starts with clean light hop, followed by a bit of malt sweetness. Beats Bud.

I have had a lot of friends talk highly about this beer. I finally tried it, and I wasn’t too impressed. I wasn’t sure what to expect from this beer other than it being different like most beers in green bottles. With the first sip, an unusual sting hit my tongue. It wasn’t like an alcoholic sting as much as being a weird flavor sting. It doesn’t have a good flavor and not much body.

Can 500 cl. Norwegian version brewed by Ringnes Bryggerier. 4,5% ABV. Pale golden with a rapidly disappearing white head. Dry, metallic nose. Clean taste with weak flavors of medium sweet malts/grain. Low hopbitterness, lively carbonation.  Short, dry finish. Not bad, not offensive, but uninteresting.

Green bottle, pop off cap and get a yeasty slightly vegetable cabbage aroma, permeating the area.  Pours like a typical pale yellow, lemony colored american beer. Nice flavorful impact with out the bitterness of malts or hops, quite clean.  Good pringley carbonation that is nice. Finish leaves me wanting more.
Sampled at Broudy’s Holiday Beerfest 12/2/2006, Jacksonville FL.    Just a macro import lager, but not a bad one.  At least its drinkable.  Beats the hell out of a BMC.
Bottle, 4.6%. Golden colour, small unstable white head. Grainy aroma, hint of green apple. The flavour is also grainy and has a strange bitterness. A quite ordinary pale lager.
Golden colored pour with thick frothy head.  Skunky hoppy aroma with a malt flavored finish.  Eh!!!

Nice looking bottle, very good beer inside.
Very enjoyable beer, think i’ll buy a whole case of this next time!
Wow this is a very low rating for such a decent beer. When I want a good refreshing pale lager, I’d prefer a Carlsberg. Just a good beer.

0,25l bottle at home. On the bottle it says 5.5% alcohol. Pale yellow with big head that diminished quickly. Lacing  remained on the glass all the way. Hoppy nose. Metallic taste with bitter aftertaste. When you are thirsty it will do.

Nice gold color,with a thin head. Minimal lace. Strange aroma -- reminds me of the outgas from items made of PVC. Do you know what a new plastic shower curtain smells like? Unfortunately, the flavor is kind of an extension of that. Maybe it’s just me, but I doubt I’ll rush out to get any more of this. Hopefully, you will have a better experience.

finally get to try the beer that sponsors liverpool...wow!.. now i’m a women, because liverpool are vaginas...has a very beautiful head and lacing...average smell...lots O bubbles...muddled taste but only slightly offensive...pretty good for a mass produced import lager.

Saw this constantly advertised while watching many EPL matches....so I had to try it.  Pale clean yellow.  light white head that fads quickly.  Aroma is light, some hops maybe...A bit on the skinky side.  Light bodied beer, with nothing note worthy to say.  An Ok beer with a lingering aftertaste.

II’m giving this a 3 for appearance because the head was a lovely creamy color & consistancy (which faded with 2 minutes). Otherwise it’s just a corn water yellow lager. Smells of skunk-n-latex. Infact, it smells like a freshly opened condom. Go figure. Tastes like metal. Like that taste you get when you have several X-rays at the same time. It’s, um. It’s not good. Denmark version, purchased at liquor store in W. Allis, Wisconsin 11/11/2006.
99 cents for 12 ounce bottle.

Bottled. Clear pale golden with a rather small head. Ok lets try to be diplomatic here - metallic - sterile and just plane boring. La la la - brian jonestown massacre rule - ahh - what was I talking about???
Metallic tasting watery Euro-lager. Drinkable but boring. I haven’t drank this for awhile....now I remember why.

Mainstream. Standard good quality pilsner

light, slightly bitter aftertaste nice color.

"By appointment to the royal danish court". I kid you not, that is exactly what it says on the case, accompanied by "possibly the best beer in the world." Very watery beer, lacks any sort of real flavour. It is a drinkable watery beer, but that is as far as it goes. The head is white and the palate is non-existent. I would drink it for free, but for the price, I have a much better selection to pick from.

I’ve had both the English and the Danish versions of this beer. They say it might be the best beer on Earth. Yeah, and Budweiser is the king of beers. Overall, not too bad. It is a rather pale beer, with a metallic aftertaste. I drank it really cold and it really went down smoothly.

Can 50cl. Poured pale gold with a frothy white head which slowly fades. No real aroma, a hint of malt & hops. Sharp metallic hop flavour, slightly citrus. No real finish, just watery perhaps a touch of bitterness. Quite unpleasant unless its really cold. Medium palate, not as watery as most macrobrew lagers. Average lager, though one of the better macros you get on tap in your standard pub.

Pours a golden color with a white poofy head. Very little carbonation. Might be a little flat from the trip across the Atlantic. Tastes watery, hardly any bubbles on the tongue. Slight bitter aftertaste, but overall a nice easy drinking lager that should be better when fresh.
Bottle 48F Lager Glass. Aroma is light hops and light malts, very clear water like look.Not much to say except the carbonation is good, other than that it is a fairly straight forward light lager.
Can 33cl at home. An old time favorit of mine. But it’s been a while since I have had one. Light yellow - white head. Light malty, almost no hop, light sweetness.
Light brown colour, medium head.  A nice tasting beer when cold, tastes awful when warm.
A fairly decent beer with clean crisp traditional lager flavor, lacks the boldness to seperate it from all the other lagers

A malty aroma with a light hops contribution.  Clear appearance with a slight, quickly dissipating head.  A lightly bitter and sour flavor, and a light-medium body with moderate carbonation.  I sampled this beer on tap in Ireland.
Very light and bubbly.  Slightly skunky smell.  Fresh taste, very mild, slightly malty.
What a shatty little beer. Tastes a bit like Heineken to me with that weird almost skunked flavor. If you did this tastetest blind you could tell this thing was european mass produced stuff.
Bottle in Wroclaw. Went well with my lebanese meal. Surprised that it actually had flavour, fairly hoppy and a bit citrus.
Golden colour, big white bubbly head. grain and malt aroma. Light hops, grain, some sweetness in flavour. Bit of a sour bite to the finish. Some finishing hops.
Even do this is the national drink in Denmark, I am not a big fan of this beer. Low in flavor and aroma. Mass produced beer, what else can be said....
500 ml can: straw colour, fast disappearing white head and a little carbonation. Sweet aroma and initial taste, followed by some hoppiness.

Tapped (Bahnhof Westerland/Sylt): Pale golden, thin  white foamy layer; nearly no aroma detectable, maybe some malt with a molecular illusion of bitterness; flavour not to describe, just a bit sticky; faint bitter, watery finish. Had to stop drinking after three sips...........
Yellow brew, very bubbly. Foamy white head with a pear, apple aroma, a bit woody. Very smooth, light body malty flavor Aftertaste is undescrible but not in a good way. Denmarks version of BMC
Just another mass-produced pilsner, which has nothing to give. Thin and sweet, with a small hint of bitterness. Watery with no head.

Draft. Used to be pretty common in my college days, but I can’t remember ever having one before. Smell brings out a detectable hoppiness, so that puts it ahead of other megabrews. Have to call its appearance "average:" a golden pils color with a thick head. Taste is definitely malty, a bit grainy, can almost pick out a North Euro hop profile. Average mouthfeel with prickly bubbles. Close to decent for an imported macro.
Bottle. Golden color with small white head. A little taste of hops. Boring Danish pilsner.
Bottle at Bakersifelds Brews in The Village; weak malt hop aroma; gold with a small white head, Flavor of a little malt and citrus.

Verre de dégustation, provenant d’un fût, dégusté au Festival Bières et Saveurs 2006 (Chambly, QC). Arôme: Légère odeur de malt. Apparence: La couleur est blonde pâle. Présence d’une mince col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût d’houblon floral. Aucun arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est la texture sont mince. Faible effervescence en bouche. (Rating #628)
Nothing to mention really. seems like waste of time, in a world with more than enough qualitybeers to chose from.

had at old chicago.  a little leary since most product they don’t turnover is skunky.  not to be disappointed, a very pungent euro hops aroma dominated the dry taste.  best thing about this was some pretty fierce lacing.

Can 0,5l at 5,1%.Pale golden colored. An OK creamy head. Aroma of metallic malt. Then it’s plain water. Dull, dull, dull. KI=6.
Earlier rating 3 - 2 - 2 - 2- 3 = 1,3 : Bottle 0,33l. 4,7% Alc. Pale golden. Fizzy. A small white head. Aroma of grain. Leaving you with a dry aftertaste with hints of puke.

When I lived aboard, Danish beer was the big deal. This and Tuborg. Looking back, I realize that we were just young and naive. If I had to, I’d choose it over most American commercials. Otherwise, it remains a memory.
Boring.  Just boring.  Brass color, a little fizz, pinch of hops, no real taste.  I wouldn’t even call it a euroloager, since even there you get some hops and malt unlike with Carlsberg.
Golden colour with pour white head. A little taste of hops. Boring Danish pilsner.

i actually quite like carlsberg myself. Its a popular commercial beer and after drinking it you can see why. What i found most distinctive was that it had a creamy soft like texture to the beer. Apart from that everything else was quite average, good pub brew and if the occasion called for it you could knock these down pretty quickly.
Geez, this is just typical pale lager territory. Sweet, malty and sugary. (Australian brewed under licence).

300ml bargain bottle. Skunky, grassy aroma. Shaving foam head studded with impressive white clumps. Malty caramel and surprisingly assertive, pilsener-like bitterness. Artificially creamy, but almost tasty. Better than expected.
my friend james let me have a taste of this authentic danish beer... it was pretty good tasting. had it at a pub in central london with some tasty steak flavored "crisps"

A popular, cheap "import" beer that’s quite popular in Canada, and one that sits next to Molson on the beer towers at the pubs.

This is a good one to drink if yiou’ve been out in the sun. make sure you serve this extra cold because it has a very pronounced burnt wood taste to it.

Draft @ Great Lost Bear in Portland - Poured a clear golden yellow in color with a small white head that faded to nothing.  Aroma was slightly skunked and not much else.  Flavor was pretty non-desript with strong hints of adjuncts rather than malts and some bitterness, but hop flavor was missing.  Not very good...
Good Brew. Gets you through a crazy night in Geneva nicely. Can’t find it much in NH though.
Golden, skunky, sweet, cheap and generic. Nothing memorable, besides the cheap skuky & sugary malt. Maybe a light hint of corn skunkyness. nothing more.
Golden amber color with froathy white head. Sweet skunky hoppy aroma. Nice deep malt flavor finish.

(12 oz bottle: BevMo in La Jolla, CA) Carlsberg vs. Tuborg -- the battle of the Danish crap beers is on!  While Tuborg is sweet, grainy, corn-like in flavor, and cardboardy, the even sweeter Carlsberg doesn’t seem to have the corn or cardboard flavors.  Not that I’m finding Carlsberg , but it’s less bad than Tuborg.  Or maybe it’s equally bad, but bad in a different way.  That metallic finish is pretty gruesome though.  Generic bad beer aroma of cheap, sugary "malt".  Light body falls just short of being totally watery -- how’s that for ringing endorsement?  Carbonation is about average for this style.  Medium straw in color and completely clear so the steady rise of carbonation bubbles is fully visible.  The beer pours a tall, white head, but it recedes to a thin ring and leaves no lacing on the glass.  Honestly, both beers are bad and I can’t pick a winner in this Danish Duel.  But I know who the loser is -- ME, I drank these two beers!!

Bottle, 330 ml. What to expect here.. not much I guess. This is actually OK though, more appealing than many other pale lagers, but I’d rather fork up that little extra dough that would buy me something nice instead.

341ml Bottle, 5% a/v
Pours a light straw colour with a generous white head. Smell consists largely of grains and hops. Tastes quite hoppy as well. Very viscous mouthfeel though. Pretty good beer, and went well with the World Cup, but not an every day beer, nor a fancy impressive beer. Somewhere in between.
Pale yellow with white head. Aroma of hops. Lively carbonated. Watery texture. Sour hoppy finish! Incredibly not ok!
bottle. pale yellow color. medium carpy white head. taste very watery. bearly any hops or malts. bad.
