A watery brew, I used to think this one was heavy flavored, but what a change 10 years makes, not even as skunky as I remember, a boring lager with little flavor.

Canadian version brewed by Moosehead.  Bought a 24-pack for a Canada Day BBQ.  Woohoo!!!!  Brown bottle + brewed locally = no skunk.  This beer is my macro  of choice when hosting parties and such; slightly more hop presence than your standard Blue/Canadian/Bud/Coors etc.  Nice nutty beginning as well.  A great crowd pleaser that I enjoy. Came with a free soccer t-shirt too!!!
RE-rate: No longer brewed by Moosehead.  Now back to green bottles, still the same beer but with a bit more skunk. Looses some aroma points.  Be sure to get it on draft or in a can even, got a few tall boys for Labour day weekend.

I keep buying beers that I know are going to be skunky just becasue they are popular and I want to try them.  This was probably my favorite of the skunk beer variety.  I think I am actually starting to enjoy the European skunk lagers.  I’ll keep working on it.

This must be Denmark’s budweiser.
Pass on this one.A taste of water
more than anything else.

Bottle (brewed under license by Mcauslan in Montreal): Poured a yellow color lager with a medium white bubbly head with average retention. Aroma of sweet malt is more present then expected with some crisp hops. Taste is a notch below your average pale lager with some crisp hops that are actually discernable. I’m guessing that I fell on a recent batch because this is really better then expected.

Bottle.  This beer looks better than it is.  As with many macros, the formula produces a great head and balanced body, with malt and hops in good measure.  But, the green bottle has to go.  The age we get these in the country means they have aged and the lighter bottle doesn’t help.

I used to think this was the cat’s meow.  This is a lighter pale lager with a decent balance.  Not too bitter not too sweet.  This rating is generic, but their is not much to say about this beer.  It seems a lot of raters here get skunked ones, mine was good and fresh.  Green bottles are hit or miss.  For a plain macro lager this is better than most.  Good lawnmower beer.

white,a bit artificially looking head
pale yellow
smells malty-sweetish, a bit hoppy
rather carbonated
smells more bitter than expected by smelling,and not so sweet
aftertaste some bitterness,almoust no malty taste
smell and taste are not really fitting together
not bad,but not interesting, a bit boring

Fyraftensøl (33 cl. flaske).

Kedelig dansk øl med normal kulsyre, som dog er god til at slukke tørsten med eller drikke sig fuld i.

Hvis der er andre muligheder at vælge i mellem ville jeg aldrig vælge denne.

<!-- i -->Right out of the bottle<!-- /i -->A bit boring standard danish lager. Taste is hoppy and carbonation is slightly over moderate. Sort of fresh and best served cold. In fact, the colder the better. Not very bad at all, but not very good either.

Kind of dissapointing. Reminded me of a Bud; but I expected a lot more. Hardly a body at all,  tasted watered down. I’ve had a series of bad beers, and this one takes the cake in the "imported but nothing special" category.
Light pilsner with only a tad more flavor than Budweiser. Guess there’s more to Amsterdam than Carlsberg. Comparably disappointing as Moretti’s and other weak Pilsners.
Bottle. Pours pale golden with a decent white head. Aroma of grain, skunk, sweet malts, and hops. Flavor is bitter, grainy, and malty. Decent body, better than most US macro.

(04.04.06) 330 mL green bottle consumed at the Rose Garden of Shamian Island, Guangzhou, China. Bottled 12.28.05. 11oP. Poured clear golden yellow with large short lived white head. Good carbonation. Sweet grassy skunk aroma. Dry with some malt sweetness and corn flavor. Finished dry with light malt fade. Light bodied. No discernable hop presence. Refreshing and drinkable but still tasted like a generic Chinese lager. Not a memorable beer.

This is a good beer for a person who refuses to drink American beers, but wants something like them.  Nothing special here, but not the worst i’ve had by far.  Aroma is a bit odd, very grassy and hoppy while the taste is weak; not alot on mouthfeel as well.

Bottled.  Skunky open.  Clear yellow and soapy white head.  Malty aroma.  Tastes very grassy, sweet malt doesn’t cut much through it.  No bitterness.  Very soft mouthfeel.  Not challenging, but not mouth-turning.

This is my rating #1000. What to rate ? of course Carlsberg Lager. Why ?  because I had a thousand of them before I got my eyes of other tasting and great beers. This beer is really nice , but fucking dull and average.... 
Cheers   :O)
Very pale colour with limited head. Taste is slightly citric with a hoppy aftertaste. Just not very much of it...

awful, they should changed their line. ’probably the best beer in the world’ i think not. clolor is too pale and the tast does not leave an impression. people who feel its good probably got influenced by its aggresive marketing.

Pale in color. The nectar is very light with ample effers. A very clean and crisp brew with tart candy flavors and a slight bittering finish. Overall: More complex than most in it’s genre. A thirst quencher with no skunky presence.

This is a review of the actual beer "Carlsberg Hof" which is not the same as Carlsberg Export, even though Ratebeer makes it so.

33 cl bottle at 4.2% at Kafé Åkaj at amusementpark Liseberg in Gothenburg, Sweden.


Medium yellow straw color. Big white head, settling into about one finger thick.
Malty and sweet scent, no hops that I can detect.

Initally a bitter taste mixed with malts. Not much finishing bitterness, but a bit fruity aftertaste. Medium body.

Rather ok beer to be consumed on a warm and sunny day as I did.


The following is a previous revied of Carlsberg Export.

Sample at a beer tasting event at "Pannrummet" in Gothenburg, Sweden.
Light yelow color. Malty scent and taste. Good bitterness. Fairly boring, but still not as bad as I have remembered it. (This was a blind tasting)
Ar 5/Ap 2/Fl 5/Pa 3/Ov 10

Rerate
as Carlsberg Hof, 50 cl can from Systembolaget. Marked 4.2% ABV
BB 04 Jan 2010, on July 2009
Clear light yellow color, small but fluffy white head. Malty, vegetable, sweet scent. Weak, malty, metallic taste. Thin mouthfeel, low bitterness.
4/2/4/2/7=1.9

Rerate
As Carlsberg Export, marked 5.1% ABV
BB 13-JAN-2010, in July 2009
Clear pale yellow color, small white head. Malty, sweet, herbal scent. Malty, dry, grainy taste. Spritzy mouthfeel, medium bitterness.
5/2/4/3/8=2.2
my favorite beer.  very good taste.  one of the originals i have ever had...
Bottle. Friend offered me this before we went out into Oxford for the night, yeah thanks for that. Golden lager with plenty of bubbles bitter aftertaste.

Bottle. The second beer of five in my "mini swill tasting". This has to be better then the last beer I rated, Molson Canadian. It just has to. Pours a clear pale gold with a spare diminishing white head. Aroma of...well, there isn’t really any?! After a few attempts of shoving my nose practically right into it I get a bit of the usual sweet grainy macro Lager smell, though not as unpleasant as most. Damn that aroma is faint. Flavour’s a nice surprise, there’s nothing unpleasant about it. It’s not very flavourful but the fact that it’s drinkable and decent is more then you can usually hope for with these macro Lagers. It’s mildly sweet with a nice light hoppy finish -- I could see this being somewhat refreshing on a hot summer day. Light bodied. This surprised me, it’s pretty decent and thankfully, better then Molson Canadian. Will the third beer be even better?

this carlsber stuff is everywhere in europe, why? my friend brought me back a glass from israel. are you kidding me israel? typical bitter metallic adjuct ridden beer.  if you get it in the bottle chances are it will be skunked and very tangy on the palate.

Purchased a bottle at Thirstys Liquors in DeKalb, IL. As soon as I opened it, there was a skunky scent to it Very watery, and has an awfu, strong astringent aftertaste. Maybe it was an old bottle, so I’ll probably give Carlsberg another chance someday...

damn man. Someone must have pissed off a skunk over in the wooded area next to my apartment complex. I opened this thing up in the kitchen, and with no exageration, smell it in my room. Pours with a massive white sudsy/coacy head. Grain off yellow clear apple juicy in colour. Cant smell nothing but skunk. Taste is surprisngly smooth with a very faint bitterness, if at all. more sweet malty haygrass. Some wheatgrass charachteristics. No real after taste. This is kind of american major brewer but smoother. Id rather hammer these at a non soccer sporting event than the choices they offer now. skunktacular.

On draft
The Danish version of Budweiser.  Only slightly better.  Gold fizzy lager with  soapy taste.

Bottle  Pours a clear gold with fizzy white head.  Had a hoppy aroma of spruce.  Taste was crisp a nd clean.  Good carbination.  Has an oily texture with a good feel.  Has a good duration with a decent bitter aftertaste.  I would get this typical swill.

Served on-tap in a standard bar pint glass at a local bar near my home.  Made an average appearance, poured a clear orange hued golden with a 



small, sticky, fizzy white head that reduced to a thin fizzy lacing.  Had a earthy herbal hop aroma with a little pale maltiness in the background
.  Medium carbonation and a slick light bodied mouth feel, average drinkability.  Had a herbal hop bitterness, just a very
light hop zing on the tongue, and a bland bready maltiness with a little lingering earthiness.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Pale yellow body. Decent carbonation. Taste is malty and grain. Aftertaste is a little bitter.
not terribly great but better than most canadian macro lagers.  thin and watery.  flavour very light.
Bottled  golden colour  white head. Mild aroma and flavour. relative short finish

Ever since I went to Denmark, and I could get this beer out of vending machines, I have been hooked. This beer tastes great, almost like there is a little honey in there. Anyway, I am a college student, and at only 6 bucks a 6 pack, I cant really complain... It tastes great for the price, and is a great way to celebrate a special occasion... There is nothing like a nice 6 pack, followed by another 12...

Light yellow colored, little vanishing white head. MIld sweetness, hops and skunkiness in aroma. Thin to medium bodied. Skunkiness also in flavor, medium carbonation with mildly bitter,  hopped and somehow honeyish ending.

In the movie ELF Will Ferrell takes a girl to a coffee shop that has cheap coffee, but a sign that says best coffee in the world, and he believes it.  Well  I had this first in Italy and there was a sign that said "Carlsberg Beer...Best Beer in the World."  Now if they meant slightly metallic, semi-bitter but not offensively with enough hops to keep you drinking, but not enough flavor to make you smile. .....Then maybe.

11.2oz bottle, green--hooray!  Pours a crystal clear light straw color with a small white head.  Very slight skunk smell, along with some corn, hay, and maybe a slight bit of biscuity sweetness.  Mind you, none of these smells are very strong.  Hops in the taste are pretty much gone before you hardly notice them, and some sweet maltiness is about the only other flavor.  Not bad flavor, just not much of one.

Bottle (341ml).  Poured pale bubbly clear gold with a decent white fluffy lasting head.  A grassy grain aroma, sugary malt, hint of rice(?) alcohol, I totally agree with Lumpy, definitely like pvc - a little funky, I initially thought "skunk" but I think it might just be stale hops.  Taste is actually minty, a bit like a Mento, dry scorched grass, quite sugary and a little harsh, but not horrid.  Mouthfeel is sharply lively, almost stinging, and strangely syrupy.  Would be a fine lawnmower beer, and I remember having it on tap in Paris and really liking it a lot, so fresher, when your feet hurt, it’s good.

Bottle. I am kind of surprised that I have not rated this one yet. Oh well. Pale gold body with a thin film for a head. Nose-burnt plastic. Taste-light bitter honey, slight metal, corn, slight cardboard, fizz, bland, uninspiring. Wood be a decent beer to consume in mass quantities.

330 ml bottle. Pale golden. Nice white head. Doesn’t really smell of anything. Very clean. Doesn’t actually taste anything either. Extremely bland. Low bitterness. Hops are distinctly metallic. Metallic water.
slightly parcial to this mass produced, unremarkable beer for nostalgic reasons. certainly not terrible.

On tap (at the Princess Luncheon, with my daughter of course, at Disney World). Poured a medium and see through golden color with a small sized white head. Aromas and tastes of grass and sweet malts (maybe some light honey). Not much else to say.

Clean, rounded, refreshing. Pours apple juice with a foamy white head. Feels good in the mouth and tastes good too. What it made me think of in Canadian beer terms is a 60% Moosehead 40% Blue combo with a bit more of a sweet flavor.

Nothing offensive about this beer  but very little to distinguish it from any other mass-produced beer. Plain aroma, flavor, and appearance. Nothing wrong with it, but there are much better beers out there.
Bottle. Pretty standard european lager.  Yellow, plain aroma, flavor, and look.  Nothing really special about this beer.
I think all European Pale Lagers are clones of one another.  It’s seems like there is very little variation.  A bit of a light hop aroma, with carbonated water.

I had this at a tasting at bevmo
this is a simple, yellow, clear, european macro-swill lager. nothing special here. There was nothing wrong with it, but there are lots better beers out there.
Bottle. Poured clear amber with a small white head that diminished quickly. Light sweet gassy aroma. Medium body. Moderate sweet bitter flavor with a small malt finish of average duration.
This is a standard Pame lager that is a bit worse than, say, Heineken.  I had it from a can in a Turc restaurant in Mons, Belgium.
Bottle. Pale golden beer with a white head. Grassy malt adjunct aroma. Crip flavor with a hint of playdough. Plain.
Not that bad.  Like it out of a bottle.  In a glass it obviously just doesn’t have enough poop to party with.  LIke a maltier less skunky Heineken.
Très, très, très fade, presque pas de goùt. Et ils sont pas gèné de dire que cette bière est probablement la meilleur au monde, je ne crois pas!

Bottled, 4,7%. Clear, pale gold. Nice, foamy, medium-sized white head.
Faint flowery hop aroma. Hint of corn. Ditto for flavor, plus a light sweetness that seems a bit artificial somehow. Hop returns somewhat bitterish in aftertaste.
Watery and thin, as these things tend to be. Medium carbonation.
Certainly not the best beer in the world, but a decent macrobrew lager.

After a long day of trekking around the city of Bath all I wanted was a good beer.  As long as it was of European origin, and as long as it was fairly cheap it would do.  I had blown all my money on good bread and genuine Stilton cheese, so what quid I had left would hardly be able to fill the bill for a fancy Belgian beer.  So off I went, walking and walking back to my youth hostel, seeing a scant few pubs, all of which looked commercialized or chained.  I wanted to go somewhere with historical significance mind you, like “The Eagle and Child”, but apparently what wasn’t doable in Bath.  Defeated and tired I crawled back into my Youth Hostel, only to remember they had a small bar open during evening hours.  There I went with, huffing and puffing, bent on having a European beer before I died from the long, acclivitous walk.  And all they served was Carlsberg.  Fine.  The beer’s name ended in “Berg”, and that sounded European enough.  To me it looked and smelled like the average canned lagers here in the states, but the taste was a bit more refined.  By refined I mean it didn’t send my digestive organs into immediate revolt.  That bit took about twenty minutes.  As time passed it felt like the Carlsberg was eating away at my stomach ling, bubbling and boiling away, probably manifesting itself into some embryonic demon-beast prepared to burst from my gut the next full moon.  My body must have sensed the imminent danger because the next thing I knew I was in a deep sleep somewhere in the living room.  Thanks to the efforts of my primal instincts I woke up an hour later, groggy and confused, but alive.  I checked my stomach for any teeth marks or any points of exit for beer borne Hell spawn but saw none.  I was lucky, and won’t be making the mistake of drinking Carlsberg again.

This is a poor man’s version of Heineken.  I personally like the crisp clean taste of carlsberg.  Ithe appearance is good and the beer looks great in a glass.  It has a crisp taste with a short minty spark that is quick to leave you mouth.

I love to drink this with a nice bowl of beef stew!
Pours a golden yellow color with a malty aroma muddled with hops.  Crisp malt flavor with some sweetness and a slightly bitter aftertaste.
On tap. This brew has no assuming features, about as ordinairy for a beer as you can get with a slight bitterness.

Can. Golden with small white head. Nice lacings. Malty aroma with some hoppiness. Clean, sweet malty flavor, but too thin. Commercial aftertaste. Rating:3-2-3-2-10-2.0. 051229

Bottle, regular Danish edition. It pours a clear, pale golden body topped by a rapidly diminishing finger-thick white head. Grainy, slightly sourish nose with a good fruityiness. Hops present, but they aren’t dominating in any way. Flavorwise there’s a pleasant bitterness, especially in the tail, but it’s thin and too carbonated. Grains, some fruityness too. A very drinkable beer, but unfortunately utterly boring and thin. In fact, it’s the lack of body that I dislike the most with this one. Makes it slide down very easily though, but you’re soon getting very tired of drinking it. 110114

I had never had a Scandinavian beer before and being a full-blood Norwegian I was excited.  Usually when I get excited about a beer it turns out to be horrible but this beer was great.  Nice and clear in color with a white frothy head.  The taste was clean and refreshing.  You gotta love Scandinavians, this would be a great beer to have with lefse, lutafisk and potato dumplings.
Light yellow color with almost no head. Watery and slightly hoppy. A ordinary pilsner taste not lager.

Nice smell! skunky like german pilsener, bit bitter hoppy flavor, watery aftertaste.
Not bad at all fore me.
Its more a pilsener than a lager.
golden colour, some sprankling, nice average white head, malty aroma, some toughes of hops, clear taste, smouth, rather sweet finish with some bitter hints.
The only beautiful thing of this beer is the logo.  The aroma, the. flavour..at least is refreshing...Like the water

Bottled.
Clear yellow coloured with a white head.
Aroma of malts and corn.
Flavour of malts, corn and hops.
Bottled. Pours a pale golden color. Grainy aroma. Some malt and a little bit of a sourness as well. Slightly skunky flavor. Some grain as well. Average.
Impressive refreshing and tasteful aroma and flavor. Surely one of the best pilseners in Denmark right now.
Bottle. Frothy fair mostly deminishing head, OK aroma very malty, watery short finish and way too carbonated. Not a good pale lager.

Pours a nice light golden yellow.  Aromas of hops, grass, and maybe corn.  Taste is crisp with a nice mellow hop flavor.  I’ve had this beer in the states and when I was in Krygyzstan. Tastes a lot better when your are only allowed 2 beers a week.

Shows a brilliant gold color with bubbles sparkling and a nice white head that lived shortly. Typical lager aroma with obvious adjuncts and metallic hints, some citrus and corn, grains and straw. Light body and soft bitter flavor. Hell, at least it has some flavor. Short but not abrupt finish. Inoffensive and refreshing well-defined lager. Pretty drinkable and not pure watery swill.



500 ml can, Turkish version bought on Easter Island Similar to the original danish Carlsberg but only more watery and with a metallic taste. Bad! Score: 1.9.
Draught. Small wite head. Golden body. Lot of carbon dioxide, medium bitterness.
Not a bad beer. Easy to drink and I would buy it again. Fairly watery and overcarbonated, but not to the degree of many mass marketed brews.
Bottled. Cold, wet, cheap, strangely satisfying. Slightly synthetic sweetness, some itchy hop. Works well with England winning at football/cricket/rugby.

This made me think of what a Heiniken could be, instead of skunky grass.  Makes me think that I might actually like heiniken after tasting Carlsberg Beer.  I will be adding this to the rotation of easy to drink beers kept on hand.
Weak, really bad brew. Skunk nose, and light in color, body, taste, all.

Medium white head. Yellow body with carbonation. Grassy musty rubbery aroma . Dry-sweetish salty grassy papery taste with mineraly floral notes. Mid-bodied. Dusty mouthfeel. Dry minty metallic aftertaste with floral papery notes. It’s OK, but bland, and generally mixes good elements with bad. (0.33l bottle, Systembolaget, Charlottenberg.)
Dry is the correct term.  would skip next time due to price, but not bad considering skunky odor.
White medium lasting head. Light golden, clear lace. Hoppy aroma. Some sweet malts. Light bitterness with a dryish finish.
sharper after taste than most but does not linger. the  hop aroma that cuts the nose. thin body which is over carbonated. would not pay the premium the brand is asking, the danes can have this one..
I had no idea this is real carlsberg i thought t’other one was, It sure is nicer than the 4% one. That’s just for lager louts i guess. All else is pretty much what highlandlad said.
Bottle. Quite grainy nose with some malt. Clean but overly thin and boring.

Ah Carlsberg... so much history and tradition to end up being best known for this. Pale gold, 0.5cm head, moderate length. Skunky green-bottle aroma, not dissimilar to the Harboe Bear Beer from the same country that I sampled last night. Very sugary sweet on the nose, with some corn. Plenty of sweet malt upfront and only the mildest of hop bite in the finish. More of a gumming than a bite. Fair carbonation and soft mouthfeel. Sweet, clean and bland. (330ml bottle, bb 17/1//05)
Low in flavour, low in aroma. A faint aftertaste of hops quenches the thirst. After mowing the lawn, perhaps. I tried the draft version.
I Tried this at a friend’s wedding.  Would definitely be one of the last beers that I would choose.  Not very tasty.
On draught at the Rugby Club. Looked a nice enough pint, tasted mainly of carbonated water. Not bitter enough. Team won.

Used to be my standard pint at university before I started drinking "proper" beer. Infinitely better than standard 4.0% English Carlsberg. Still it’s yet another example of mass marketing making something out of not very little. Golden yellow, over carbonated lager.
On tap at the Queenshead in Toronto. Skunky aroma. Golden colour with a smal white head. Not a lot of flavour, fairly bland. I had expected more from this one.

I have never had this beer before. Sampled from an 11.2 oz green bottle this beer pours a clear medium golden color with a medium sized soapy white head. The aroma is skunky and tangy. The flavor is dominant with pale malts and a hint of spiciness. There is no skunk on the flavor. The beer is mildly sweet and has a sour tangy finish. Not great, but decent for a pale lager.

(bottle) Nice Pilsener appearance but the rest is less than decent. Herbal hops and grainy malts aroma. Slight sweet flavour, thin body, unpleasant carbonation. Watery malty taste with a thin slightly bitter finish.
I was brought up on this stuff... Not a favorite, but its still ok on a very hot day after mowing the lawn, or late in the nigth when you cant taste anything...
Bottle. Wet dog and skunk aroma. Pretty much clear but a few floaters. Little head. Funky detergent like flavor with a sweet grainy finish. Is OK on draught but still mediocre.

A strange subtaste.  After my last tast I remembered our travel to denmark in the 80’s.  The beer was bad. But the country beatifull. I think at that time the carlsberg was worst than now or I do ........
Not a bad lager, a little diff. than most I’ve had.  A very well balanced pale.  Easy. On tap @ the Saucer.

"Probably the best beer in the world" Just as the company moto goes, I’m beginning to believe the same. I enjoyed this beer for the first time while in Asia and was surprised to learn how big their market share was in these countries. This beer has a nice malty taste and no bitter aftertaste I find in most beers have from this region. Quickly becoming my favorite beer.

It definitely ain’t as bad as some say. Pretty nice hop smell, golden colour, medium head. Pretty nice bitterness, no signs of alcohol, maybe slightly too harsh overall. I was pleasantly suprised with ths one, brewed by Okocim, Poland - the last time I bought Carlsberg brewed in Poland it was utterly horrible. Now I can see vast improvement. This is pretty good for a mass production lager.

First beer of the RBESG Denmark trip, on the boat from Harwich to Esbjerg. There may be a craft beer revolution going on in Denmark, but the Carslberg monopoly is still going strong on the boat. In fact, apart from Guinness, this was the only beer available, full stop. The one good thing about the bar was that the crossing was a little choppy and more people were puking up than drinking, so it was easy to get served. As for the beer - very dull, but inoffensive. Much the same as most macro European lagers. So anodyne I can’t find anything more to say about it.
33 cl. bottle. Rather boring danish pilsner. Golden colour, a small but fast disapearing head. hops flavor and watery body.

300ml bottle. Gold colour thin white head, slight grain aroma ome acid some hop, dull boring finish. Never had a beer in a 300ml bottle before though, which was the most exciting thing about this beer

Nearly transparent tawny yellow with a large but quick-to-fall head.  Hops in the aroma and the palate proves quite hoppy as well. There’s an almost spicy sensation on the tongue partly due to the heavy carbonation but also because this has a good Euro-lager bitterness.  I was happily surprised by this one.
A golden color with a small whtie head.  Little to no aroma.  Heavely carbonated with not much taste.
bottled, a typical lager.  smooth, great taste and less filling.  nothing to talk about.

This beer has nice color, but a small head.  The beer has a strange smell that takes away from the nice hop taste.  It may be a tad too skunky for me.  But it is better when it is served extremely cold.  Many people like it very much.

Probably the best beer in the world...or, probably not. Golden colour, thin head. Malty aroma. Metallic, artificial hop (eh?) flavour with a little grassyness. Highly carbonated. Sour-ish palate. Taste disappears almost immediately. Wherever there´s Carlsberg, there´s friends....Then i prefer to be alone.
Pretty decent lager with a strong hoppy taste and aroma with some malts in the aftertaste. (Bottle 25cl 5.5% alcohol in my version)
not a bad lager.  tastes better out of the bottle than on draught.  in the same flavor boat as heini’s and becks.

On tap. I was served a sample cup that was already served and waiting for someone to drink, so from the start i wasn’t to happy about drinking this. No head, gold color, and looked like a cheap ass lager. Nose was very faint and no signs of the usual stamp of aroma was detected. Flavor was typical of the style but with that European twist of extra additives added. I have to rate this extra low because of the way this company served it to me. Thumbs down.
(bottle)  Poured a golden yellow without too much carbonation and a small head.  Nice, clean malt flavor; smooth and well balanced.
Golden in color with small white head.Aroma of mild oranges. Bitter flavor with a dry finish.
I was really hoping to enjoy this beer more.  a bit skunky for such a light, unclomplicated beer.

2008-07-22. There is much debate over subjectivity and variability when reviewing beers but there are two definite points: Freshness and Context play important roles in the beer experience. Based on the quantities consumed I have to imagine that BMO Field has some of the best turnover, and thus freshest Carlsberg in Toronto. I sampled both a draft and can version at my first TFC game and found myself enjoying it much more than expected. The blazing sun definitely added to the experience as I quaffed the nicely chilled golden brew, with just a small white head. The aroma of the beer managed to deliver some modest malt and muted grassy hops in the first half, but man-sweat and spilled beer presented to big an obstacle in the second half. The flavour was much the same, above average levels of grainy pale malts and modest hop bitterness in macrobrew terms, but a mild overall experience - the bitterness was not near as assertive as that of the regrettable TFC loss to the Montreal Impact. (What the hell kind of team name is that anyways???) Average palate was just on the upside of full (again, by megabrew standards). I have had much worse, but also far better. 6/3/5/3/12 - 2.8  Plastic cup, Toronto FC, BMO Field

 Draft. Golden yellow, big fluffy white head. Sweet grainy aroma. Very mild bitterness, fairly sweet flavour. Touch of harsh something in the finish, perhaps a mild astringency? Average macro palate. Probably not the best beer in the world.  5-6/3+/4-5/2-3/10 - 2.5 TFOB 2005
grainy skunk aroma.  gold color.  yep! its green bottled import lager.  every one of these green bottled lagers are exactly the same.
pours pale golden with a small white head that quickly fades, aromas malt, hops, a tiny bit skunky, the taste is carbonated, corn-like, finishes bitter, nothing great.

I lke beer. Point taken, i dont know if i am rating correctly. I dont have much acess to expensive beers, so I like what i Drink.
For me, its in the same level as Heineken

Pours a light yellow, with a mostly diminishing white head.  Aroma of grassy hops with some bready malt.  Mouthfeel is highly carbonated and a bit chewy.   Finish is moderately bitter, slightly sweet.  Really not that bad, better than its American macro counterparts.
In one word, water.  In two words, piss water.  Tastes horrible, don’t believe the bottle when it says that it’s "Probably the best beer in the world."

a light yellow color w/ a small well laed white head.  Smells of wheat and corn and sweet sugars, palate is thin a touch sour and well coated.  Flavor is a touch tart, wheaty, light corn and light malt.. fairly blah.c

A pale yellow lager with a fast dissolving head. Hoppy aroma. On tasting it is disapointing, a bit over carbonated with a slight malty, corny flavour. Overall nothing special, but nothing I particulaly hate about it either. ’Probably the best beer in the world’, I think not.

Tepid aromas of corn and some hops.  A club-soda metallic taste.  Not at all assertive on the palate.  This beer is bland in every way.  Not much to specifically dislike, but nothing to make it worthy of another order, either.

Well, considering the system booted me out of my previous rating, this will be a rather shortened version of the previous version.  Sitting at a south side bar in Chicago I realized I never had this beer and decided to try it out -- albeit after having a hoppy beer or two.  This was rather unassuming and flavorless.  However, I did notice some malt, bread, wheat, cookie accents up front that redeemed this beer.  While not receiving high marks or even worth seeking out, I toyed with the idea of having myself another and could see drinking these in a hangover causing outing sometime in the near future.
Poured a golden color with a smallish head.. Aroma was very skunky with a bit of hops.  Flavor was not bad.. a bit of corn in the flavor with a mild hop presence.. Not bad..
An average lager. Tastes different in some countries. Will have one over Amstel or Heineken but not If I can have a decent beer.

Probably shouldn’t admit on this web site but not sure i could tell the difference between Harp and Carlsberg if blindfolded. Like them both though, better than the US big three by a mile. Flavour stays good all evening unlike most US lagers. Nothing special but consistant.

Bottle (Danish 4.6% version). One of the best selling beers in the world, and it is -unfortunately - no wonder. If you want to measure your beersales in 8 digit numbers, you can’t do it with a beer that anybody could actually dislike. Pours a light yellow with a thin quickly disappearing head. The aroma is fresh and hoppy but also very one-dimensional. On the palate it has very high carbonation so the bubbles are dancing on the tongue. Again the taste is very one-dimensional; slightly malty, a bit of hops and a low key bitterness. Quite thin. For millions this is the (probably best??) lager of choice. It is by far the best known Danish brand of any kind in the world. For me the most fitting description of this beer was one given by Michael Jackson at some point: There is nothing wrong with this beer, there is just not really anything particular about it. So drink it if you really can’t afford a proper czech or german pilsner - if you can, buy one of those instead.
Yellow gold with moderate head, malt and mild hops on the nose. Refreshing and enjoyable, and better than most mass-marketed North American lagers, but still pretty average.

This is the most sold beer in the small bar where I am doing some tending - and that is quite a shame. It is not a bad lager, but it is very, very average. I prefer the Green Tuborg if I had to choose between the two  - and that is often the case in Denmark. The aroma of the Carlsberg Lager is a little thin though the taste is somehow refreshing - but remember to keep the beer cool. Lager is not my favorite beer genre and this one does nothing to change that. It is however a nice beer to drink loads off, since it is not that strong or has that much personality.
typical pale lager.  easy drinking.  corn/cabbagey flavor.  nothing too exciting here.  drinkable though.
Just another lager, its cheap which is good thing, but it doesnt taste of anything. Maybe refreshing when cold which is always good.

"Possibly the best beer in the world." OK. That’s like saying McDonalds is possibly the best place to eat in the world. Anyway, typical pale lager. Lotsa head, very light bodied. Avoids the skunked taste thanks to a can. It’s better than a Budweiser but how much does that say?
Better than your typical garden-variety lagers, this one is crisp and refreshing.  A good session beer, if nothing else.
We had this in Paris.  It wasn’t all that great, esp. when compaired to the other beers we’ve had.  No real flavor.
Very average beer. For session drinking, Id rather have a miller or a fosters. Not even very cheap.
On tap in Paris.  Yellow with quickly dissipating head.  Smells like bud/coors/miller.  Not much taste at all.

Pours golden with little white head.  Another one that I had on tap recently and was much less skunky in the aroma than bottles I had previously.  Fairly malty flavor.  I agree with some others that it is almost malt-liquorish.  Not great, but not that bad either.
Smells and looks like a malt liquor. Thin foamy head. Flavor also reminds me of malt liqours. Really a pretty poor beer, but I didn’t expect much.

Light yellow color with a thin white head. relatively few carbonation bubbles. The aroma is grass and corn with some celery. The flavor is rich grainy corn and wheat bran. There is also a little bit of celery and black pepper spice. Decent for the style.
Clear bright yellow with a white head. Aroma of bready malt. Slight hop flavor. Finish is a little dry and bitter.
Decent, nothing particularly wrong with it, but not exciting in any way. Worth trying once, but I don’t see myself spending $6 on a six-pack of it when there are better, more interesting choices.

(Bottle 33 cl) Danish version: pale golden with an almost absent head. Subdued late bitterness. Not bad just very plain. 
4/2/5/2/8=2,1 310899



(Bottle 33 cl) Thai version: Nice hoppy nose and very hop-aromatic all the way through to the finish. Quite pleasant and seems more sophisticated than the standard Danish version - or I’m just influenced by the white thai beaches...
5/3/5/2/10=2,5 121103



(Bottle 33 cl) Portuguese version brewed by Unicer. Pilsener golden, small white head. Lovely floral nose. Lightly sweet malt and a very discreet bitterness. Pleasant alright - a beer that won’t offend anyone. Comes in a special Euro 2004 (European soccer championship) bottle with a football cast into the bottle. 
5/3/4/2/10=2,4 100705
pours pale gold colour with almost no head. nose is a bit hoppy and grassy. watery mouthfeel, hoppy finish. utterly boring :|

Mediocrity knows no bounds!  Poured a clear light gold, no head.  Grassy nose, a bit of a bite, certainly drinkable en masse. Came in a nifty Euro 2004 glass though...I thought the soccer ball was going to hit me!
english pint / yet another decent, boring lager. subtle, watery, but mostly a bit generic, grassy, meh.

Pure yellow color with a diminished white head and spider like lace. Mild grass and light malt nose. Sweet malt mingles with resin and flowers. Really quite plane and darn right boring. Too sticky for a quencher, to thin for a malty lager after a hard day. I really don’t have a place for this one.

Tasted whilst on my honeymoon in Bali, and brewed in Djakarta Indonesia, this turned out to be what I expected. Just another Int’l Style Lager. Inoffensive and boring as hell. Pours a brilliant pale gold with a short fluff of white foam, that disappears quickly, giving it a soda look. Very mild grassy hop and slightly dank liquor aroma. Mildly bitter in the mouth, grassy hops play there part as does some husky grains, little sweetness in front and finished up with a short forgettable swallow. Light bodied, medium carbonated and light on in flavours.  Will have to taste the original, as this one was only good for quantity and not quality.

Canned.  A pale straw coloured lager.  The aroma is a bit corny and maybe a bit of sweaty onions.  The taste is grassy and glassy.  There is a sweet, sickly alcohol bite, and only a little malt character.
Average at best. I would drink it, but I just won’t go out of my way to buy some. Just an average lager.

This poured a clear golden with a giant and frothy white head.....tons of lace. Aroma is terrible and maybe we can blame the green bottle........slight skunk some malt. Flavor is similar, a bit metallic and chemical with a slightly hoppy and dry finish. Maybe it lost quite a bit on the way from Denmark to Arizona but damn. This is terrible beer. I’m gonna puke.

Suprisingly, this fizzy beer I like.  Carlsberg has something special about it, and I can’t quite put my finger on it.  Drinkable, with subtle tastes of spice (maybe something like nutmeg and corriander), licorice, and a little sulfur.  Very enjoyable.
From A Can.Yellow in colour,no head,aroma is chemical,taste is of water,gas and some bitterness.
a decent beer from denmark nothing to special tastes like a heineken, but nothing 2 fancy. an alright beer to drink

Can.  As Carlsberg Export (UK).  Golden with a small white head.  Aromas are sweet grain, chemicals and soda water.  Flavours are grain with that odd soda water flavour.  Very thin with far too much carbonation.  Bitter with pepper on the finish.  We should send it from Northampton to Denmark and see if they like it.  I doubt it.

Rated from draught version brewed by Moosehead for Canada. Pale gold colour with a small white head. Aroma is mild, sweet and slightly spicey. Crisp mouthfeel, not too bubbly, quite refreshing. Flavour is fresh and mellow, with sweet notes, and a mildly hopped finish. For a mainstream lager, this is pretty damn good - certainly better than when Labatt was brewing it for Canada.

GREEN bottle poured yellow with light head and lacing.
Aroma and flavor is very spicy with a bitter tang on the palate.
Not bad ..but odd.
Carlsberg Export (albeit UK brewed). Cheap, swilly lager that isn’t at all awful and is quite drinkable though bland.
Nothing special.  For the money, I’d just as soon drink Bud.  The head is gone in a flash.  Rather bitter tasting.  No finish.  Sharp carbonation.  A standard European macro.
I’m sorry, I am not a good judge of aroma, appearance but I do know what tastes good. To me, this is one of the best tasting beers available.

A flat and boring lager. The aroma is vaguely fruity with absolutely no freshness. Very little head. The flavour is anonymous and the palate leaves you craving for water. Not a favourite of mine, however, enjoyed by many workers for more than a century in Denmark.
Was regular of mine, still like it,  a good solid lager. Easliy availible and easliy drinkable.
Bottled. Golden colour, big white bubbly head. Fruity aroma with hints of hoppy bitterness. Sweet fruity taste with a bit bitterness in the finish. Carbonation tickles your tongue a bit too much.

On tap @ Kildare House. Medium gold hue. Thin swirly white cap of bubbles on surface. grain and malt aroma. Light hops, grain, some sweetness in flavour. Bit of a sour bite to the finish. Some finishing hops.
Crystal clear  light golden in color, medium white head. Light cereal and lawn clipping scents. Sweet corny taste, but slight hops give a decent bitter follow. Still just a bland summer beer.
Pours gold, tastes pretty good for a pale lager.  The nose is weaker then the flavor.   Nice everyday beer for anyone to have.

Thin weak head. Amber / gold colour a little deeper than expected but the nose is bang on - classic pale larger. Palate is ok, sweet notes combining in an acceptable manner with the fizz driven finish.  In the pack for the style but nothing more (Tesco Lotus 34 baht)

Pours pale yellow with a small white head andmedium-sized slow rising bubbles.  Aroma is sweet/sour malt with a yeast and hop nose.  Flavor is hoppy and dry with a metallic lasting aftertaste.  Light and dry palate.
reminds me of Heinkene’s lost brother, even selection of Hops and Malt, crisp and clean

Mildly shunked, mildly spicy hop nose.  Clear blonde body is topped by a finger of lasting white head.  Floral and spicy hop flavour with mild, sweet, grainy maltiness.  Crisp carbonation, decent carbonation and refreshing medium-light body.  Bottle (Rahman - Feb. 2005).
Tap.  Rather unpleasant, even my macro-lager standards.  Bland malts, funky metallic taste, minimal hops, just some random bitterness.  I couldn’t finish.

Smells a little earthy/grassy and a little like cheese (yeast?). It pours a pale golden color and has a medium sized head. Flavor is light and tastes just like it smells. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Nothing special nothing nasty.

Touch the tip of your tounge to a 9-volt battery then taste Carlsberg, you’ll probably bin the ber and keep the battery. 

Metallic Vomit 9-Volt tasting crap. Arrgh!

Another great European Lager.

"Metallic Vomit Soap" describes it best.

Yellow/pale gold in colour, head is good & firm leaving attractive lacework as it slowly dies down. Unfortunately, it’s downhill from here...a very unpleasant aroma doesn’t really make me want to taste it!..but here goes. This tastes like a watered down version of Special Brew, the sugary(not malty)flavour is there too, not good, but better than most of bog-standard lagers eg Tennents, Miller, etc.

Poured a yellow straw hue, white head and some lacing. The aroma was sweet and skunky with some grassy hop notes. The tastes was slightly malty and a little fruity with a lite alcohol bite at the finish. Mouthfeel was light and carbonated. It’s kinda boaring but not terrible. An average import.
Bottle. Pale golden colour with slim white head. Corn aroma. A bit sweet, a bit stale but mostly bland.

Extremely boring and bland lager made from corn.
The only 2 positive things that can be said about this is that it comes in handy if you are thirsty and don’t have water handy and some of the commercials are pretty good.

Probably the best beer in the world ... Yeah right ... lol . Still got a lot of work to do guys.
For 2/3’s of the price i can get a local lager that is far better than Carlsberg!!!
Pale color, pours to a medium head. Smells, well, skunky; the taste is similar. Not as skunky as a St. Pauly Girl or a Becks, though. It’s better than a Heinekin, a Becks, and a Spaten, IMHO.
Nothing special but a good noncritical bar-beer to go with when the others are just a hangover in a bottle.

The worlds favorite beer? How can they say that with a strait face. Amasingly it is now one of the most popular beers in Ireland and the rest of the uk. I hear it  actualy out sold guinness last year in Ireland, but I havent confermed that as fact. Standard pislener, ultra pale lager yellow colour,  large bubbles, soda like head. Corn, pale malt on the nose. Flavour watery, bitter lager. Corn sweetness, water,  unwelcome skunky hoppeyness, but mostly watery. Flat mouthfeel. Atleast there’s no aftertaste. Dont bother with this one, save you’re money, get a blue, budwiser or some other garbage. For getting drunk, not for the beer lover.
This beer is awfully sweet and awfully weak.  I felt like I was drinking a carbonated fruit drink.

This beer has a light appearance.  I had it out of the bottle and it had a bitterness that was not pleasant.  The taste was also rather weak.  There are many other beers out there that are better then this.
Just too bitter for the lack of body.  Still an average beer with a slightly unpleasant after taste.
Bottle: Poured a crystal clear very pale gold with an unstable white head. Saazy aroma with pale malts and corn. Totally flavourless thought sweet. Refreshing but watery and uninteresting.
Weak flavour, light body, flat,  bland, waek bitterness, not for real beer drinkers, only for people who wants to get pissed, probebly one of the worst beers in the world.
Shining and intense color. Compact foam but escaping. Balanced bitter and even if is not sure one level beer.

bread and straw nose, minute head that lasts throughout. Clear calm body, very light activity, with a light yellow color. Initial flavors of bitter and acidic, like a mix of lemon and clover grass. Dry and lively going down, with a slightly astringent finish. I would expect much more from the company that tamed the wild yeast.

Pale yellow colour. Skunky, corny aroma. 
Tastes also quite skunky and has an adjunct character. Heineken is actually really good compared against this.
Bottled, pasteurised. Pale yellow with highly fizzed head. Vague hop and malt flavours inhabit a fizzed, boiled, spritzy monster. I wanted to like it, but just couldnt.

Pale gold can - Carlsberg Export. This is the one the Danes hate to see leave, yet is brewed in Northhampton alongside the British 4% lager. It is better than the 4% version, but that’s only because a 4% lager is a fairly nondescript beast to begin with. I found this drinkable in the same way that a lot of commercial lagers are drinkable. They wouldn’t sell much if they were vile tasting.

There’s not too much to this.  It has a nice look, a light golden color and a modest white head.  Barely an aroma, it being of slightly sweet malt.  Watery and slightly bittersweet.  No finish at all to speak of.

This  beer poured a clear yellow with next to no head.  Scents are pretty much standard to this boring beer, although this one I thought i could sense a little wine note..I doubt it. Taste isn’t too bad but boring and just like the rest of the major lagers. Flavour was watery and left nothing but a grassy flavour behind.
Good lager, it’s like the Heineken of Denmark, refreching thoug. I’m not really into lagers but this is quite ok.

Appearance: clear, pale golden color, firm and fluffy, pure white head.
Aroma: dry, and a bit corny, and a certain funky staleness that was quite off-putting and unlikeable.
Taste is bittersweet. This beer contains some hops, and some malt, too, but neither are employed very well, or do anything to impart flavor, character, or any quality that would urge one to drink and enjoy. No, it was a chore to plow thorugh this brew. Very weak, flat, flavorless, boring as they come. A sourness emerges towards the end, and only furthered my expanding repulsion towards this bad example of a lager. Are there corn or other adjuncts at use, I wonder, for it certainly tasted that way.

For this review, I have tried a bottle that has been brewed under license by Carlsberg in Sweden. (From the summer of 2004, the Danish original is sold in Sweden)

The colour is clear yellow. The white foam dissolves quite fast into a half-finger thick layer. 

The smell is fresh with lots of bitter hops. Uncomplicated.

The taste is straightforward: First, there is a clear taste of pilsenermalt that evolves into a fine, dry bitterness from the hops. The bitterness slowly dies away into a tender note of… puff pastry!

This is a beer that knows what to do and does it with precision. No-nonsense!

Carlsberg Beer is known in Sweden as “Hof”, the Danish word for “court” after the large text on the label that once informed the buyer that Carlsberg is a purveyor to the Danish court.

Had this one bottled in St. Charles, Illinois.  It’s a pilsner, so you know already it’s not going to be great.  I wasn’t terribly dissapointed, though.  Ricey nose with little, bubbly head.  Carbonation was a little distracting. Not much going on here.

I like this beer.  It is what I order when I just want to have a beer and relax, like the Bud to the average Joe.  It has a nice yellow color, is a bit on the carbonated side and has a strong bitter taste.  Normal, everyday lager.
Thin snow white head on a clear golden body. Metallic and grainy in the aroma with a slight tone of hops. Harsh pilsnener flavor, thin and not very interesting. This is a Carlberg for god sake!!!

Rerate: Fancy green (bleh) 0.33l bottle made in the Tuborg Fredericia brewery.... Poured a big fluffy white head that went away fast leaving scattered lacing on top of a clear golden/yellow body. Quite good for this kind of beer. Lively carbonation. The nose is just malt and olives. The taste is rather unimpressive, dryish, watery, with some lame hopiness on top, and maybe some malty hints under that, slightly bready, tiny acidic hints, and, umm.. alcohol ? Underwhelming. No, not a good pale lager. (-1 palate)

Old Review:
An average...premium...lager with an inoffensive taste. There’s nothing really bad about it, but it has very few good qualities (well, it’s refreshing).
Highly carbonated lager with a light flavor. The bitterness seems a little over the top and way out of balance.

Brown bottle - 341ml. Clear gold body topped with a decent but diminishing frothy head. Weak malty aroma with some subtle bready and flowery notes. Ordinary malty/hoppy taste with a discreet and moderately bitter final. This is really not bad... but it has nothing especially impressive. There are a lot of danish macrolagers that has more character.
Had from can in London.  I actually really liked this beer.  Slightly sweet, goes down strong, little to no aftertaste.  Probably my favourite for a steady beer if I was buying cans.
Overall tres average.  Bland and boring.  Get a feeling it could / should somehow be better.
What in fact are my carlsberg years?  Are they that time in my life when I have given up all hope and settled on skunky beer?  yes I think so.
When I poured the beer there was a very big head which dissapated. The aroma was pleasant and inviting.  The color was like straw. This is not a special beverage just an average beer.
Lovely fruity aroma. The flavor is wide, featuring nice malty undertones, a strong hoppy bitternes, and perhaps a hint of apple. Very aromatic. Not at all as weak and strengthless as Heineken.
pretty crisp and refreshing i suppose.  the flavor is a lot nicer and rounder than most lagers.  still not a passing grade.
Well tried it many times very light bodied,bit carbonated,nothing speacial nothing extra.Nice for drinking at the heat with very cold.
Better than an American macro, but still pretty bad.  I can figure out which I like less this or Heineken.
This is a well below average lager. Lots of odd chemical tastes going on, with little aroma to speak of. I’m glad I didn’t have to pay for this one!

Ok it had been years and years since i had tried this brew..lets see if its still as I remembered.
Im beginning to think I made a mistake buying this "sixer"..by the appearance alone, lets say its only a touch darker than Budweiser..slighly darker urine colour. smal white head.
the smell is not too good..slightly metallic..nothing much at all really.
taste is not good very sweet malts followed fast by a burning plastic style bitterness.
Damn why did I have to buy a "six"..this is not good beer not even an average lager.
Yellow mildly fizzy...gross smell, moldy sweaty bread...tastes much the same...
Flat wheaty taste with chemical backtastes.  Disgusting - how do people drink this crap?  (Draught in Carlsberg Brewery, Kobenhavn)
Para beber por la noche (el que tenga ganas) por pubs de tu ciudad. No es una maravilla pero tampoco lo precisa. Es la primera cerveza danesa que pruebo
Smells grassy and cheap, typical of boring, mass-produced imports. Yellow in color, light yellow that is, Decent head. tastes sweet and grassy. Yuckedy yuck yuck. Never again.

Medium gold color with an excellent head and lacing, and a mild yeasty straw aroma. Light bodied with a bready maltiness and soft finish. Reminded me some of a Helles, although a rather "light" version of one.
Bottle. Golden color, weak corny aroma and taste, light body, light finish. just another pilsener.
Umm... can’t say I like this one.  Brings back bad memories of uni pub in london -- when this was 1 pound on wednesday nights... still not a good deal.
Bottle. Pale golden colour. Thick white head which wears off too quick. Hoppy aroma. The taste is hoppy and light/medium bitter.
My first Carlsberg was a class II beer in Sweden. Basically 3.5%. A bit more malit flavor than other macros.

On tap at the Circle Bar and served by the Gimly himself. Watch out for his battle axe! Slightly darker than bud light and with medium body this is an easily swilled beverage on the same plane as corona or labats. There is some small hops and sourish malts with a bit of a sticky finish. The kind of beer that you refrain from drinking too much because it tastes like a hangover in a bottle.

The first full beer I ever had, on Laeso in Danmark no less.  There is something to be said about having a beer in its place of origin.  Remarkably better over there than in the US.  A nice and skunky macro-style lager.  Better than Budweiser with some noticable malt flavor.

Brewed in France at 5.5%abv.
 Light hops, skunky and dull. Some sweetness, but not that pleasant. Pale amber clear with light lacing head that dissipates quickly. Heavy watery body with medium carbonation. Starts with some corny/grain sweetness, little hops, and very mild. Finish is bit more acidic with some stale hops coming in, but still that corny sweetness. Weak and watery overall, best ’enjoyed’ cold.  Drinkability and temperature are inversely proportionate.

Aroma barely give a hint of hops.   Nice head.  Flavor crisp and clean but not much of a beer flavor.  Rather bland - pretty much the equivalent of an American macro.  As a friend of mine calls it "The beer of English football hooligans".

Clear full gold; good fluffy white head, leaving fine lace. Wet cardboard, some (wet) hay. Absolutely nothing else, I swear. Grainy taste. Finish is sweet and a touch of roasted malt - or adjunct? Dull/ unobtrusive. Dropping dead in secs. Watery mouthfeel, slightly sugary like sugar dissolved in water (new def. of beer?). Aftertaste is a sudden full three seconds of metallic harshness. I’m sure this must be an added hopcone. CAMRA used to poke fun remorselessly at their ad "Probably the best...". Even the most cynic eructation doesn’t give full credit to this... collected rainpuddles from a stubblefield.

Tap. Light golden yellow, minimal head. Aroma has a touch of hops, sweetness. This falls into the bland lager category, innoffensively offensive. Somewhat harsh sticky sweet aftertaste. Fairly low on the adjunct scale. Clean and drinkable.
Fizzy yellow and nothing special about this.  Watery taste with a not so smooth aftertaste.  Blah.
It’s easy to taste that this beer is made to offend no one tastewise. That makes it boring an bland
Thin, average but at least it’s drinkable. Better than Grøn Tuborg, but still nothing exciting.
That’s what happens when you run out of tickets (inside for myself). Thin head, watery and refreshing, but with not that much flavor.
Golden, big frothy white head. Malty but unclean aroma. Flavour is nothing to be exited about. Not much of anything. Some grass, smome malt... The whloe imression is a bit "gloomy".
Gold, lightly carbonated with a tight, white head which holds fairly well.  Hoppy aroma, and a nice dry, hoppy flavour.  Some hint of sweet maltiness in the flavour also.

Was about to put this one in the swill category until I took my first sip. Popped the bottle top and got a Pepe le Pew smell for starts. Not good. Looked good nice head. Taste changed my mind. Not Earthshattering but better than my initial impression.
Decent enough, but nothing spectacular. Mildly hoppy aroms with a similar mild hoppy taste. A slight sweetness in the taste as well. I prefer this over Canadian, Bud, Blue etc.

A mildly hopsy, thoroughly unimpressive lager.  Light on pour and not much richness to the taste.  Corny.  Skunky. Better on tap. Drinks like a midwestern American pilsner (eg. Pabst or Miller) instead of a proud Denmarkian lager.  Would prefer this over a Heinekin, though, anyday.  (But Grolsch wins out over both!)

[bottle] Pours a very pale yellow with a thin white head and lots of carbonation. Not much of an aroma, mainly hops. Very ale-like taste that reminded me a lot of Rolling Rock with a slightly bitter finish. No wonder it’s called the Budweiser of Europe.

Amazingly, I used to pound this stuff back...  so in the interest of nostalgia, I figured I’d try it again.  Absolutely nothing unique or memorable about it - like any other Canadian macro (I know it’s HQ is in Denmark, but it’s also brewed here).  Lingering metallic tang, too carbonated, hard to believe this is a beer that people get worked up over.  The hell with nostalgia, it tastes like crap.

Bottled(330ml). -just like other danish beer vain and watery, light hoppy,  very drinkable but borring beer 
Earlier Rating: 12/25/2002 Total Score: 2.6
Canned(500ml). -like Tuborg but little better, refreshing, could be drinked lot, average pilsener

Liverpool sucks and this beer doesn't make them look any better. Looks good in a glass but thats about it. Why would we drink this even if there is a budweiser put next to it. Nothing new when it comes to taste/flavor. Drank it on my way to Sweden, thank god they have belgian beer there.

33 cl, served in tall Menabrea glass.
Pale gold w/ OK head. Rather anonymous aroma that doesn't give too much away. Turns out that there isn't all that much to give away. Taste is rather subdued, a slight sweetness being the most defining characteristic. Very easy to drink.
A fairly decent lager that certainly won't frighten anybody.

Aroma? Skunky. Appearance? Yes. Flavour? Not so much. Palate? Negligible. Overall impression? Not much. Reminds me of another infamously bad Denmarkian beer: Tuborg. However, Carlsberg is probably slightly 'superior' - and I emphasise the quotations here, and stress that it is only 'superior' to relatively few beers. Hvis tur er det til at hente øl? [Whose turn is it to get beers?]

This one gives a new definition to "skunky beer."  Not that this is the worst beer that I've ever had, but for the love...the stuff smells like a skunk!  No kidding!  I don't care how good it is, this one must be defined as a skunky beer.  I should've known, given the product placement in "Bend it Like Beckham," of all movies.  Anyway, I should review it now.  Appearance like unto urine, taste lacking and somewhat watery, with an aftertaste of funk...yeah...not happy...need food...need a good beer...need a life...

I didn't think this beer was too bad.  The initial taste isn't great, but changes drastically as it is drunk.  I would certainly consider trying this stuff again even though I understand what people mean when they refer to the taste as "soapy".

Light yellow and fizzy.  Nasty skunked corn aroma.  Ewwww... Initial flavor is something like rice and corn and plastic... not as bad as the aroma, just light and weak and corny.  Rating this just to get Denmark under my belt.

(Bottled) Pale golden color, medium, foamy head with some lace. Slightly stuffed, fruity and quite hoppy aroma. Sweet-honeyish, quite crisply citric-hoppy, although a bit dish-washing liquid-like flavor. Bitter, light-bodied, quite carbonated palate. This average, crisply hopped pale lager could be a decent summer brew if it was cheaper (in Finland, that is).

Bottled
Nice golden yellow color and steady creamy color. Lots of CO2. Lame metallic and fruity aroma. Taste is close to water and finish soapy. Bad aftertaste.
standard pilsner struck the carlsberg trademark... No or a quite bad, not longlasting (in this case luckily) aftertaste
Good sweet refreshing malty flavor.  Clear light color with minimal white head.  Quite refeshing and enjoyable.

(On bottle, so many times. On tap; so may times)
In Denmark there was only two beers 15 years ago(well, almost only two) Carlsberg(Hof) and Tuborg(Grøn=green).
Hof is the bitter version of the typical danish pilsner and really good for refreshment, when not too cold. A snappy aroma and easy drinkable, hops-full taste. Nice pale-yellow color.

Enough malt for me to be happy with, in a lager, the hops seem to be sitting in the background which I disapprove of. I am a bit disturbed that the most common failing in lager/pils (no malt) is taken care of but there seems to be no distinctive snappy hops which even most crap lagers make a try at.

more malty but still euro-macro lager hop aroma.
muddled malt and hop flavours.
light but not too thin palate with light early bitterness.
macro swill.

I hate hotel glasses. After two rinses in hot hot water and a thorough drying it has no head and those horrible lemonade bubbles. Anyway, this is another Euro pils style that doesn't inspire at all. I do detect some of the noble hops there and a malty presence but it is all to fleeting. It is a cut above some of the Asian competitors but it really appears that this is brewed for mass consumption by the uneducated but thirsty. 
Earlier Rating: 8/6/2003 Total Score: 2.6
I agree with the comments about skunkiness in this beer. From the tap in Kyiv however this was not too bad. Slightly thin but not too bad. It is a reasonable pils.

Of the tap and surprisingly flat. Some beers had a head, so I bumped the appearance up seeing that.

Grainy taste, light in flavour and bodym a bit of hop bitterness on the finish.

Happily, we don't live in a Carlsberg world.

I'll say this is what I had, but I'm not too sure. It was on tap as Carlsberg Draught. Short foamy head. Slightly creamy mouth feel.Trace if coriander, spice, grass and sweetness. Maybe some malt. Soapy. It isn't a lager, not bad for a blond. Mild perfume and flower notes. Weak finish.
Standard mass produced light stuff, but must admit it is refreshing while watching a footie match from time to time.  Based on the Canadian bottled and tap version.
This is one of those beers which is brewed so that anyone can drink it. This is fine if you want to earn a lot of money, but not if you aim to make great tasting beer.

Light golden colour, head dissipates pretty quickly, moderate carbonation.  Sweet, malty flavour.  Not bad, a refreshing "Canadianized" version of this Danish beer.  (341ml bottle, 5%, brewed in Canada by Labatt under supervision of Carlsberg)
Bottle in Amsterdam. Yellow in color with decent head. Nice lager that starts off sweet and ends with a decent lager malty finish. Must be different from American Carlsberg.
this beer looked good in a bottle.  did not taste good.  a cheap mass-produced manufactured flavor.  not a good beer.

Draft: Light golden, clear, sticky lace. Light and slightly sweet malts were somewhat synthetic tasting. Off-flavors of metal (iron), plastic, and vegetables (cabbage/sauerkraut). Light bitterness (zingy) with a dryish finish. Blegh. Rerate (can bought in Switzerland): Very heady. Light, chalky malts. Mild sweetness with a bit of sourness. Faint bitterness. Boring and bland. Funny enough, I put "blah" in my notes, which is similar to my old rating that said, "blegh."
Yellow to light golden with a foamy white head and a surprising bit of lace.  The aroma is fruity and the body the same with a light bitterness towards the end.
I think of it as a Eurpoean Budweiser.  It's better than Bud, but it's pretty flat tasting and boring.
small amounts of hops and bitterness. quite clean easy drinking stuff, at the same time, nothing special to justify the high price, at least in Australia.
This was pretty awful...it looked just like Miller Lite off the tap, and had a strange tanginess to it.  Semi-flat as well.  I'm in no mood to praise dreck like this.
Yellow with a fizzy white head. All around, fairly clean and crisp but nothing special.

Bottled. (from my notes) Aroma had a tiny amount of hop notes and maybe a small amount of straw. Appearance clear yellow lighter than I expected. Flavour was mildly sweet in a sugary way with some hop notes as matched the aroma. Quite drinkable but am suprised to learn this is a Pilsener.
A lager in a green bottle. Exciting? Nope...................................

Not an impressive beer, but then one doesn't think of Denmark when one thinks of beer. A slightly better than average Euro lager taste and body, but gets cloyingly thick with adjunct flavors towards the end of the bottle.  Best when drank from the bottle and not from the glass--like most beers of this type.
Can: Lightly golden color, nice aroma with bitter tones. Average flavor but still overall OK.
Skunked of course. Clear gold pilsner, frothy white head. Smells skunked. Carbonation, skunk flavor. I would much rather have a High Life than have to drink this beer. Sweet and skunky. Blah.
Drank this puppy on the way to Oktoberfest in Canberra. Quite sweet, reminded me of Grolsch, but a little easier on the palate. Made the DAB they had on tap at Oktoberfest taste like p*ss.
Not crazy about this lager.  Sweet, malty, and bland flavor.  Finishes crisp, clean, and dry.
Crisp and refreshing.  Light flavor and Nice carbonation.  A very good beer to have when you are having more than one.  Excellent on tap.
Carlsberg is some tasty stuff, great icy cold with a light golden colour, its super easy to drink and with no harsh chemical taste that is the bane of so many european beers.

I think I'd actually rather drink Jarlsberg. You know, like the cheese -- in liquid form. Anyway. My dad bought this, apparently mistaking it for Heineken, and it smells and tastes as corny as that Jarlsberg joke. Maybe be I'm getting some kind of inauthentic North American version?
Normal coloring for a pilsener. Skunky aroma with some hops. Standard malt flavors. Yup, it's a fairly boring pils.
Average pils color with a decent carbonation level. Aroma is lightly skunky with a citrus hop presence. flavor is malty but this is just a little too mainstream with dms and a little diectyl.

My draft of Carlsberg tasted fresh (not skunky), was easy to drink and made a good start to a night of sampling brews at the Grey Lodge Pub.   This brew will always have a special place in my heart due to a positive go-go bar experience involving a few Carribean women and a case of these green bottles.
This beer is clean, fresh and clear.  It has its unique taste probably due to its yeast - Saccharomyces Carlsbergensis.  Try saying that once you have had a few. cheers

Bottle.  Pours golden yellow, with a large creamy white head, this was the best part of the beer.  Aroma is mild, with a slight hoppy nose.  Flavor is initially sweet with an odd metallic hoppiness and a little bit of soap.  Palate is light with a nice carbonation.
quite a nice beer with a favourable sharper crisp bitterness to it. packs a very small head but overall a nice clean beer. overpriced however.
Rating based on draught version: Average taste with a little extra character, small head, and decent aroma.
Not as big aroma as the last pilsener that I tried but I prefer the bitterness in this as it a bit more pronounced.
Surprisingly, mine was not skunky. Still has a cheap aroma. Grassy/haylike taste to it, and slightly more bitter than most of its style. Easy to drink, but rather unimpressive.

The one I had was brewed in Canada, suppose just so they could write "Imported" on the label. Hoo Hee, am I supposed to be impressed? Very Pale yellow appearance with a nice foamy head out of the bottle. Not as nasty as a Heiny, and probably on par with a Beck's. This one would probably go fine with a pizza.

Keg, Carlsberg Hof
Blond color. Really poor, watery beer; it almost stinks. Forgettable.

This brew poured a medium head of creamy finely sized mostly lasting white bubbles that left a fair lacing and a transparent straw yellow colored softly carbonated body behind.  It has a mild malthop arioma that is just a tad skunky.  It has mild lager flavor that is weak and thin while being somewhat rice like.  Its mouthfeel is a tingly one.
Come in brown bottle at 5% here in Canada. Brewed by Labatt. An average pilsener which lack in personality. Nothing great about this beer and nothing too bad.

The head was white, small, soapy in texture with fine-small bubbles.The body was carbonated and clear.The hue was gold and the nose was fruity.The lacing was only fair with this beer.The flavor was bitter with an aftertaste.The mouthfeel was smooth, tingly on my tongue and thin.This beer lacks character as there is not much that I can say about it.

A lot of bubbles and carbonation, though drinkable without getting blisters in your throut.
Thirstquenching ISL.

I just caught this one in my area for the first time in years.  I've not seen a Carlsberg since I came of legal drinking age a few years ago.  Not much color.  Not much flavor.  Not much anything.  Mild carbonation.  Cheap malt taste with no balance.  Surprisingly strange bittnerness on finish, but not a good hop-finish like good pilsners have (Urquel).  Still, it's kinda refreshing when it comes down to it.  This would be a good cheap beer if it was cheap, but I'd rather stick to Rolling Rock than this over-rated import.

It's not nearly as good as most other Pilseners from that section of the world.  It's just lacking anything about it that's likable, there's no big problem with it, and it's definitely drinkable, but just nothing about it worth drinking.

Admirably brash skunkiness. Somewhat darker--oranger--body than most international lagers. Average circling and smattering of unenthusiastic head. Aroma is, again, skunk, and some pretty harsh/acidic barley. I smell a little bit of corn. Flavor is sweet, cigarette-smoky, and pellucid. No "complexities" here; just sweetness, cooked vegetables, and a noticeable lack of hop accent. Very simple, but not offensive. Not exactly intriguing.

Blonde lager with a cereal grains nose behind which you can feel the hops is hiding. That hops doesnt uncover in mouth where sweet malt is the dominant taste accompanied by an honest bitterness. Many other commercial beers overwieghed it though, not so well-rounded and finished, the balance isn't as good as in a just as commercial Grolsch for instance.

The beer of the Danish court? Not quite. It can be very watery, and doesn't carry any aroma. It goes down just fine though. Great beer to make you look classier and more European than you really are without having to know real European beers.
An ordinary pilsener, but a little to bitter to be really refreshing. Not one of my favourites.

Color is a light golden yellow with a small white head that faded after a minute or so leaving some touches of patchy lace.
Smells of bright, sharp hops, very clean and has some malt and sweet spice but is all very faint. Taste is more of the same with a weel balanced sweetish malt and spiced hop thats clean and refreshing, and lends itself into smoothing, but is a little on the uneven bittery side in the hop bite. Feel is light and wet with no real rounded or bold, standout qualities. Givin all that its a very good, easy drinker thats clean and goes down down smooth.
Yellow with a nice firm head. Well balanced malt and hops aroma, but a little too watery. When blindtasted it’s still my favourite standard Danish lager.
typical european brew.somewhat refreshing taste but nothing fantastic .just an average brew.not something i would go out of my way to buy again.
Not a bad lager but hard to understand the mass appeal. Sweet all-malt, light in body with a dry almost sour finish.
White weak head. Golden color. Aroma is slightly bitter with herbal and hoppy notes. Flavor is moderately malty, slightly dry, ending in a short not too bitter finish. Light bodied.
Bland euro lager, nothing good about it, but one could do much worse. Cost more because its an import, so your better of buying strohs, haha

Rating #600... Crystal clear yellow brew. Creamy, small white head with decent lacework.
Smells like an A.B. product. A touch floral, but mostly bland.
Tastes like a mid-tier american standard. Thin and mostly flavorless (probably a blessing).
Light-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and lively carbonation.
Mercifully short, crisp, adjunct-laden finish.
If you MUST drink this beer, make sure it’s served ICE COLD in a FROZEN MUG somewhere in the ARCTIC CIRCLE... where you have no other choices. Otherwise, there’s really no excuse for even trying this beer.
Faint aroma of bitterness.  Thin head, light yellow colour.  Slightly sweet on first taste with a slightly bitter finish.  Somewhat watery.

What can I say, I simply love this beer. Definitely not a craft beer, but of all the mass market beers it's eailsy the best tasting and most enjoyable. Smooth, easy on the palate and with a nice refreshing taste. A solid quality Danish beer.

This is the drink of the Danes--a standard pilsner.  If not this, then its brother Tuborg takes its place.  Maybe a little better than your american standard, but not that much better.  If you drink enough of them, you might start swinging a an ax, pillaging your neighbors, and stealing their women.
a very average import.  not much to distinguish it from any other lager.  somewhat bland taste, and even blander aftertaste.
This  beer is lacking character heavily. I was expecting alot more from this famous brew, very typical, no body and it just tastes cheap.
Has a golden color with some carbonation and a lightly malted smell.  Taste is malted and has a hop finish.  Overall not a bad pilsener, but nothing special.
one of the worst lager I´ve tasted.. watery and the aftertaste is bad, I call this one the european moosehead.. bad lager
This beer has a yellow body - hue with a normal pilsener flavor and a light body.
Nice average kick-back lager to have any time of the year.  Goes well with most weekend junk food binges.  Also very refreshing.
Not a lot to say about this Pilsener.  It's pretty fair, standard brew.  Not the best, not the worst.

Mostly just thin and nasty.  Not much malt flaovr, not much character, not much alcohol.  Maybe a little floral hoppy taste and a little bitterness in the finish.  Free in the hotel fridge, but no reason to take more than one.  Pretty awful, actually.
Golden colour, thin head that lasts few seconds. Light malty aroma. The flavour is  sweet, just a little bit malty. Watery, very watery...

Used to be my favorite lager until I diversified my tastes. For lagers, this one is still ok. Mildly hoppy, crisp, refreshing and very easy to drink. Malty flavors. A bit of skunky sweetness on the nose but very mild. Can't get this in Southern California anymore, bummer.

I found Carlsberg a close runner up to Heineken when trying to impress women with my "worldly mannerisms" as an 18 year old novice.  These days I still enjoy the beer, but there are many others I'd prefer

Another blonde Dutch.  I could smell the skunkiness during the pour, and it did not get any better.  The beer is light in the mouth yet, I didnt want to keep it there due to the bitter and skunky taste.  I would only drink this again if my friend bought it for me at a social gathering.
Pale golden Danish substitute for water. A little cereal aroma. Does not taste much. Competent maybe to quench your thirst a sunny day, but this only in Copenhagen. Maybe.
The Danes are great for super models and inventing the fizz in beer. This one is the bog standard lager. The Export lager has a more bitter, and higher strength. Go the Export if it's on tap.
Yellow with a medium sized white head.  Lots of carbonation.  Full bodied and a little sour.
not bad for fizzy yellow beer.  However, it had a light crisp taste and none of the crappy light american beer aftertaste.
A real help if you are thirsty and are looking for water. Not any maltiness at all and the hops, well are there any ?
A VERY mainstream brew, if you are into Becks, Hieniken etc this fits right in.
Very very average. To call itself "pilsner" one must have some hops in, but here - no case.
I don't know what it is about german imports, they generally taste the same.
Basically, the one good thing about this is that I got to add another country to my list (I think). I think mediocrity should be the goal here.
It is not my kind of beer, but I drink it, why I don't know, perhaps because of the name: Carlsberg.

Hey you get off my lawn. These where the first and last words Ive ever spoken after drinking a Carlsberg lager. Carlsberg you skunky bastard. You make me want to mow the lawn over and over again. Upon doing so I shall pull up a beach chair and bask in the warmth which is my victory. A victory that will last a life time, or maybe for one night. Fuck it. However either way its still a victory.

With all due respect to my last entry...Vacation to England... Purchased only one Carlsberg 1847 original lager along with five pints of Guinness stout the last night I was in London. I bought these beers at the 24 hour market after I placed an order for some pizza at the local arcade mart. The two pizzas where five pounds each. So you figure five lbs is about ten US dollars. That’s about twenty dollars American, I wouldn’t have been so depressed if it had at least filled me up! Twenty dollars worth of pizza and I was still hungry? Wow. At least the Carlsberg and Guinness did there part. Cheers!
Quite a good lager. Not as good as the non-export though. Light on the alcohol which allows you to savor and make it last. Recommended.

Pale golden color topped with a medium thick white head and good lace.  Strong skunky aroma.  I could smell the skunk from across the room.  Slightly sweet yet skunky flavor with a clean finish.  Smooth and light bodied.
