Ho hum beer that I used to think was much better.  Comes off as stale and not too biting, would be much better if well it were a totally different beer.  Weak color, stale taste at times.
This is the beer I used to drink when I would frequent the Palamino Club back in Atlanta.  A Heineken like aroma but the taste it amazingly unique, but still a very typical lager.
Another one of my faves.  Other folks don't seem too thrilled with it, but I always enjoyed the semi-heavy flavor and sweetness associated with this one.
Usually I try to be more descriptive but this is just plain nasty, two sips and I drained it.
A little lighter than I expected but I really like the beer.  Maybe this is the light beer I''ve been looking for that is not brewed at a megabrewery.
Probably the best beer in the world - nah, don´t think so!!!...........
Bottle  Clear, yellow body.  Creamy, white head.  Quite ok looks.  Some hops in the aroma, but not attractive: quite soapy.  Quite sweet flavour with some bitterness.
Not the absolute worst pilsner, but its also not from the USA!..............
An average lager.  Calling it a pilsener doesn''t help expectations.  Got a free glass though!
I must be in my Carlsbery years, I didn''t find it all that bad though it still was below average. Better than most of the American Standard found around here...
The aroma almost killed me. i thought I was dinking a Heineken.A decent beer but probably would tste better in Europe.

This is really great beer-sweet ,smooth flavor-looks great,tastes great.You do have to watch out for the skunky ones though.The first time I tried this one it was really skunky so I took it back and got a six from an unopened case and it is fantastic.
Sweet, lightly malted, heavily carbonated. .................................
High quality beer. But it is not the best beer in the world. Normal, even good lager.

Not as bad as I expected; my companion at the bar was vastly more interesting than this beer, but when it became clear that nothing would happen, I switched to another beer that I actually wanted to taste.  Very sweet.

A very good quality beer.  Love the bottle.  And the inside of the packaging isn''t too bad either!  Goes down very smoothly, a lot smoother than I expected.  Has a nice aftertaste.  Made me change my mind about European beers....
Not a bad or good beer. By a discount beer insteat. It''s cheaper, and as good as a Hof.

Bottle 341ml 
 
Appearance:    Pale gold with short lived white fizz.2- 
Nose : Aroma of wet slightly spoiled grain with slight hint of green leaf.
Flavor/Palate : Medium light bodied , off grainy with better sweet malt ending. Canadian edition reminded me a lot off poor local micros a la Lucky Lager. In short lacking freshness/ crispness.

Bottle and tap. The only lager to pay for. Good for sucking on. Rather weak, but probably 
the superior 
lager from the Nordic countries. Refreshing, grave. Once you get past the wide, yet
mostly boring palate there is the aftertaste, which I am addicted to. Something about its 
thickness suprises me and grows thicker each time. Danish lager is, afterall, the best
lager in Scandinavia. Often compared to Heineken, but Heineken is weak, thin and bumpy 
kerosene compared to this. Take a swig and enjoy the hops. Textured, yet in the end boring.
Take it for what it is. If you don''t want a boring beer, don''t drink lager.
Gold with fast fading head.Light malt profile throughout....................

Re-rate: New Canadian version contract brewed by Moosehead. Can. Pale golden colour with a thick frothy and rocky white head. Floral and lightly grainy aroma. Floral and spicy bitter flavours are present, but accompanied by a grainy character that detracts from everything else. As it warmed the graininess actually settled a bit. Light bodied, fizzy, but refreshing.
Can''t really say anything good about this beer, flavourless and bland......
unremarkable. They roped me into buying it by offering me a free glass. I would drink this over a Canadian macro, but not by much.
Yellow Hieneken, not worth the money........................................

Not that bad.  I drank a lot of this on a vacation in Toronto, when i was hanging out with non beer snobs.  It got me through the week, when I couldn''t hit the beer store and get something i wanted.  Rated a 7 for fun times.
It''s not a bad beer and yes it is a great dinner beer with a Big Mac.......
yellow with white head.  faint malty aroma.  nothing special about this.  boring.
An ok beer.  I would take it over Tuborg, but still not a favorite..........
smells bad. Hoppy pilsener, bitter. Nothing special.........................
Yellow color, brackish head. Smells like rotten hops. Dry taste, hopbitterness. Same palate.
This is quite a nasty lager.  I can''t tell if it''s the adjuncts or what, but there is a nasty taste and aroma emanating from this beer that needs to be avoided.  Very unpleasant.
Nothing spectacular. although it was very clean and refreshing it did not impress me.
Average beer. Golden coloured with quickly diminishing head. Similar to Tuborg Pilsener, but a little more bitter sweet flavour. On tap it's a little more crisp and refreshing.

[Re-rated as a head-to-head comparison between the Danish version 4.6% ABV - which must be the original and the Brittish version called Carlsberg Export at 5.0% ABV - according to Oakes the same beer] The color is the same - though maybe the English version is slightly darker yellow. The head is clearly more dense in the English version and therefore longer lasting. The aroma of the Danish version is slightly sour and grainy - where the English version is more clean grainy. The flavor is standard pilsener in both of them, though the English version again comes out cleaner and with more power. I definatly go with the English version if this was the only two beers I could choose from - but they are close, so Oakes could be right. I just don't always get the some beers exist in different versions and others don't. [Original rating] A standard pilsener as all the big brewing groups brew them. Nothing that will upset anybody - and therefore nothing that will thrill you.
boring. has long lasting head. a bit weak. bitter and sweet.................

Light aroma with both sweet malt and light hops...Pale gold color with medium-light head...Flavor had sweet bottom, mild but well-bittered hops...balance is decent but body is a tad thin...Very drinkable but unremarkable beer...
Watery, no taste. Nothing interesting, try Elephant beer instead............
Hmm.. pretty disappointing.  Thin, skunky tasting.  After a few of them, the taste disappeared and it was just boring.
brewed in Canada,but I found it to be quite good............................
Can on the flight from SFO to Hong Kong.  Pale yellow with a foamy white head and lots of rising bubbles.  Bland and unremarkable flavor.
My no. 1 choise between Carlsberg and Tuborg pilsener. A little more taste of hops and a little less sour palate than the Tuborg. Easy to drink and to get. A work-day beer.
Crap!! Brewed in Canada!!! This is not the same beer you get in Europe. Thin, flavorless  garbage.
Full of flavour and easy to drink, bloody ripper............................

I ordered this tonight when I couldn't decide on anything else.  Time for something new, I guess.  I was pleasantly surprised by it.  Good taste with just a small amount of bitterness.  When I'm in the mood, I should be drinking it again.

Kind of your average lager. Light gold color, large head. Light tasting larger style beer. Slightly hoppy, nice mild malt, slightly sweet. Mouthfeel is round. Good Balance. Smooth taste. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is very slightly bitter, some sweetness.

Inititial skunk off the bottle that turns to sweet malt aroma. Pale gold and an OK head. Light malt taste a weak bitter component - almost no hop character at all. Thin-ish body and very quick flavor profile. The little flavor that is there is well balanced, but this is overall very un-impressive.
Skunky, clay-ey, dusty aroma. Sweet and also bitter aroma with a malty finish. Tastes a little bit like a kids experiment with water and clay.

Rerate Revisiting after almost 11 years. Light golden, snow white head. Very skunky aroma. Corny, grainy, cardboard-like flavor. The Danes surely can do better than this! Original 2.9 Slightly skunky aroma - very small head. Surprisingly full body - compare to Heineken - but a notch above in my opinion.
Slght maltaroma. Sweetish, bitter, herbal, grassy flavor. Hint of metal.....
I remember when this beer was brewed in Copenhagen and it was alot better than the Canadian brewed version we now get in the U. S. The flavor is not awful, it just almost non-existent.
A classic here in Denmark but it's nothing special really...................

Goody malty beer with that European bitterness after.  .....................
Skunky and old.  I think that this beer may have been a nice buy when it was fresh, but the age has turned into a green and skunky mess.  Bad carbonation.  Fizzy and thin.  Nasty overall flavor.
Blond with a medium head. There is some hop in the aroma, surprise! A very standard pils, it is ok.
not quite sure if i had a bad bottle or what, but to me this beer defines skunky... somewhat smoky flavor, and not much else really to talk about.
Has an interesting smell, but that's about it.  Imagine stomach acid, add a little fruit flavoring, and you have this beer.
Average at best, thought it seemed a little skunky, bought it because I thought it was a product of Denmark, later noticed it was brewed in Canada
Like most danish pilsners: a taste that does not disturb anybody. Good for thirst.
this was exactly what I expected. Not a very exciting lager, didnt even have that bite that most mid tier lagers have. More a mellow, fruit and hops flavor that sorta faded into the sunset.
Golden color, skunky smell, clean finish....................................
Sweet sugary aroma, yellow, fluffy head. Nice bitter sweet flavour. Crisp and clean. Average, but when I first tried this in 72, it was imported and it was very good.

Pale gold - small artificial looking head.  Light skunkiness and weak hops in aroma.  Skunk is not strong but is still the most dominant flavor.  Very weak malts - barely detectable bitterness levels.  Somewhat sharp and astringent in the finish.

Pale yellow-gold with small vanishing head. Faint grassy hops and soda water aroma. Watery thin body. Bland soft faint bitter and fainter sweet palate with refreshing dry finish. Wait ! - even water is refreshing after spending all day trudging the streets of Paris! Things are getting pretty bad when I'm down to rating bier ordinaire (beers I've avoided rating) in nice French restaurants - maybe I should drink the wine!
(Rated 14/6/2003: Paris France)
(Rated 14/6/2002 Paris France)

This was nasty.  I usually can find some redeeming features in a beer, but this was as bad as I've had a lager.  Aroma was highly artificial, and I could only place the flavor as cold spaghetti bolognese.  Lovely, rich head in its favor, but nothing else.

Little bit of foam, rich yellow hue.  Sweet aroma, minimal bitterness.  Flavor is fairly well balanced, with sweet malts and slightly grassy bitterness, the latter particularly on aftertaste.  Mediocre beer, at best.

At the pub I usually frequent, this is one of the cheapest pints that one can get. This is not a bad thing, as it is better than the more expensive Stella Artois. I used to hate this beer, but have recently grown to love it. Carlsberg has a very distinct taste to it, and when it is served ice cold, can be extremely refreshing. A wonderful lager that should be enjoyed by all.
A big beer in Denmark, maybe one of the best lagers, But I find lagers boring
Not too much head.  Would be better if it were a bit hopsier.  Apparently it's a mass-produced beer, so I'm much impressed with their efforts to conserve quality - unlike some American breweries.

I've had varying experiences with Carlsberg. At its best it is one of the premium lagers with a rather inoffensive character. At its worst its the quintessential macrobrew...watery and skunky...If given other choices I wouldn't opt for this one...
Decent pilsener. Lacks a little in the aftertaste department, but not bad. I'd buy it, but it's not Falstaff, as far as Pilseners go.
Canadian, brown bottle, not skunky. Decent white head, pale golden color, hoppy aroma. Goes down fairly smooth. For a macro brew it's not bad.
I love this stuff, i've had great times drinking. simple lager but man it can knock you out after a fair night o' drinkin'
Typical lager, at least it had somewhat of a sweet distinctive taste.  Maybe a tobacco finish?
A decent lager.  Nice blond color.  Nice malt finish........................
Yellow fizzy adjunct lager. Sweet and bland this is a well below average industrial lager. I have no idea why the canned and bottled version are listed separately.
Same beer as the bottle; just a little above average lager - but the bottle looks nicer. Best on tap in Copenhagen though, at least it feels right when you're there.

I will say it once again, you can't compare different styles of beer.  This beer is mentioned to drink when you are thirsty.  Not to enriche a soul...

It was a gift to find a Carlsberg in difficult circumstances!

Can
Pale golden, heavily carbonated, white foamy head.
Flavorless and boring.
Light and watery.
A bit of a disappointment. I thought since they sponsored Liverpool FC this would be a great brew, but has a terrible taste.

I actually had this on draft, but whatever. The best description I can offer is Budweiser from Denmark. You'd think the Danes would be able to make a better beer, them being descendants of one of the germanic tribes and all.

Only take one if they're free, otherwise there's no reason to buy one.  Appearance garners a 1 for a) green bottle b) screw-off cap c) ugly, artless label.  Thin, clinging tart lager palate, skunky aroma.  Tart, bland lager.
A nice, premium strength lager, with a good aftertaste. Compares very well with other comparable lagers. A nice, satisfying, regularly available lager.

I was expecting the traditional green bottle skunkiness with this one, but to my suprise, this is the most tolerable of the "greens." It actually grew on me, maybe because I had a few dark brews before it I was looking for something crisp and refreshing. Either way, nice brew.

contact brewed by Labatt.
decent enough  mild lager.
as one may expect somewhat inbetween a european lager and north american beer.

Head is initially small, frothy/fizzy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (bread, grain/cereal), lightly hoppy (herbs), with a light note of alcohol. Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter, slightly husky/unclean. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Ok aroma for the style (better malt character than a lot of beers like this), but overall not very enjoyable.
There are better, and there are worse. Not really my cup of tea but the free glass I got for buying this one was pretty cool.
Not a great beer, but servicable.  It has a funny aftertaste................
Decent lager, a bit of flavor here or there. Better than Budweiser, worse then Heineken, serve it to those who like Natural Light and need some sort of 'intro' to real beer.
A classic. One of the best commercial pilsners in the world.................
pretty good...tastes like a lot of the canadian beers.......................

Plastic 50 cl bottle:
Golden colour. Small, fluffy head. Sweet adjunct aroma. Sweet flavour. Unplesant, sourish bitter aftertaste. Awful.
One of the better West European macros I've had. Not skunky despite the bottle. Not really good but drinkable.
Hoppy and skunky aroma, i don't know what it is about Danish lagers, but they all suck. Considering Denmark borders Germany, i can't find an explanation.
this beer wasnt too fucken great. my dickhead mate eddie liked it. dickhead.

Perhaps it was a bad bottle, but this had a wretched taste, with just the alcohol coming through, not the flavor. I could give it another try, but with all the good beers out there, it's hard to justify doing so.
Bottle:  Clear yellow with a thin white head, aroma has grass and grains, thin bodied with ample carbonation, starts and ends lightly bitter.  Much better than the last time I had it.

I'm not gunna talk any of the arse some of these people have, coz basically Export is the greatest lager out there. With an excellent taste that makes other beers the equivilant of piss, it truly deserves to be the King of all beers. The only draw back is severe beer-arse the morning after.

Thin head that quickly dissipated (yes, the glass was properly cleaned).  Slight hop/malt aroma.  Medium bodied, low carbonation, mild hop bitterness, with just a slight skunkiness.  Decent beer.  The bottle I tried was made by Labatt.
Before I knew beer this was one of my favorites, now that I know that there is better out there, its not that good.

I must admit that I had the Malawi brewed version only to compare, and it was sensational. Especially considering the choices...none! (Chibuku doesn't count!)
Very tasty after a hot day of doing nothing in Malawi. Great to sit by a fire with. Even better if you have half a dozen or more with you. Went to the brewery in Blantyre, but they were only running tours in swahili, so we just went straight to the tasting!
What a great 2 hours!
Slightly more malty than it's Tuborg rival, and better to my taste, even if i like hoppy pilsners. But it's in any case a modern style pilsner, with the weaknesses that comes with that style.
Accecptable, but had some skunk action going on. Better than most of the lagers i have had. Much more solid than the average lager.

Hopey nose.
Cloudy gold colour (ice haze?) Head Disaptes quickly...........
This was slightly skunked even in Copenhagen. It still went down like Rolling Rock.

Carlsberg is one of the good lagers among those I’ve tasted.  It’s very tasty with a medium-body mouth feel.  Very nice malty aroma!  Nice aftertaste and just an easy snug beer for every occasion. Common people give this one a change you’re rating it close to the BUD!
I can't really tell why, but all in all this is my favorite lager...........
Not as good as HOF. Proberly NOT the best beer in town......................
decent.but it felt good to piss it out.left a edge in my stomach............
It's a malt-edged nose ahead of Heineken....................................
a great beer that is full of flavor ........................................
